Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel on waterfront - it is effectively what you would expect -”
Reviews.Author: Keith791
Reviews.Content: Stayed there one night when downtown for Canucks game. Lovely setting, awesome room if a little small compared to some i have stayed in. Opposite end of town for stadium but shuttle bus available to take you downtown during the day. Valet parking available. Awesome pool - get changed in room though and use the robes - no real changing area at the pool. Hot tub is "hot" !!!! Overall happy to recommend. ( hotel was used for filming whist we were there - new tv pilot I believe - added somewhat to the visit as there was loads going on ). Enjoy !

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but First Class here”
Reviews.Author: sirdons
Reviews.Content: When staying in Vancouver, this IS the hotel to being staying at, nothing but first class. You will not be disappointed from the time you check in to the time you leave, just so central to everything in walking distance downtown. We had a great room with great views, updated rooms, very clean, pool and hot tub was a treat after a long day of shopping! *S*

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, less than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: silvervexcebo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night in March 2012 and unfortunately it wasn't as nice as I had expected. The carpet in my room was covered in dog hairs (golden retriever by the looks of it)! I am a dog lover, but having blonde hairs all over my suitcase and boots was not what I was expecting. The gym and pool were nice but both very small. Room was rather basic, although the toiletries were nice. Wifi was quite pricey. On the plus side, breakfast was excellent and the bed was very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in good area”
Reviews.Author: Tanya1111
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a few Westins this month as I have been traveling a fair bit. The Bayshore has the standard Westin amenities, however I think it stands out over the others. The property is right down in Coal Harbour, and I enjoyed the view from my room, of the outdoor pool, harbour and Stanley Park. Quite lovely. I have never had 'bad' service at a Westin, but the service here was even better than I am accustomed to. From the concierge, the front desk staff, to the staff in the hallways and room service, I am hard pressed to remember a time I have gotten better service at Any hotel in my travels. The pool and workout facilities were great, and of course the awesome heavenly beds keep me coming back, I find them very comfortable and they make for a good nights sleep. Nice to have the heavenly baths as well, complete with robes. I definitely recommend the Bayshore for vacationers and business travelers alike. I only wish I had known I was able to get a shuttle for free within 5 miles of the hotel, I chose to drive instead and had to pay the over $40 fee for parking, when I could have left my car at my sisters place a few miles away. Live and learn I guess!

Reviews.Title: “Surprised”
Reviews.Author: BillParker
Reviews.Content: I visit Vancouver several times per year on business and have never enjoyed the city as much as I did staying here. The view of the harbor and mountains from my room was spectacular. The balcony door opened and I had fresh air instead of the air/heat system running. The staff was exceptional and friendly. One of my nights I returned very late (about 11:30pm) without having had dinner. The bartender and manager served me a beer at last call along with snacks for dinner. These gentleman along with a waiter stayed and talked hockey for an hour--such a pleasant way to end a day. My wife and I were considering a vacation trip to Vancouver this fall. After staying here I know we will be visiting and I know exactly where to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: sunschein44
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night and two days at a conference. Love this hotel. Service was outstanding, rooms were very comfortable. Location: Perfect right on the water. Great for morning runs/walks or a stroll for dinner Rooms: Bed are heavenly. Love the white tea scent Restaurant: Food is a bit pricey but very good Pub: Fun place for an end of day recap

Reviews.Title: “Standard Westin, Great Views”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay here, although we only spent 1 night. We arrived about 11pm and the girl working the front desk was really friendly. She said she had a great corner room with views of the harbor so we took that. The room was your typical Westin, we had one with 2 double beds as they didn't have one with as good of a view with a single king. There was a little sitting area, a separated entry way and a decent size bathroom. We ordered room service once we got to the room and despite $20 for a pizza, were were impressed with the size and it was pretty good. It arrived quickly, about 20 minutes after ordering. The views from the room were lovely and having the patio door open could allow you to even hear the waves. As far as location, it worked fine for us. We picked up our car in the morning and drove to breakfast, chinatown and Granville island.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE it!”
Reviews.Author: beyoncebeytwice
Reviews.Content: My classmates and I stayed at the Westin Bayshore for the 2012 Vancouver business career expo in March. Our experience was absolutely perfect from the second we arrived. The hotel was able to offer all 14 of us early check in (for 7 different rooms). We were also given complimentary Wi-Fi for our rooms, although I wasn’t sure if the person who had booked our rooms arranged this. Our room was gorgeous and the view of the water was amazing- three of us currently have pictures of the view as our computer desktop photos! The bed was the best I've ever slept in. I had the most amazing sleep of my life, despite the fact that both my roommates were snoring. I actually took the Westin Home collection catalogue (sorry!) and am seriously considering saving up to buy the California king sized bed set. The hotel staff was polite and very friendly, at least three different employees greeted us each time we entered the hotel throughout our 3-day stay. I also lost my key during one of our nights out & the woman at the front desk around 3am was so sweet about it. A classmate also needed some résumés printed out and stated that he sent them to the front desk, went to the bathroom to brush his teeth & when he came out the document had already been slid under the door. Amazing service. The hotel has everything you could want: a Starbucks, an ATM, valet parking, a great gym, two pools & a sick hot tub. Our rooms were located in the tower and I thought the décor and furnishings were very modern, the only area that looked a little older was the hallway on our room’s floor. Not an issue at all though, the hotel, service & bed was amazing & I can’t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not quite outstanding”
Reviews.Author: LifeAsIz
Reviews.Content: Overall, our stay was very nice. The staff was pleasant and the views were great. It's a stone's throw from Stanley Park. Now, some things that I wish could have been different ... I wasn't a big fan of the closet being in the bathroom. While I can see that might be necessary considering the lack of real estate in the room, it was a little inconvenient to have to wait to go into the closet because someone was using the facilities. Water closet and clothes closet shouldn't mix. Rooms were a tad small. Not a deal breaker but it should be noted. Something else I wasn't keen on - the internet charges. While I was prepared to pay the $14.99/day charge, it was a bummer that I had to pay that for each computer or internet device I had. It was mostly a pleasure trip but there was some business thrown in. Because of this, I had a couple internet devices. Because I thought $30/day for internet was a tad much, I got around it by going down to the lobby or lounge area for free wi-fi. Cheaper yes but not convenient.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katherine B
Reviews.Content: I wish they were selling appartments!! I am in love with the Bayshore! The view, the location, the nice staff! I always stayed here on business and after a long stressful day, to be able to slide open the wall to sit and enjoy the sunshine was fabulous!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location , Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Danify
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Bayshore for about the 40th time over the last few years. Every time we pull up to this oldie but goodie I relax. Its in such an amazing little corner of our country. The views are simply fantastic. Service is good ,rooms are a 7/10 as they are small and a little dull but the views make up for it. Good pool ,good gym. They keep upgrading everything. The walk around Stanley park is divine. 10k of Beauty. Go check out this corner of Canada.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Westin Properties”
Reviews.Author: roxygirl100
Reviews.Content: I travel extensively on business and between the Westin Ottawa and the Westin Bayshore - the two are my favorite. Upsides: - ambience, decor, modern, subtle, very pleasant from the moment you walk in -location right on the harbour, with a view to Stanley Park - very restful - food is excellent at the breakfast area and also the bar restaurant -Starbucks right on site -staffing very pleasant and helpful -stayed with the family in the summertime - pool was terrific -fitness center very well equipped -many conventions here and yet it is quiet - they don't appear to let alot of partying going on -walk up the street and lots of places to eat - either on Denman - (Ukrainian Village, Mexican Restaurant - and many other low key neighbourhood hangouts) or head up to Robson - and there will be many more restaurants and bards Downsides: - if you need to be very central, this is about 5 min from downtown - walking - have had a few IT issues here - and although they have been helpful - there have been difficulties in resolving

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: Joe_petr
Reviews.Content: great location close to stanley park. Right on the water minutes from all the action down town rooms were nice. Dont try to party in the room lol we had a bachelor party in a suite it got shut down pretty quick great for business love coal harbour area lived in the area for years lots of places to eat robson street is a 8 min walk away. i recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice, Great City”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaTalkinghead
Reviews.Content: You can never go wrong by picking the Westin Bayshore in Vancover. The hotel is located on the water and offers plenty of options when it comes to food and entertainment. The rooms are of decent size, with high speed internet (for a daily fee), many of them facing the bay. Directly behind the hotel is a walkway for jogging, walking and biking. It's also a five minute walk to Stanley Park (a must see). Adjacent to the property is Carderos Restaurant. Their menu is diverse and delicious. Try the salmon burger for lunch. Up the street three blocks is Robson Street, one of the main entertainment zones in Vancouver. Other parts of the city are a 10 minute cab ride, including Rogers Arena. The hotel also features a small shopping arcade that includes a couple of specialty shops, a sundries shop and a Starbucks. There is also an indoor pool, workout facility and indoor hot tub in addition to an outdoor pool. Of course, food prices on the hotel property are at their typically inflated levels. As a lunch option, if you like sushi, walk up to Robson Street and try Miko Sushi. It's world class and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for business and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: 154943Peter
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin from March 12 - 15, 2012 and had during my stay 9 meetings with prospecting students for our Hotel Management Schools. This Hotel is ideal for meetings, big Lobby and lots of niches on the ground floor where you can talk undisturbed. There is also Starbucks and a bar (Seawall) to meet. The location is beautiful with a view on Stanley Park and the Harbor. The rooms are well equipped, Internet access good but you have to pay for it. I like the option for self parking. Swimming pool and Fitness Centre are nice. I recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: MicheleKath
Reviews.Content: Every staff member at the Westin Bayshore is super nice. All of them; bell boys, reception, maids, managers. Michael and Mathew also treated us like loyalty. I am very picky at hotels/resorts and I give this one A + and a half! Super clean and gorgeous all though from reception to the deluxe rooms to the awesome gym and pool. Nice and quiet in the rooms, never heard a thing. I'll post some pics. :) Thank you Westin, you'll hear from me soon to book again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot near Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: SimpleKraft
Reviews.Content: We got this room on Priceline for less $100. Upgraded for a bay view for a few dollars more. This spot was ideal for our overnighter. Walked to Stanley Park, Downtown and Granville Island. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “nice view, good location”
Reviews.Author: wck112
Reviews.Content: stayed over on a Febuary sunday night so the hotel was empty. the room was clean, and the harbor view was very nice. i've always love the westin heavely bed..no exception to this hotel, although the flat sheet felt a little big rough. I used the indoor pool and hot tub. there were no one around so I had them all to myself, which was very enjoyable. all the staff were friendly. location was excellent, you can just walk down few blocks to restaruants and shops. overal a good stay, although the room was a little bit pricy for this time of the year. could have easily gotten a 5 stars hotel in the area online. also, it really sucks when they charge so much for wifi. I couldn't find free wifi in the lobby either so it was very inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Bayshore, still awesome after all these years”
Reviews.Author: Vancouverraised
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in 1973 Dec 31, then again 1996 the just recently March 3rd 2012, Love this place, two renovations since my last stay and very upscale, great room and for $ 250 US, TOWER 14TH FLOOR WITH THE USUAL AWESOME HARBOUR VIEW. Will return for a couple of nights sometime this year, Great restaurant Cardero's next door, great prices, great food and ATMOSPHERE WOW ! A NEW and instant Favourite only drawback, parking $36 for the stay one day. was free in 1973 and 1996.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: TerTrav
Reviews.Content: first night ended up with a noisy room (watch out if you're close to the convention end and there's late-night dance party competition style events) But the hotel staff made it up to us and relocated us to a quieter much nicer room for the rest of our stay - gorgeous views of Coal Harbour Note: Unfortunately the new spa took out the change rooms or locker rooms at the swimming pool/exercise center so you have to hike through the hotel in a robe and dripping swimsuit. Wi-Fi in the lobby is only available in one hour increments - seems a little chintzy - you can always go to the on-site Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent views, Comfortable beds in a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: FitMom68
Reviews.Content: We booked this room last minute to enjoy an evening Downtown Vancouver. This hotel is going to be made our home away from home which is only an hour away. Comfortable beds, clean rooms, beautiful views and A+ staff. The only negative is the parking is very expensive, but that goes without say anywhere down town. My thoughts are that all hotels should provide courtesy WiFi and parking for guests or even give it at cheaper rate then the going which was $36.95 per night. Carderos Restaurant is hop skip jump away and has an amazing menu. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant and also give it an A+ I look forward to staying here again in the summer when I can enjoy their beautiful outdoor pool.

Reviews.Title: “Gone downhill - Terrible. Never staying here again!”
Reviews.Author: Travell2012
Reviews.Content: I'm a starwood preferred gold member, have stayed here several times years ago, and travelled for work for many years. As such, I've been in my fair share of hotels. This was the worst hotel experience I've had for many reasons. Leaving me exhausted, disappointed, and 100% decided upon switching to Marriott going forward. As a previous reviewer states, there was an unannounced all night, large salsa dance group who made Tons of noise. This was a Sunday night, and I have a to. Of meetings. So all I wanted was a good quite room to sleep in with a comfortable bed. What did i experience? The rooms are outdated, completely lacking in soundproofing , and the beds are far from Heavenly at this Westin. The service (as im finding at all mon-W starwoods these days is terrible from the frontline staff. The bellman provide excellent service, but the rest of the staff acted like they were being inconvenienced, even though requests are simple and fair. I got to my "deluxe" room to find a teerrible, completely sagging bed. It was killing my back so i asked to move at 9pm, The person who amswered tokld me to use a back board, said every bed was the same and refused to forward my call to the front desk. I mentioned that the beds can be quite different and asked again for front desk. I was moves o a new room. There was so much noise in the halls and between the walls from the partying dance groups that i asked for another room at 1:45am, and ended up back in my original room. They showed me another room at 1:45am but the heat was broken and it was sweltering.... Thus back to original. By then i was wired, and couldnt sleep. I booked the Loden at 5:00am and got out of there as fast as i could. Do not book this hotel. It's a relic, and "heavenly" is a complete misnomer to describe it. Choose the loden down the street. Best $199 you'll ever spend. To finalize, the only reason I chose the Westin was to use the 20,000 points I had burning a whole in my account. Bye Starwood. Good riddance!

Reviews.Title: “Sleezy moves to con us into booking”
Reviews.Author: Kephilpo
Reviews.Content: It's currently 1am. I have stayed here before and have had pleasant stays. Came here for a conference this week and assumed this would be the easiest to stay at. Although the rooms are adequate, no one let me know there was going to be dance, that was going until 4 in the morning, I have a flight and need to wake up at 4. I have worked in hotels before, and you always let your guest know before hand and always always block rooms separately from party people and regular sleeping people. I called the front desk and after waiting silently on the phone for what seemed like 5 minutes, she told me she would tell the people to turn down the music. Does she think I'm stupid? That's not happening. I would have gladly moved hotels to ensure a good sleep for a full day of travelling. I do not feel as though my business is appreciated. Will definately consider never staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Awesome”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 Nights on business. As a Platinum member was upgraded to one of the best rooms I have ever had. The Howard Hughes Suite has spectacular views from TWO balconies on the top floor,corner. I didn't want to leave! Also enjoyed the spa, I think it was Igor, one of the best massages ever. Front desk and bellman friendly and helpful. Reasonable cost to receive packages, JP most helpful. Hotel is in easy walking distance to Robson St where there is a Safeway and beer/wine store. Right next to Stanley Park for walking. Went to lounge Sunday night, says open till 11:00, got there at about 9:45, and a rather unfriendly bartender told me it was last call. That was fine as the beer was $8.50! The only other negative is the parking charges, $36 per day, self park, much too excessive. But the views, oh, the views!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for a tourist but I would not reccomend to a business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Ythis123
Reviews.Content: Not a bad hotel. Nice lobby and solid service. Looks like a good conference facility and rooms are fairly good. Hallways leading to rooms look a little "dated". The worst thing about this hotel is the attached restraunt and bar the seawall. Poor food for the price and average atmosphere. If you are a tourist you would t eat here as you should be out sampling. Vancouvers excellant selection of restraunts. As a tired business traveller I ate here and wished I hadn't. I tried to go to Caderma across the street but couldnt get in. One other thing this hotel could use is a lobby bar.

Reviews.Title: “great location and views”
Reviews.Author: travelbugberni
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel on priceline.com for $85! Reception was wonderfully friendly and checkin was very efficient. It is a grand entrance once you come into the hotel. The location cant be beat as this is located by the water. Stanley Park is within walking distance and the marina seawall walk is beautiful and a walk into the city centre. The view is awesome - the mountains in the distance, the sea, the marina nearby, the floatplanes, etc. The room was a little bit smaller than we anticipated but it was comfortable and cosy. Starbucks coffee is provided. And there is a rainshower in the bathroom! We only stayed one night but would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas away from home”
Reviews.Author: PhotosbyPharos
Reviews.Content: With our children away with their "other families" this year, we're staying in downtown Vancouver because we hate an empty house at Christmas. We had a suite, thanks to Star Points, which gave us a huge living room-dining room combo, that overlooked the busy Vancouver harbour through many windows. It also a had a small bar kitchen with a sink and small fridge, but no cutlery or china. A quick call to room service solved that problem in less than ten minutes. Of course, we had a king-sized Heavenly Bed and two bathrooms, one for the bedroom and one for the hospitality suite. We entertained on Christmas Eve using room service and ate Christmas lunch in the restaurant. The latter was excellent. However, they would not open the bottle of wine we brought with us (odd, as the other Westin in Vancouver is happy to do this). The wine list was limited and not what we wanted to complement our meal. On our last morning we enjoyed brunch, which has never disappointed us. All in all, a very acceptable way to spend a relaxing Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “the beds are heavanly”
Reviews.Author: disco-dale
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a vancouver great, right down on the harbour front and right beside stanley park and on the waterfront walkway so if you want a nice long walk with a view this is the place to stay for sure.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: threecharm
Reviews.Content: we picked this hotel after spending time in Whistlerfor Christmas and before heading back to Seattle for New Years. We booked it based on location and room size. We have three kids and the boys slept on pull out couch in the family room area and there was a seperate room with a king. Bathroom is good size with shower and bathtub. Balcony looks out toward the other towers and water. Rooms are very clean. Only downside was towels were not replenished more than two after the first night of having four. You can hear and see the sea planesas well as see the boats in the marina. Stanly park is right next door! You can walk to resturants and along the waterfront- it is in a condo type area so you have little conviences such as dry cleaners- drug store cafes. Hotel has a starbucks if things get desperate!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for much better!”
Reviews.Author: Corey Q
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Westin Bayshore was awesome, starting with the moment I checked in. My flight arrived early, and we got to the hotel at 9:00am. We were just going to leave our luggage at the desk and check in later, but we asked at the desk and they had rooms already cleaned and ready for us, so we could check in right away. We were even upgraded to the tower, which has great views of the city! The beds were among the best I've ever slept in.. I just sunk into it and slept very well (despite being under the weather). Honestly, I couldn't ask for much in the way of improvements. There isn't a SkyTrain stop nearby, but that's a small issue compared to the overall excellence of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Les D
Reviews.Content: The location of this property is fantastic, the views of the mountains, Stanley Park, the harbor and city lights at night make you feel like you want to live forever. Right in the heart of the city, near shopping, food and adventure!!!! Open the large doors in your room and take a long breath of the clean air as you look at the harbor and the many ships and boats floating past you, no smog here!!! If you like to run or walk this is the place to do it. This property has a outdoor and inside pool, with a very good work out area. Will stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: civilizedtravel
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to Vancouver for business for over two years now and have tried many different hotels in the city. The Westin Bayshore quickly became one of my favorites thanks to its incredible location and incredible service. So let's start with service. The staff at the Westin Bayshore are some of the friendliest and most helpful that I've ever encountered. From restaurant recommendations to the top jogging trails these guys can help you with just about anything. The hotel itself is in an amazing location right on the harbor with easy access to Stanley Park and the city. The rooms are well appointed and many have absolutely breathtaking views. I am also a huge fan of the restaurant Carderos which is a one minute walk from the front of the hotel. A great fit for business or vacation travel I would highly recommend this hotel next time you stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Coal Harbour and Stanley Park at your doorstep”
Reviews.Author: Orcas_Island_Steve
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bayshore was our favorite hotel in the world in the late 70's, when we and it were youthful. We revisited it this weekend for our 35th anniversary, and had a fine stay...lovely harbour view room with great bed, warm and caring staff, and a short walk to the beauties of Stanley Park (including the enticing Teahouse restaurants). As other have noted, the hotel facilities are showing their age...not old enough to be venerable but no longer chic. Westin needs to either refurbish/modernize, which will be an expensive proposition, or recognize the limitation in their pricing. We enjoyed wi-fi access in our room for $10/day, which is reasonable, but not reasonable was the fact that it applies to individual computers--so you pay for your laptop, iPad, and iPhone separately...beware. Enjoyed afternoon tea and a lunch at the Seawall Bar & Grill, and thought the service and food quality to be excellent...also liked watching the seaplanes flying in over the marina to land nearby. If you arrive into Vancouver via plane or train, and take the Skytrain system into town, the hotel is an easy walk from the Burrard Station, a bit longer from the Waterfront Station, but the pedestrian route adjoins the harbour. Very handy Starbucks in the lobby...better choice for breakfast than the expensive buffet, which is served in served in an unattractive, out-dated area along the hallway to the tower addition.

Reviews.Title: “Good for business, not so much for pleasure”
Reviews.Author: JimCF
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at Westin Bayshore. We are often in Vancouver, and this time we decided to try the Westin, even though it's not in our preferred part of town. It is pretty close to Stanley Park, which helped. Things got off to a rocky start, since the hotel advertised that their rooms had combination bath + shower, but it turned out that was not the case. We later complained about this once we'd returned home, and after a followup call, they took care of the issue for us. While the rooms were comfortable and clean, we really felt that a lot of aspects of the room were both overpriced: parking was $36/day, local calls were $1.50, and wi-fi cost a whopping $15 per day. If you're on business and you don't care about these things (and your company doesn't either), that's one thing, but otherwise it's tough to swallow.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for tourists, particularly as it offers one hour free internet in the lobby.”
Reviews.Author: MaxsSunshineTour
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Bayshore about ten times over the last few years as we visit Vancouver regularly and use Priceline four star hotels. We have stayed there over christmas and again in February. It is close to downtown and really is the only hotel to have really fantastic views of the harbour, Stanley Park and the mountains. The hotel boasts Westin "heavenly beds and the service is absolutely four star every time we stay there. On our previous stays we were always frustrated that the internet was extremely expensive whilst several other priceline or travelocity secret four star hotels in downtown Vancouver offered free internet to their guests. This has now been resolved and the hotel now issues free one hour coupons to their guests to use in the lobby. Well done Westin for listening to feedback from their guests! The hotel has a nice bar, restaurant and two swimming pools. It really is a delight to stay there but it is not yet our favourite hotel downtown. When you first enter the hotel there is a huge mostly empty lobby that has very little ambiance. We really think that the hotel is missing a trick by not using this space to create a more welcoming public area. We regularly use the Seattle Westin that has a similar public area but has much better seating and ambiance. It is a shame that guests to Vancouver don't benefit from a similar design and I am sure that the Bayshore miss out on revenue by creating a better space where their guests can relax. We never stay and eat breakfast at this hotel because it is ludicrously expensive compared with most other four star hotels. The problem is that the pricing structure reflects expense account guests and not the average leisure traveller. Our only other criticism of the hotel is that the televisions in the room all have had very poor signals unless you are watching a paid for HD movie. When we have raised this with the hotel they will generally send an engineer to the room to fiddle with the wires behind the tv but it is about time they got it right. When we stayed at Christmas we were offered a free HD movie by the front desk because their engineer could do anything about it. All in all this is a great choice for a trip to Vancouver, providing you don't plan on feeding your family in their restaurant or sitting in your hotel room watching the television. We were very pleased to see that our next trip to Vancouver in April will also include a Priceline trip to the Bayshore.

Reviews.Title: “Might have to come again”
Reviews.Author: welshdragonCalgary
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend decided to go to Vancouver for the weekend of feb 4, As we only decided that evening we stayed up and waited for our flight at 7am. And before boarding I booked through Expedia and got a price of 125/night and so booked here. Arrived at the hotel around 8 and was in need of some sleep, asked if we could do an early check in and they very kindly said they could accommodate us. Stayed in a traditional deluxe room 507 and was not disappointed although not the view of the whole harbour but still had a great view of the water and mountains still worth the price Beds were great. Shower was well needed. Sadly had to leave 7pm as I was needed back home in calgary. So this weekend I have decided to return at this hotel as I was so impressed. This time im staying for the whole weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, clean, beautiful rooms, awesome location”
Reviews.Author: sajopik
Reviews.Content: We were surprised to this contemporary room with beautiful bathroom and very comfortable bed. We stayed on one of the top floors in the tower. Beautiful view of the bay. Within walking distance from Stanley park and nice bars and cafes.

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieDenver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were celebrating my birthday and we stayed at this hotel one night at the end of December. It is centrally located, the rooms are well-appointed and the hotel has beautiful views. The woman who checked us in, Jenifer knight, was kind enough to upgrade our room and send a nice note and fruit up for my birthday. We will definitely stay at the Westin anytime we are back in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and Nice”
Reviews.Author: SaskatoonAccountant
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Staff are great - the cleaner I seen everyday was especially friendly. Internet was expensive and in all the travel I've had this was the first I had to pay for internet - but apparently that is acceptable and reasonable for Vancouver. Awesome beds, sheets, pillows, etc. In-room Starbucks coffee was not very good, but there is a full Starbucks coffee shop in house that was nice to have. All the food and drink is extremely expensive - $28/person for breakfast. Most, if not all, rooms have a small balcony to step out on. Thermostat in my room did not appear to work until the last few days of my trip. The first 4 days it would only go as high as 19.5 C.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views and Spa”
Reviews.Author: Amy J
Reviews.Content: Great view of the water and the sea planes coming in over the water. Room was spacious and very clean. The spa had great ambiance and the masseurs were excellent. There was not a great lounge area to grab a cocktail and relax but plenty of nearby spots within a short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Business Get Away”
Reviews.Author: Sakura26
Reviews.Content: I usually stay right in the heart of the city when I am in Vancouver. I went back to the Westin Bayshore after many years and was very pleased that I did. It is about a 15 minute walk along the harbour shore to the downtown core - a very pleasant and manageable walk. the hotel has been renovated and has an elegant feeling to it. My room was in the Tower overlooking the harbour: typical Westin amenities and as usual the bed was "heavenly". I was only there for two nights but certainly will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ParisAugust2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great location - next to Stanley Park (very walkable) and Coal Harbour. The walk along the waterfront is great. Rooms are nice -- its an older hotel, but has been substantially updated. Reception staff are wonderful. Relatively quiet (parties are held here on weekends, and for some reason our 8th floor room let in sound of them periodically). Room service very $$$ (like any other hotel) -- but again, great service.

Reviews.Title: “looking forward to another stay”
Reviews.Author: JForster150793
Reviews.Content: we love the Bayshore it is close to downtown..yet views of the harbour. When in Vancouver most people want to: stay by the ocean, walk to Stanley Park, enjoy the mountains...this location serves your purpose...typical Westin style and great beds...we always stay here even though we only live 4 hours away...a quick walk over to Cardero's is a must

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Canukgurl
Reviews.Content: First time at the Bayshore and it was great. Reception staff was some of the friendliest I have ever come across. Big, clean rooms. Great views of Coal Harbour. Fantastic walks along the sea wall and only a short jaunt to the heart of downtown. Will stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely if you are looking for a relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: BoywonderTo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Bayshore for a weekend back in September (just never got around to write the review) and had an excellent stay. I got this hotel as a bid on priceline. Initially I was somewhat disappointed and anxious as the hotel was quite out of the way. I was won over by the great experience. So let’s address the location first. If you are looking to be right in the middle of action (shopping/bars/business district), the Bayshore is indeed a bit out of the way. But it is only a short cab ride from all those things, and is a block north of Georgia Street which is serviced by fairly frequent bus service toward the downtown core. The location however is also one of its strength. It is located in Coal Harbour, where Vancouver’s most expensive condos are found. It is also right at the marina and is next to Stanley Park. It takes about a lovely 15-minute walk on Denman down to the English Bay beach. The room I got overlooked the Marina and the hotel pool, which was a very pleasant view in late summer/early fall. The room was very spacious, well decorated, and the bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was modern and well designed. Since it was September, it was still warm enough to take advantage of the large outdoor poor (if swim the diameter of the circular pool, you are swimming about the distance of a 16.6 m lap). The Staff I interacted with were friendly and helpful. The Starbucks voucher for not changing sheets daily, while of small value, was a concrete steps to encourage clients to be more green during their stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel overlooks the Waterfront near Stanley Bay”
Reviews.Author: kiwisolargal
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night Jan 3rd. Large spacious rooms interconnecting was brillant for us. Large comfy king size bed and two queen size beds in other room. Spacious bathrooms one with shower the had bath with shower over it. Lovely big corner room with views towards the outdoor pool, Stanley Bay and then Waterfront. We loved watching the float planes fly past and land in the harbour. Friendly helpful Reception staff and Bell Boys the Valet guys were also really friendly. Didn't ever find anyone on the Concierge desk but Reception answered all our questions and helped us out. Easy walk to town although would take you 15 minutes along the Waterfront or meander down through the streets. Indoor Spa/Hot tub hotel pool indoor and outdoor, good gym. Like all hotels now there is quite a substantial fee to park overnight so we drove two minutes along from the hotel and used a public carpark more than did the trick for half the cost. Good hotel restaurants, Starbucks but also handy to other restaurants worth a look. We wandered down to White Spot Cafe in Denman Street lovely breakfast and just opposite Safeway.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly stay @ the westin bayshore”
Reviews.Author: Tak57
Reviews.Content: We stayed here only one night. Well, every time we go to van city, we stay here because of the heavenly bed and the staff. Again this time, front desk agents were so friendly and personal while checking us in at late night.And also very informative about their property and the city. We had relaxing stay and was comfortable. We don't even consider staying at other hotels in van city. We will come back here for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Another successful stay at Westin Bayshore”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night, at a convention being held at the hotel. While the hallways to the rooms are dark and seem dated, the rooms are great. Beautiful bathrooms, good size bedroom with all the amenities (GREAT beds), and an amazing view of Vancouver and the water. Friendly front desk staff. Overall, another relaxing and successful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great view over quiet Coal Harbour”
Reviews.Author: jmacleantaylor
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Westin Bayshore were uniformly polite, helpful and warm. The room, though relatively small, was spotlessly clean and had a lovely, large bathroom with great rainfall shower. The fourth floor room had a lovely view of Coal Harbour, North Vancouver and nearby mountains. The hotel is less than 15 minutes walk from the SkyTrain station and there's also a bus that runs to a nearby intersection. Moments from Stanley Park, the hotel is also only two blocks from busy Robson Street, but just far enough outside the busy centre to create a more quiet and calm atmosphere. The only criticism I have of the hotel is the corridors. While the rooms are lovely, the corridors feel dingy. There's a Starbucks right in the hotel! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Short business trip turned into feeling like royalty; And I'm not even related to Wil and Kate”
Reviews.Author: Bonnieloves2travel
Reviews.Content: The staff were extremely accommodating, friendly, offered to show 2 rooms to decide. While viewing one they msg'd our escort, to say there was a 3rd suite to view. The room we chose to stay in was perfect, super clean. We really felt like royalty!! Every staff mbr we encountered was so friendly and helpful. I took my mother & husband along with me on the trip the Westin's treatment made this feel like a holiday, not a business trip. Would definitely return to this hotel, even though I like to stay at a different place each time I return to a destination I've visited in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable View!”
Reviews.Author: Hawleydaze
Reviews.Content: Just open the curtains wide and there is Stanley Park, the North Shore Mountains, marinas, Vancouver rowing club, and sea planes taking off and landing. The location is Fabulous! The room had two double beds that were closer to queen size. Very, very comfortable, clean, and quiet.Fridge and coffee maker included. Large bathroom. Newspaper delivered to the door. Older building but totally renovated. Close to all kinds of restaurants, shopping and of course the seawall for walking. Wide open lobby and very courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravellers2008
Reviews.Content: Stay here 1-2 times per year - my first choice when in Vancouver! Edge of dowtown, all the rooms have awesome views, right by Stanley Park and the seawall. Hotel has great food, fitness centre, pool. You will enjoy bigtime!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel on edge of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: jkavery
Reviews.Content: This was a nice Westin Hotel on the edge of Downtown next to Stanley Park. Nice views of harbor and mountains from room. I was able to watch sea planes take off and land right outside our window. Only down side for me was location is a few blocks from downtown action on Robson, Granville etc. Has an indoor pool for colder weather and an outdoor pool for summer weather.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience”
Reviews.Author: hamofseattle
Reviews.Content: We just spent two nights at the Westin Bayshore (Dec. 27-29). We enjoyed the hotel but we were placed on the fourth floor overlooking the pool in a old part of the hotel with very small rooms. Our family of four was super cramped in a room with two beds and no real additional seating except for a divan crammed between one of the beds and the window. We got a great deal on Priceline so I think they placed us in one of the poorer quality rooms. Seriously it was too small and with a narrow bathroom. I stayed in this hotel several years ago (by myself) and the room was much larger and more comfortable. The staff was great in our brief interactions. We were not told about parking options like the other commenter so we were stuck paying high valet prices. Self park sounds like a better way to go. The pool is wonderful for the kids. It is large enough and in a bright room. This was one of the highlights of our trip. Can't beat the location too since it is close to Stanley Park. All in all a nice experience. I am only giving three stars because our room was not great at all and I think we could have done much better elsewhere. Also the parking is expensive and would have liked to have been advised about self park. I did ask about parking options when I checked in and was just told about valet. One other tip-people were getting free WIFI codes at Starbucks with $5 purchase. That seemed to be a big hit since everyone was asking baristas about WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Good”
Reviews.Author: chrisparkcarpentry
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Westin Bayshore in the last year and we won't hesitate to book again. The location of this Westin is perfect for parking your car and walking to Stanley Park, downtown, and the Seawall. Ideal for taking your kids to see the boats, float planes, and beaches. Lots of greenspace outside the hotel and a couple of pools on site. If you are looking for a decent grocery store store, you can walk 5 minutes east to the Urban Fare. There is a pretty nice cafe style restaurant inside the store as well. I'm sure hotel staff will point you in the right direction. Our stays have all been during "off-season" so the rate has been great value for such a nice hotel. Staff have always been very good, as well. One thing to note is that up till recently you could find cheaper, sometimes even free, parking within a few blocks. The free spots are now metered. Parking at the hotel was $36 for one night which I think is too much for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location, superb service”
Reviews.Author: TheBardakist
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel online through priceline when our whistler vacation got longer due to great SKI conditions. It has a great location, walking distance from stanly park (where our kids wanted to go to see the baluga whale which we did) and from downtown. We enjoyed their heated pool and where surprised that the breakfast was not only tasty but free for kids. The concierge and valet peopel where all friendly and gave us tips about the city (like where to park for free and where to eat and buy stuff). I guess we like the hotel so much that we left some of our stuff there (accidently), when we found that out, we emailed the hotel and indeed they found and mailed our things back to our home in wa.

Reviews.Title: “Room Not Ready”
Reviews.Author: Kathy M
Reviews.Content: We were attending a conference at this hotel that started at 11:00 AM on a Saturday. Our room was not ready to check into until 4:30 PM and our luggage was not delivered until 5:00 PM. There was a dinner associated with the conference at 6:00 - we felt that our room and luggage should have been available to us sooner, especially in a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “The Concierge Desk”
Reviews.Author: ncmaui
Reviews.Content: Horton at the concierge desk was exceptional! He was so helpful in booking our tours and went above and beyond to help us in the following situation: I had left an important baby bag on the day of our departure and did not realize it till I arrived home. I called to the Westin and Horton was able to locate the bag for me, which was actually in the taxi we took to the airport and had it shipped directly to me. The hotel and staff are amazing and we will definitely be back. Thank you, Horton!

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: tonyj01
Reviews.Content: Echo other's thoughts re location, we enjoyed the Bayshore, and the local neighbourhood, including small shops and pleasant restaurants was homely too. An easy walk or plenty of public transport to the downtown areas, combined with stunning views of the seafront, marina and distant snow covered mountains. We enjoyed our stay in Vancouver, two nights whilst touring this part of the West Coast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, beautiful room...”
Reviews.Author: brenda054
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel with two of my daughters while they attended a dance conference held at the hotel. Our room was very nice and the view was incredible. I spent a lot of time in my room as I had brought work with me and I needed to remain in the hotel to be accessible to my daughters during their breaks in the conference. I totally enjoyed sitting at the working desk overlooking the ocean and watching the seagulls soar round my window. Also enjoyed watching the huge yachts sail in and out of the harbour in front of the hotel. The area is great for taking ocean side walks and there are super restaurants in walking distance. The hotel has a shuttle that takes you downtown in minutes and it runs every half hour so very convenient. The hotel pool is large and the exercise room is well equipped. I recommend this hotel for anyone - whether for work or fun.

Reviews.Title: “Good Locaton”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin M
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one evening. Found it to be good. Rooms are good and comfortable. Close to Stanley Park and Denman St. where a lot or restaurants are located. Its quiet and peaceful. Perfect place to spend a night.

Reviews.Title: “Highly overrated... Disgusting rooms.”
Reviews.Author: vancouverites211
Reviews.Content: Worst experience ever. First they put us in a handicapp room with nasty and forty grey tiled floor, then we requested a room change with a tub and they put my husband and i in a room with two double beds and a tiny bathtub, smaller than our small apartment bathtub! This place is WAY overrated, the decor is cheap and the finishes are very poor quality. Will NEVER stay here again... It basically ruined our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place - amazing people”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi P
Reviews.Content: I was there Dec1-4. The front desk people were very nice and knowledgeable. No problems at all checking in. The last day my plane was not until 9pm so I called them to ask what time check out was and they said noon. They then called me back and said how about 2pm if it works better for me and that it was free of charge. I was also informed that they would be able to hold onto my luggage at the conceriage downstairs until I was ready to leave. It was amazing service. When I dropped off the luggage, the person there was a little mean in that he grabbed the luggage and seem unhappy to even do it because we had about 6 luggages but maybe he was just having a bad day? I didn't want the one guy to ruin my feelings towards this hotel but it did bring it down a little as it was my last day. As for the conveience, if you don't mind the 15 min walk to Robson or Granville, its a great place. I didn't want to be right on Robson like the Sutton and just loved the view so chose this place. It may not be for you, if you are not use to walking though.

Reviews.Title: “Vancouver the Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Smalldeluxe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, overlooking Coal Harbour and Stanley Park is just steps away. Robson street is close by and the walk is wonderful. This is a clean hotel, well maintained. Staff are helpful. We usually stay in the tower, this was our third visit. The rooms are a good size and comfortable. The lounge at Stonewalls has a great atmosphere and the food on the restaurant side is good and the view - second to none. We have always had good experience at this hotel, however this time there were a few items that changed my opinion. We booked a king room in advance and when we arrived we were told that there was only a double room available for us and that the hotel was full. Internet - Very disappointing. This is a world class hotel and they expect guests to pay for access to wifi..... On top of that - only one person can use the login code at any given time. With free wifi in so many places this will impact my decision when choosing a hotel in Vancouver again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: MarciaAK
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bayshore is everything you expect from a Westin. Lovely location, well decorated, extremely comfortable beds, nice array of bath supplies (including conditioner) and a spectacular view. It also has other aspects that one would expect, a fee for internet, expensive dining and a spa. But if you accept these components in upscale lodging, you will likely love the experience. The Bayshore is right on the harbor and next to Stanley park. The hotel even offers a map for those who want to run the trails. I was there during a blustery storm and a conference. So I mostly attended conference sessions and stayed indoors (not my usual MO) The conference facilities were gorgeous. Comfortable seating, well designed and laid out breakout rooms, good temperature and delicious food. Next time, I would love to go in the summer and enjoy the outdoor pool and park.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and relax”
Reviews.Author: Wandae2
Reviews.Content: This is one of the most beautiful hotels I've stayed in. The staff are super helpful, the accommodations are great. The view is spectatular. It is within walking distance from the convention centre and the walk along the waterside is so beautiful. The hotel hosts a spa, fine dining and relaxation. I would stay there again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay with vast spacious public areas.”
Reviews.Author: Often_Traveling_Jack
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel just after Westin Grand in the City Center. Experience is pretty much as good as in Grand. Tower rooms with views overlooking bay are exceptional. One thing worth to keep in mind is that seaplanes are landing on the bay every few minutes, so there's some noise when windows are open, not disturbing but noticeable. Deluxe room was very nice and spacious, however 32" TV looked a bit small (in comparison to 42" in Deluxe room at Westin Grand) For coffee junkies there's even Starbucks inside the hotel! Breakfast was nice, with few day to day variations in continental menu. Staff was always nice and helpful. In room dining was also OK, however with a limited options after 11PM (again in comparison to Westin Grand special late night dining menu). White Tea cosmetics in the bathroom have a very very nice scent. I'm not sure what kind of bed was in my room but it was very big and comfortable (I'm 6'6" tall)

Reviews.Title: “Great property in great location beware of extras”
Reviews.Author: Shaunr52
Reviews.Content: Large well appointed rooms. Hotel is located in the scenic coal harbor area and provides a level of service that is expected from a Westin property. The only real downside is this property charges for things that most hotels include-local and toll free phone calls, Internet. Additionally the $34 per night parking fee while not out of the norm for downtown Vancouver is another added expense to consider. The fitness and pool areas are excellent and well equipped. Onsite dining is very good. The immediate area has a good selection of cafes And Cardero's is a good dining option. All in all a premium property at a premium price.

Reviews.Title: “Walkable to cruises”
Reviews.Author: 1travelerof6
Reviews.Content: Appreciated this spacious and clean hotel. Walkable to convention center and cruise port. Friendly staff. Didnt eat a meal here but enjoyed the convenience of this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great View”
Reviews.Author: reillyran
Reviews.Content: I love this location. It's tucked off to the side, but easy to find if you're driving. The views are gorgeous. The staff is great. The rooms are spacious, we even had a little deck area. Starbucks is right downstairs and there's also a great little restaurant within walking distance if you want to hang out and have a beer and get some food. We drove past a lot of the other downtown hotels, and I'm glad we chose to stay where we did. They had a least four proms going on and we didn't hear a thing.

Reviews.Title: “The heavenly bed did not disappoint - it was indeed "Heavenly"”
Reviews.Author: Judylaine
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful stay at the Westin Bayshore. The location is beautiful and very serene. I liked being able to walk to the Vancouver Convention Centre each morning - it was not only lovely, but started my day off in a relaxing fashion. I wouldn't hesitate to return to the Westin Bayshore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Jenben1984
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in August 2011. We still talk about the place. Our room overlooked Stanley Park and it was so peaceful! The pool was really nice and we liked the robes in the room. I LOVE the Westin hotels... When I travel for work, I ALWAYS try to stay at a Westin. This one was top notch... The staff were pretty friendly, although they wouldn't help me book another SPG Hotel by the airport for the night before our flight home...and we didn't have internet access... I'd definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: CoconutCanada
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was a nice hotel. Stayed ehre one night while on a lay over. Rooms are a bit odler but have been updated with sleek furniture. i had a corner room so lots of space. kins size bed bed was very comfy. Room and bathroom was clean and well lit. Really liked the rain shower head. They have starbucks coffeee in the room. Hotel staff were very nice. Only two minor complaints: 1. they don't tell you local calls cost $1.50 a pop. Before we made the calls, we looked throughout the room for a binder and on the phone itself for details about phone calls and could not find anything so assumed locals calls were free....until we got the bill. I guess a quick call down to the front desk before we made a few calls would have answewred our questions and maybe would not have made as many calls from our room. 2. business centre costs you money to use. For the price of your stay here, they should really allow you to use the internet at the business centre for free. All I needed was to do a quick email check but did not want to pay the fee for use for 10min.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan W
Reviews.Content: Beautiful views of the city and Coal Harbour. Adjacent to Stanley Park. King room very comfortable and quiet with floor to ceiling windows and one of the most comfortable beds you will find in any hotel. Indoor pool and hot tub are too small to handle all the guests when the hotel is full. Quick walk to shopping on Robson and Denman. Attentive and friendly staff. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: zubrzye
Reviews.Content: What's there to say ? Everything was great. But one thing is exceptional : the view. In my opinion, no other hotel does have a similar view in Vancouver looking at the harbor, North Vancouver and the Stanley Park. You could look at the seaplane landing, the geeses, etc. Near everything without being at the center of the action. Room was great, service as great, etc. 5 stars, even a 6th for the view. If you go to Vancouver, that's the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Radiant space, light and staff”
Reviews.Author: AndiLeaD
Reviews.Content: In town for a business conference, I had the chance to stay at the Westin Bayshore for the first time. LOVED IT. First of all: location, location, location. In the heart of the city AND a stone's throw from Stanley Park. I also appreciated the calmness of the place: how all the natural light lit the large, peaceful, open lobby and meeting areas. They're also very committed to conservation efforts, which I certainly appreciate. On top of all that, the staff *excelled.* Kind, authentic service, PLUS impeccable follow through, along with those unexpected, fun surprises that make a stay special. The food and drink at our event was deeelicious, healthy and creative. I love visiting Vancouver, and now love it even more for having discovered this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Mini oasis in the city”
Reviews.Author: 100countries_or_bust
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location - the waterfront and Stanley Park. We stayed in a tower room with a view (10th floor). With an indoor and outdoor pool they covered every season. The hot tub didn't bubble very much. Check in was slow - only one person and then our room wasn't ready. They placated us with a couple of vouchers for the hotel Starbucks while we waited about 20 minutes. Parking is expensive whether you self-park or valet.

Reviews.Title: “Great views”
Reviews.Author: gargks
Reviews.Content: The hotel has an excellent location; situated in the downtown where one can get anything one wants. We got the 4th floor from where we had an excellent view of the city and could also enjoy the marina right in front of us. The rooms are neat with proper lights and LCD TV. The washrooms are provided with nicetoiletries and bathrobes. The room service was good. The staff is very cooperative.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Stay in British Columbia”
Reviews.Author: Tim C
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bayshore was a nice hotel with beautiful views of the water, and mountain range. Overall it was a clean hotel, with friendly service, as well as nice rooms. Would recommend to other people looking for a hotel to stay at near the water in Vancouver! The only downside is that the hotel is far away from most of the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “what a find !!!”
Reviews.Author: alie01
Reviews.Content: What a great find, beautiful hotel, great location, fantastic views and all at a great price. Restaurants close by, as well as good shopping nearby. You can even walk to Stanley Park - would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: debathome
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel..Great heavenly bed and great staff...You are right on the seawall so the views are amazing. It is an older hotel but has been renovated to Westin standards. The only complaint I would have is that we ordered room service quite late and they were out of a lot of food. There was an event going on but still I thought that was tacky to run out of food. The next morning we went down for breakfast at 11 and they only had a brunch that was 28 dollars and they were shutting it down and there was no other place to go eat breakfast so we waited and went next door to Cardaros for lunch. I think they should have a restaurant that is open all the time and that you can order off a menu.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Proud_Canadian440
Reviews.Content: Rendezvous with my husband who was working in Vancouver area. Hotel is situated in Coal Harbour which is a beautiful ocean front local. Check in was quick and efficient. We were automatically upgraded to a harbor view king size room. Room was quite nice; there was floor to ceiling wall to wall sliding glass windows which we opened to enjoy the wonderful ocean breeze Bed was very comfortable. We woke the next morning to a beautiful sunrise. Before going for dinner we had a cocktail and appetizer in the hotel lounge. Marina adjacent to property with a nice restaurant over looking the Marine. We had a wonderful seafood dinner there. There is a beautiful walkway system all along the waterfront that ties into Stanley Park. So if you are a runner, cyclist or you just like to stroll you are surrounded by spectacular sights!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and wonderful weekend away from home”
Reviews.Author: mdditt2000
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bayshore hotel is located in the perfect location for a relaxing vacation or weekend away. We stayed at the Westin Bayshore hotel for three nights and enjoyed every minute of our stay. My son loved the sea planes taking off and landing right outside and hotel window and balcony. The hotel is directly opposite Stanley Park and is within walking distances to downtown and good restaurants/coffee shops etc. We loved walking alone the sea wall. The pools and gym looked great unfortunately we never used either of them. The Westin Bayshore hotels internet speed was effective and seem to work very well. We loved the Starbucks located in the hotel. The Starbucks is open early in the morning until 4pm in the afternoon. Since Starbucks was located in the hotel we never had to eat breakfast from the hotel. However the hotel breakfast buffet did look very good. It also looked over priced. Our room was 1880 located on the 18th floor. Our room was next to the elevator shaft. Every time the elevator went up and down you could hear it. I would recommend you request a room that is not located next the elevator shaft in the tower. Very poor design if you ask me. We also had to the ask the hotel staff four times before we received the babies crib. For some unknown reason we receive a bath mat with the crib. I don't think the hotel staff known the difference between a hotel mat and baby blanket. Hotel management was very apologetic and send up a tray of cookies and water. Regardless of the elevator and crib issues our stay was wonderful. Safeway's and whole-foods supermarket are two blocks from the hotel on Robson St. We purchased some fruit, yogurt etc. The hotel room has a refrigerator. No SPG platinum upgrade from what I could tell. We received a standard Westin king room. Well room did have a great view of the downtown. We will definitely be back. No SPG club lounge.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay”
Reviews.Author: Ti-Pite
Reviews.Content: i love this place. clean, modern, quiet and comfortable. excellent service, well situated. good price for vancouver. Right in coal harbour, beautiful view. never tried the brunch because i found it expensive. OK, nice little cafes right next door with good cheap filling breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Amazing Views!”
Reviews.Author: Erika S
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here with an upgraded harbour view room. The room was well appointed with a floor to ceiling wall of windows overlooking Coal Harbor. The view was amazing! Anytime we were in the room we left the curtains open and at night we left them open to take in the skyline. The location was great too. Every evening we strolled along Coal Harbor eating gelato and watching float planes landing and taking off. We had tickets for the hop on hop off trolley and one of the stops was at the front doors of the Westin. It could not have been easier to get on the trolley and sightsee the entire city. The Westin is also very close to Stanley Park which only enhances the views from this hotel. The staff was always friendly and greeted us everytime we left and welcomed us back when we returned each evening. This was our first visit to Vancouver and the Westin Bayshore has ruined us for any other hotel in the city because no other hotel can offer the location, views and convenience. We can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Wonderful, Relaxing Room”
Reviews.Author: LifesGR8atSuper8
Reviews.Content: To be honest this Westin is my favourite Starwood property in Vancouver; heck it's one of my favourite hotels in the city, period. Yes, its a capable hotel with refined (not stuffy) service standards, large open spaces, wonderful guest recognition if you are a returning guest and a member of their loyalty program as I am. The property offers a variety of decent dining options but let's be honest in Vancouver with Denman, Robson and Gastown walking distance from the hotel, there are alot of great alternatives to hotel dining. Room serivice is worth a try- the late evening menu offers some good value. What really makes this property a favourite of mine if the location right up on the edge of Coal Harbour and a stone's throw from Stanley Park. You want a real West Coast experience, then you can hardly do better than the Westin Bayshore. no other hotel compares. Smell the sea salt from your room. Marvel at the magnificent Cypress and Western Redcedars and Arbutus trees that crowd Stanley Park. Enjoy the choreographed dance of the float planes, cruise ships and helicopters as they come and go on Coal Harbour right outside your guestroom window. You're completely encapsulated by everything that makes this vibrant West Coast city so great. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Best position possible”
Reviews.Author: Cloughie
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights prior to joining a cruise ship. The cruise company recommended the hotel to us and overall it was a good recommendation. The position is absolutely perfect, as first time visitors to Vancouver it was central to the majority of the attractions.We were upgraded because we had requested a room on the executive floor, they do not have such a floor however they did give us a room with a view of the bay which was spectacular. Our stay did not start well, we had 6 bags to carry once we got out of our taxi and there was no porters to assist. Having struggled inside there was a long queue at the check in desk which didn't help our mood after a long flight. The decor appeared a little "tired", however the dark brown colour scheme did not help. However the room was comfortable and the staff were generally very efficient. We only ate breakfast in the hotel which was very expensive. Perhaps this relates to a difference of culture, Europeans in general eat small healthy breakfasts whilst you cannot help but notice our American cousins tend to eat very large meals at breakfast which probably explains the high price charged. We had chosen restaurants for dinner from reviews prior to arriving, however right outside the door of the hotel was an Italian restaurant which was excellent. We ate there twice. The hotel was very busy as there was a large convention in Vancouver at the time and the hotel was also the venue for television programme "Canada's Got Talent" which made every day very interesting to say the least. We will be visiting Vancouver again and we will certainly use the Westin Bayshore again and already stated its position cannot be beaten. Hopefully they will have redecorated by then!

Reviews.Title: “Stunning hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: RachelAllen
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Westin which was the final leg of our honeymoon trip. The hotel is situated in a perfect position on the waterfront and a short distance from Stanley Park, restaurants and shopping districts. Spacious modern rooms, great showers and nice toiletries. Fantastic indoor and outdoor pools which were nice and warm. A smart hotel with friendly staff, would highly recommend. We didn't have a car with us but heard from others that the parking is a little expensive so might be worth investigating if you plan to take yours with you.Tip - there's a lovely restaurant opposite the hotel called Cardero's, definitely worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Weekender in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: PhotosbyPharos
Reviews.Content: We live near Vancouver and chose the Westin Bayshore for our 29th wedding anniversary. Just one night, two days, on a glorious fall weekend. Beautiful view of the harbour and shipping, mountains and highrises from our room. Can walk around Stanley Park from here or along the waterfront into downtown.Excellent restaurants and bistros everywhere. Service was superb in the bar, the restaurant (food delicious), and at the front desk. We are booked into a room for Christmas and decided we wanted a small suite - "No problem!" Keys were handed over and we chose which one we wanted. Done in about ten minutes. As you can see we are coming back to the Westin Bayshore. Only downer - Valet parking is exorbitant and there are no other options if you bring a car.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not at luxury resort level”
Reviews.Author: RoadWarriorBizman
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the location being on the edge of the bay overlooking Stanley Park, water and mountains. If you are a walker, you can get to almost any location in downtown Vancouver with a 20 minute or less walk. None of the little extras you expect in a resort, like coffee/tea stations in the morning or the hot chocolate and cookies on chilly evenings. You are instructed to go to the onsite Starbucks for those amenities. The property is a bit dated and in need of one of those multi-million dollar renovations. Older equipment in the gym. Service was very professional and polished.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsSJF
Reviews.Content: Our family loves this hotel. We have been coming yearly since our honeymoon thirty years ago! We stayed this visit at my daughter's request for her birthday. The hotel gave us a free upgrade and when we arrived they had provided chocolate covered strawberries as a treat for my daughter. The location of the Bayshore is perfect. You can walk out the door and walk for many kilometers along the water. If you head west you will get onto the seawall that goes around Stanley Park or you can visit The Vancouver Aquarium . At Christmas there is a Wonderful Christmas Train in this area that is great for kids of all ages. If you head east from the hotel you will walk along the water towards the Vancouver Convention Center and Gas Town. If you walk two blocks South you will get to Robson street which is a fabulous shopping area. The hotel has an indoor and outdoor pool. Our favorite is the heated outdoor pool but the indoor pool and hot tub are nice as well. The gym is small but is adequate for both cardio and weight workouts. Foodwise, the Sunday Brunch is awesome but expensive. There are many options for restaurants in close proximity to the hotel. Our kids always enjoyed the Whitespot which is only a short block North of the hotel. There are also many cafe's in the area. The staff at the Westin are wonderful. They are helpful and pleasant. We have gotten to know some of the staff who greet us warmly each time we come to stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a location!”
Reviews.Author: musicmansimpson
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful property in an amazing location. The hotel is very nice, and the staff is fantastic, particularly the front valet crew. I'm not sure why anybody goes to Vancouver and stays on Robson Street. That's the same experience you'd get in any vibrant city. Go and stay at the Bayshore, on Coal Harbour, with a view of 3 amazing things: 1) a harbour; 2) a beautiful park; 3) stunning mountains. All in the same view! Each of these individually would be nice, but the three togeher are breathtaking. We actually preferred this view to the view we had staying in a Premium view room at the Four Seasons in Whistler! I received a wonderful platinum upgrade to a harbour view room very high up, and the manager sent up wine and chocolates to my wife and I, since we were celebrating our first anniversary. I can't say enough nice things about the hotel. It is all around solid, and I highly recommend it -- especially for the terrific price! It's nice and quiet, too, which makes for a solid sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Nickeled and Dimed”
Reviews.Author: Seaem
Reviews.Content: I received a nice rate through a discount booking but beware of all the added extras. Parking is $36.00 a day and it is out of the loop enough from most of the action that you either have to drive and try to find parking at whatever event you are attending or take a cab. Breakfast is expensive and they charge for internet. The facility is very swank and the pool and exercise rooms are decent. Also I found the staff very helpful. I probably wouldn't stay there again but not because of the facility itself. I prefer a more central downtown location where I can walk to most attractions. Also be mindful of where you park. We pulled into the lot that said "Welcome to the Westin Bayshore" as you first pull in off the street. It was really far from the hotel and we ended up wandering around and someone let us in the back door. It turns out it is the employee and Bayshore condo parking. The staff was really nice and got our money back from that lot. It is a great place to stay if you are attending a conference at their conference center and you are allowed a big per diem.

Reviews.Title: “Insane hidden costs, flies in room :(”
Reviews.Author: Minotauraus
Reviews.Content: Pros Great location, most of the places are easily accessible, safe relatively new constructions, rooms are large Two of the 3 nights that I stayed here, staff was good, helpful and friendly Cons We had 2 houseflies bugging us. Not expected from a 4* hotel which charges $200 a night Costs are not upfront. Internet is $15 PER DEVICE! I heard two really upset people calling the front desk while I was checking out. also parking is $36 a day. Factor in breakfast etc for two and the total cost of staying here is over $300/night. Frankly, I wouldn't pay half that. Showers are mounted on the ceiling, not enough pressure to wash shampoo off hair. No shower curtains, half glass, no doors in shower area. this means if you shower, your partner will have to sit on a wet seat and walk on a wet floor. Good luck! No vending machines or anything that can give you a bottle of water if you check in past the restaurant close time. This was very disappointing. The rooms weren't pre heated. We had to ask for blankets as the sheets were very cold.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: aylabean
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at Westin Bayshore post Alaska cruise . The room was spacious , clean and the "heavenly beds" certainly are , they were the most comfortable hotel beds we have ever stayed in . Staff were very helpful and when we asked for extra coffee & milk for the room they were delivered quickly and with a smile. We enjoyed the use of the pool and jacuzzi although it would have been helped if pool had been better signposted and there was more than one changing room , also found the jacuzzi temperature just a bit too hot !

Reviews.Title: “Cold”
Reviews.Author: TravlngExec
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March. No matter what I did I could not get the room up to a temperature that felt warm. I piled two comforters on my bed and woke up in the middle of the night shivering. I think it was because my room faced the bay and was walled with windows. Service was great - but they couldn't really do much about the temperature. wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view!”
Reviews.Author: linkjess
Reviews.Content: We had a harbour front view room and couldn't have been happier with it. The luxurious king bed was terrific for the three nights we were there. The room was quite spacious, with a desk in front of the balcony looking over the yachts in the harbour. The location, right at the foot of Stanley Park, is wonderful. If you get a room on a higher floor the views of the harbour and park are outstanding. The hotel has a 'green' policy, where you can go without having your room serviced in exchange for $5 at one of their restaurants. I never like having my room serviced anyway, so it was a good trade. Overall the hotel staff were friendly and helpful. Speaking of restaurants, we had breakfast at Currents one day and would never do it again. It was as overpriced and average as a hotel restaurant could be, so I guess we got what we deserved. $5.50 for a terrible cup of coffee and $15 for bacon and eggs. With terrible service on top of that. Offensive! But I separate the restaurant from the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, great views”
Reviews.Author: Pathcontrolmonk
Reviews.Content: the staff were all excellent without being overly hotel-like, seemed to be a comraderie among staff too as opposed to "this is your job, not mine" attitude. room was quite spacious with perfect views of harbour, mountains and park. the building is fairly old though so they could really use an update, especially the single pane windows from the seventies. great location too if you are in vancouver for a holiday, everything is walking distance.
