Reviews.Title: “Long wait for room.”
Reviews.Author: walterlus
Reviews.Content: After arriving at the Westin at 10 am I was advised that that my room was not ready. But since I came in as Princess customer I would be a priority. Lo and behold I got my room at 3:50 pm. Can't blame Princess, but the front desk should have been more honest. Never again at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: GEERSA
Reviews.Content: After having spent 10 nights in the last two weeks away from home, I was not relishing another hotel stay. Thankfully, the Westin Bayshore in Vancouver turned out to be a relaxing gem of a hotel. Well appointed, recently renovated, and staffed by highly competent and friendly staff, my stay was perfect. The hotel is wonderfully situated in Vancouver, overlooking Stanley Park and Vancouver's harbour. The area around the hotel has great restaurants, is close to the convention centre, sea plane airport and cruise ship terminal. Stanley Park offers numerous bike, walking and jogging trails and was a great place to work out in (for active guests the hotel has a well appointed gym). The hotel has a variety of small stores, including a Starbucks outlet. Complimentary coffee brewing facilities are provided in the room offering Starbucks Coffee and Tazo teas, I did not have a mini-bar, but the room had a small refrigerator. My room was on the 18th floor of the tower, unfortunately not fully facing the park and harbour, but a bit off to the side. The views over the city, harbour and marina were great, especially from the small balcony (having a sliding door to let fresh air in was a plus too). As with all Vancouver Hotels on the water, guests do need to put up with a bit of sea-plane noise as well as the arriving and departing ship's horns. These noises are a minor irritation, and were not a factor at night. Westin's beds are very comfortable, and my room had a selection of different pillows (soft, firm, thin etc.). The bathroom had a bath (with weird double shower head) and hotel toiletries were of a high quality standard, robes are also provided. There is lots of cupboard and closet space, and my room also had a spacious work desk. Little extra touches such as towels at the entrance for joggers, and bowls of complimentary apples were nice. I didn't use the spa, but companions who did were very satisfied. All in all, it was a very pleasurable stay and I can highly recommend the Westin Bayshore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Steve E
Reviews.Content: The Westin bay was in a great spot for my recent visit to Vancouver. The hotel was spotless and the staff very helpful and friendly. The pool was to die for... I would recomend staying here to anybody visiting this area of Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “heaven on earth”
Reviews.Author: FionaSelkirk
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bayshore is heaven on earth. From the moment you arrive all the staff make you feel so special, especially the house keeping staff who went out of their way to make sure you were having a perfect holiday. Our 7th floor room had an amazing bay view with sliding doors, you could relax in your easy chair and watch the sea planes coming and going - stunning. The rooms were very well appointed - huge comfortable beds with lovely quality sheets, superb bathroom with bathrobes, fluffy towels and good quality toiletries. The food and coffee shop in the hotel were divine, and loved having the choice of an indoor and outdoor swimming pools. We loved the bay shore location and it was perfect being just next to the huge Stanley Park. Can't wait until we can return to this amazing hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: Danpal747
Reviews.Content: I had a short stay at the Westin Bayshore over a long weekend. I found it to be a great location to explore Vancouver. Lovely room with a great view of the harbour, beautiful by night and at sunrise. Within walking distance of some great restaurants and a really pretty park, which can be cycled around. Heartily recommended....enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Our Outstanding Wedding Party Destination”
Reviews.Author: pholmes_77
Reviews.Content: We’ve just returned home after having our wedding in Vancouver. We all stayed at the Westin Bayshore which I can truly say was one of the best decisions in our Wedding. From our arrival at the beautiful Coal Harbour area and being greeted by the cheerful staff we knew this was going to be exceptional. With the Westin being located right on the waterfront it offers endless sights of shear natural beauty as you look out from your lovely room to the harbour and then over to the magnificent mountains (our wedding pictures testify to this!). In fact the windows, well sliding glass doors actually, are all part of the enchanting experience of staying at the Westin especially as you take in the amazing sights during the day then the color struck skies during dawn and dusk. Even the night views of the harbour and city are really striking from the rooms. Being surrounded by the beautiful Stanley Park and many top restaurants and cafes along the waterfront, nobody had to venture far or think hard to be entertained. Walking and cycling around Stanley Park was a top favorite amongst our party. It is an out of this world experience and even more so since we spotted seals in the water. Even within the hotel itself our guests were able to take advantage of the Starbucks, Whale Watching trips, the Spa and moreover we all loved being able to gather together as a group in the mornings during the fantastic buffet breakfast. The staff at the Westin were amazing, particularly as some small and unexpected touches pleasantly continued to surprise - such as offering popsicles at the peaceful poolside in the hot sunny afternoons! We loved the afternoon turn down service in as the staff were so thorough and friendly that our room was very well kept and so comfortable at all times. In conclusion, we have to say that with the Westin Bayshore you are living in the best of all worlds as a guest. While the hotel itself has everything you could want for a luxurious and restful stay, the fun city of Vancouver is right at hand while on the other side you have the magnificent and striking beauty of Vancouver’s nature. We can’t wait to return for our upcoming stay in December.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: I loved the location of this hotel and the views were incredible. The lobby and common areas have a weird feel but not enough to complain about. Room service was unbelievably good and prompt each time I ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, right next door to Stanley Park!”
Reviews.Author: TheVeggieNomad
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious room. Staff were friendly and very helpful. Don't forget to check at the concierge desk before you head out to explore, they have discount coupons for many of the attractions :)

Reviews.Title: “Location A1!”
Reviews.Author: johnrowe918
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel right on the waterfront,fantastic views over the city and Marina,very helpful staff,and we were given a free upgrade,which made our 4 day stay even more enjoyable. i have stayed here before on a business trip,so I new I wanted to return for a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable”
Reviews.Author: CanadaFamily
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently using a priceline bid. The hotel's location is perfect, particularly if your goal is to experience the beauty of Vancouver, including the sea wall and Stanley Park. The view from my room of the harbour was awe inspiriting. I overlooked the marina and would spend the mornings watching the floatplanes land in the harbour. Saturday night the party boats are a bit loud, but that would be a seasonal concern. The sea wall development through the area is wonderful. well lit and safe. One could spend days just strolling the neighbourhood. A short walk to downtown business district and an even shorter walk to the stores and restaurants of Denman and Robson. The customer service far exceeded my expectations. The lobby area for checkin is a tad confusing-- no clear line up as you register at desks and endless line jumpers, but the service was very warm. The restaurant was lovely and the morning buffet, while priced quite high, had an abundance of fresh fruit and different selections daily so you don't get bored. I really loved the hotel shops, which surprised me in the quality of merchandise. I will return. BTW-- Kelly from group sales is a star in the hotel brand.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Jw550
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night prior to an Alaskan cruise. The location is fabulous! Right on the harbor with incredible views. Had lunch sitting outside watching the floatplanes take off in the harbor. Very convenient, ( two blocks to a Safeway grocery) tons of great looking restaurants nearby. And as with any Westin, a very nice property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - not nice view”
Reviews.Author: Mina_trip
Reviews.Content: If you are staying in old tower, watch out. We had no view ( we had a view of next building in 3metres). Very nice hotel, great location, hotel customer service is excellent. Outdoor pool was warmed up, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good service!”
Reviews.Author: Ocean8282
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the hotel for free due to spg redemption. Despite not paying a single cent, we received wonderful service. The front desk staffs were friendly. I was having a small chat with a Chinese front desk staff during the check in procedures. The friendliness impressed me. Even the housekeeping personnel were greeting us with smiles. The greatest surprise was the free upgrade to a harbor view room. The view from the room is fantastic! We can see the Stanley park and harbour. The room is clean and comfortable. The hotel is great for those who want to explore Stanley park as it is just steps from the park.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable stay at Westin Bayshore”
Reviews.Author: benjam42
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here previously and have consistently had great stays. From the warm, genuine reception at check in to the staff throughout the property, this Westin does a great job. The grounds of the property are amazing...nice touches throughout - great pool and fitness center. We also thought the service was great - one front desk agent helped track down the Kids Club pack for our daughter (did a lot of searching!) And, you can't beat the location - perfect for playing in Stanley Park or simply being close to the center of town. As a loyal SPG Gold member, I would pay extra to stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Great room, but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: JCA1342
Reviews.Content: Location, room, bedding all wonderful...but they could use a tad more insulation in the walls. We could hear the neighbors closing their curtains, and everyone exiting the elevators. Overall a good experience and would stay here again. Also, if you are traveling with pets, this place is pet friendly! I recommend the restaurant nearby, Cordero's...excellent seafood but make reservations...like most great restaurants, this place is busy and they usually have a lengthy wait list.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: abbagirlKelowna
Reviews.Content: I had to request a room with a view, and was charged a small daily fee for it. Also, I found the parking rate to be excessive ($36/night). There is free parking on the street at the meter from 10pm until 9am, but you'd better not be late in plugging that meter! I felt that our room could have done with some updating/renovations, but it was nothing major. A/C worked perfectly, very quiet. New flat screen tv. No balconies except top floors. We had 2 double beds & a cot. Dogs stay free, which was a real bonus for us! This is a quiet, well-built hotel. We never heard any dogs throughout our stay. The hotel had a gorgeous outdoor pool, and a smaller indoor pool with a small hot tub. The very best part is the location of this hotel - right on the seawall that leads to Stanley Park! The location was simply unbeatable, and the view was worth paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location, too many extra fees”
Reviews.Author: turcich
Reviews.Content: The property is beautiful and in a great location, the rooms are nice and spacious. The hotel charges too many fees ($15) for WiFi both in the lobby or in the room, and even charges too use the internet at the business center. The property is in a great location for runners as the path around Stanley Park is right out the back door.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!”
Reviews.Author: coolgrams
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for 3 nights. It was wonderful! Best location and view in Vancouver. Rooms are nicely decorated, beds are super comfortable. We stayed in the tower overlooking coal harbor. Make sure you ask for a room facing the water, as our first room was on the side of the building and was next to the elevator which was quite noisy. We did move to another room. The staff was awesome. The outdoor pool area is lovely, and the temperature was perfect. As the hotel is right on the water, there are a lot of seaplanes flying in and out, so there is that noise occasionally, but we loved it as it added to the experience. Would definitely go back again! Parking is expensive, but if you have your own car, you can park on the street outside from 10pm to 9am for free, and then move your car in the morning. We saved about $30 doing this.

Reviews.Title: “It was fabulous and we enjoyed every minute.”
Reviews.Author: JMB_7
Reviews.Content: The staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Our room was in the towers section with a water view, and nothing was lacking. The room is very large and comfortably appointed, had a safe, refrigerator, all the amenities.. only not so great is the rainshower shower head which requires you step out of the water to soap up. But we lived with it. The pool area is rather small for a hotel this large, but we only used it at the end of the day and were always able to get chairs. There is a Starbucks in the hotel for a quick morning breakfast as an alternative to the breakfast buffet, which looked beautiful but is more food than we were interested in. Pros: This hotel is within walking distance of the park, restaurants, the sea walk, and is in a great location.It has great rooms, great staff, great facilities and we will stay again-only in a water view room however. City view is nice but not what we came to look at in Vancouver. Cons: Valet parking is expensive at $40 a day, (self park is available for $32 a day), rainshower shower head, smallish pool, costly internet connection.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel and area”
Reviews.Author: ambct
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Bayshore for a couple of days after an alaskan vacation. The hotel was beautiful and within walking distance to Stanley Park. Our room overlooked the Marina and the view was beautiful. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ladygirl77
Reviews.Content: My sister and I went to Vancouver for the Labour Day weekend and we stayed at the Westin Bayshore. What a gorgeous hotel! The valet service was prompt and large and checkin was a breeze. When we got to our room, we were pleasantly surprised with a patio door that opened and a beautiful view of the boats parked at the docks on the water. While staying there, we walked up to do some shopping on Robson Street ,which was a nice stroll, and we rented bikes at a place just a block over to do a tour of Stanley Park. What a nice way to spend the day. I highly recommend doing both things. We had a spa visit while we were there. My sister had a massage which she claims was her best ever (not sure if it was by Shannon or Natalie) and I had a facial from Michelle which was definitely one of the best I'd ever had. The spa had a very relaxing atmosphere and if I was a resident of Vancouver, I'd definitely go there on a regular basis! Our time in Vancouver was limited and we didn't get to take in everything but the pool scene seemed to be a rather great one. There in an indoor pool and an outdoor one. The outdoor one definitely looked like someplace I would have enjoyed had we had more time. We had breakfast in the hotel the morning we left and I was disappointed we didn't eat there every morning. Food was great, service was great, view was great. All in all, we were extremely pleased with our stay and have nothing negative to say. I'd go back again in a heart beat!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely position overlooking Stanley Park.”
Reviews.Author: SJHill_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Bayshore for two nights after a two week RV trip. What an utter treat. It was a very hot day and we were offered chilled water to drink and fruit even though we were only dropping off our bags before checking in properly later that day. We had a fantastic tower room ( ask for a corner room on the 15th floor overlooking park!) with the most stunning view of Stanley Park, the marina and mountains. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff, the room was extremely spacious, nicely furnished and spotless. The outdoor pool was just wonderful. We felt truly spoilt as we bobbed about in the sunshine. The children loved it! We were even given a complimentary film voucher for the kids and when we expressed that the Internet access that we paid for in our room didn't have much of a signal they refunded without a quibble. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we just had such a lovely, lovely time.Westin, you have some excellent staff at this hotel ( and no I'm not related to any of them, they were just exemplary!) It was a perfect way to end an amazing adventure in Canada and if we can save up, we'll be back asap. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here if in Vancouver. The position is so open and airy with amazing views. Much better than feeling 'hemmed' in Downtown!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: TravelandLearn_11
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bayshore provides great views out towards the harbour with its many activities. We were lucky to get a room high up with extensive views, and enjoyed zipping a glass of wine, watching the sunset and the rowing boats go by. The hotel is currently undergoing upgrade in its decor, and the lobby looks great. Make sure you get one of the updated rooms, which are lovely. Given its location, it is only a short walk to the many restaurants on Denman Street, should you crave Japanese or Korean food. in the other direction, it might be a ten- to fifteen minute walk towards the downtown shopping area along Robson Street. If you come by car, you might even get lucky and find (much cheaper) street parking around the hotel instead of the expensive hotel parking garage....

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: Jesse O
Reviews.Content: Pros: Beautiful views, right next to Stanley Park. Large property. Nice pool. Cons: Windows were filthy (on the inside), construction was going on so we had to keep our blinds shut from 9AM-5PM every day. It's a beautiful weekend in Vancouver, we had come up from Seattle to get away, and we're stuck in a dark room the majority of day light. But I'm going to knock it down for this reason. After my stay I get an automated from the GM asking how my stay went. I spent some time typing up a response, send it, and nearly a month later...no response. At least send some sort of automated "thanks for your reply" email back. But nothing?

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Lived up to the reviews”
Reviews.Author: beanerneener
Reviews.Content: I had never stayed in a 4 star hotel but my boyfriend really wanted to to make this trip special. We ony stayed one night but it was amazing! The view of the harbor was spectacular, the bed was super comfy, the staff were very nice, I could go on for hours. The only thing that I didn't love were the rain showers, a little bit of a let down (I had never used one before) but maybe I expected something more magical. Overall if we are able to i will definatley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sandraclue
Reviews.Content: This is a beatiful, clean and immaculate hotel. Completely up all Westin standards. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I loved the sliding windows which completely opened the room to the water. Very relaxing. Also a great location in Vancouver, we could walk along the water, and we loved the restaurants on Denman Streetvwhich isca short 5 min walk away. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Morton H
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a beautiful hotel on the water with views of the water, city, and harbor. Rooms have floor to ceiling window/doors that you can slide open and the rooms are tastefully decorated. The bathroom is spacious and the shower has a double head and ample towels and amenities. Fridge and safe are in-room as is an LCD TV. The room were very well insulated and quiet and we were not bothered by any noise from the hall or adjacent rooms. The only drawback was the $36 charge for parking, which is next door to the hotel so you have to walk across a small walkway. Staff were very helpful and pleasant and we go an excellent deal on the hotel through hotwire.com. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular sunrise and everything else!”
Reviews.Author: DKNY74
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a weekend at this hotel. I was last there 5 years ago, and it didn't take long to remember why I love it to much. There is simply no better location in Vancouver. The hotel has some of the most spectacular views I've ever seen - anywhere. The sunrise from my room was beyond amazing (just look at my pic!). The sunsets are just as gorgeous. I actually didn't want to leave my room because I enjoyed the views so much, and the large windows that slide open (floor to ceiling). The hotel itself is great, but it's the staff and the service that make it exceptional. From the arrival at the front desk, to morning breakfast, to working with the concierge - the staff just get it. They provide a personalized level of service that makes you feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but we had a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: bdr402
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to stay at this hotel for 3 nights before we left on an Alaskan cruise. We could have stayed at less expensive hotels in Vancouver, but some friends stayed there a couple of years ago and said it was nice, plus we wanted to be on the waterfront. We prepaid $1315 in May to get a good rate for 3 nights. We reserved an upper floor room with a guaranteed room overlooking the bay. We arrived on the day of check in at 12:30pm because we had to check out of a different hotel, knowing check in there was at 3pm. We were prepared to site see the harbor area until check in time. The desk clerk said our city view room was not ready yet. I told her we had a bay view room. She said we didn't. I showed her our confirmation letter and she said okay. She said our 11th floor room would be ready at 3pm. We had the luggage people hold our 4 suitcases and we went sightseeing. We returned at 3:30 and our room still was not ready. But she said she had a similar room on the 10th floor, so we took it, as we were tired from walking. I went to get our checked luggage and the guy brought it out and left it in front of me and started to walk away. I asked if he could deliver it to our room? He had a very poor attitude and said he could. It was obvious he was very busy, but his poor attitude was unnecessary. He did deliver it to our room, and was all friendly when it came time for me to tip him. On a positive note, our room was awesome. Also breakfast in the breakfast area was good. One night we went into the bar to have a late dinner. We were enjoying a drink, waiting for our food, when the bar suddenly filled up with a huge drunken crowd who just got off a party boat docked outside the hotel. We had to move onto the patio, wrapped up in a blanket, under a heat lamp, just to be able to hear each other talk. And our bar waiter got all pushed out of shape because we moved, apparently because a different waiter would get his tip. One last gripe. The hotel has an outdoor pool, and an indoor pool and spa. All 3 nights we wanted to go for a swim in the indoor pool or soak in the spa. But every time we checked it out it was like a kiddie pool! No adults around, but any where from 6-10 kids yelling and splashing in the pool. So we could not even use it. Would I recommend this hotel or stay there again? NO WAY. I'll spend my money somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “You'd be crazy to stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: fruchick
Reviews.Content: I got this room for one night at a ridiculously low rate on Priceline the day before, and it would be a bargain even at rack rate. I had a room that overlooked the pool, as well as the harbour and North Vancouver. The entire outer wall of the rooms are sliding glass doors, without screens, so you can get the cool shore breeze right through your room. The chaise next to the doors is an awesome place to stretch out and watch the planes take off and land in the harbour. The supplied wine glasses were great to fill up from a bottle from the nearby wine store. Yup, it was a nice night! The outdoor pool area is great, and I wish I'd had more time to use it. Probably about 40 lounge chairs to be had, though I'm guessing they really fill up during a hot afternoon. It's a quick (though uphill) walk to Robson Street for shopping, and the seawall is literally right outside the door of the hotel. Stanley Park, of course, is right there too. Great location. One thing did bother me: there was no guide in my room for the hotel itself. The tv told me that my check-out time was noon. The menu on the dresser told me how much a room service bagel cost ($7.50!). But no instructions on how to get to the pool, or how the towel service worked (no attendant when I went in the evening, so just took my own towel from my room), or anything like that. Don't even know if there were vending machines on-premises, or whether the mini bar was the only option. Kind of odd. But overall, a fantastic experience, and if I ever find myself in Vancouver again I absolutely know where I'm staying!

Reviews.Title: “Nice walk to the convention center”
Reviews.Author: sam1am
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a nice 10-15 minute walk along the shore from the convention center/Canada Place. The hotel was in great condition, although they were in the process of renovating the exterior of the tower. Didn't eat breakfast at the hotel, instead I stopped by a local grocery store and had fruit and cereal in my room for breakfast (nice to have the refrigerator on hand). Staff was incredibly friendly from check-in through the end of the stay. We had no issues requiring staff intervention, so contact was minimal. The business center is available to guests for free printing of boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the way”
Reviews.Author: RoniTC
Reviews.Content: Upon entering the room you will notice the fantastic view! Ask for a Coal Harbour view. Open the floor to ceiling glass doors that form a wall and listen to the beautiful sounds of Vancouver. Pull up a chair and watch all the activity, planes, ships, skaters, walkers, runners, dogs, bird, traffic and much more. Of course you have the heavenly bed and excellent service. Book it, you'll love your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel for our 25th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: sredheada45
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our honeymoon in July 1986. So we decided we would stay here for our 25 wedding anniversary in July of 2011. We were treated like royalty. Hotel is located right next to the sea wall and Stanley park. Canada place is around 1/4 mile away. Gas town in a fair 1/2 mile walk but we did it with no problems. The views from this hotel are spectacular in the tower. We had a view of Stanley park, the mountains and the harbor. We watched the cruise ships go in and out. The hotel gives you complimentary umbrellas. Everyone was so nice from the bell men to check in staff. The room was large, clean and nicely decorated. Huge bathroom. Gorgeous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “poor service, bad staff, lack of responsiveness”
Reviews.Author: bretgoss
Reviews.Content: I sent in a letter to the GM on 8/14/11. I have yet to receive a responce. First and last time with this hotel. This is the letter: Emma, I travel 85% of the time for my work. In and out of hotels on a daily and weekly basis. I planed this trip up to BC with my family. We stayed at the Sheraton in Surrey , then your property. I am very dissatisfied with the level of service I received at your establishment. This is why. I called to ask for early check in. I was told to come by at 1PM and they would try I stopped by at 2:30 to hear that you were full, my room would be ready at 3. I came back with my family at 3:30, was once again told you were full and my room was not ready. I ask, was your full occupancy a surprise? You hadn’t had time enough to schedule enough housekeeping to meet the needs of your hotel? Or is it just when a room is not available is the standard excuse given is "we were full last night"? We got into our room at 4PM Went down to ask where the nearest liquor store was. I was told it was only a few blocks away. My wife went on a walk only to find out that most BC liquor stores are closed on Sunday. Either your front desk clerk didn’t know this, didn’t care it was Sunday, or just sent us on a wild goose chase Your concierge was exceptional and the only exception to your hotel, she helped with food suggestions and informed us of a liquor store open on Sunday. Poor service atyour bar. Lack of a trained bartender (she had to look up how to make a margreita) and other guest served out of sequence. To top it off, housekeeping came by our room at 9:40AM! I guess they wanted to get a head start since you were FULL! All in all our experience was sub par. Like I said in the beginning of this email I must travel due to my line of work. I do however have a choice of what hotels I stay at. I will be limiting my stays at Starwood hotels based off my experience at your property. Sincerely, Bret P. Goss

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service!”
Reviews.Author: lovegreece01
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night at the Westin Bayshore but we had late check out the next day so we had time to enjoy the pool and hotel restaurant. We had the buffet breakfast which was probably the best breakfast I've ever had. The hotel is in an excellent location as you can walk to the shops and restaurants on Robson and Denman. The service was fantastic and all of the staff made us feel welcome and were extremely accommodating. I will definitely stay there anytime I go to Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sagewords
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel!!! Don't know why anyone would give it less than five stars. The rooms (we had two)were beautiful and spacious, the bathrooms a pleasure with lots of room for clothes, towels, toiletries, the gym adequate, the concierge so helpful and friendly. Our housekeeper was lovely and accommodated all our requests. This hotel made our stay a pleasure. There are different kinds of showers. If you don't like the showerhead that comes straight from the ceiling, be sure to request the regular kind. Vancouver is a great city, and the Westin Bayshore is the perfect place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location on seawall and next door to Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: utripmeplease
Reviews.Content: We liked this hotel because it had a great location next to Stanley Park--a great place. We got a great deal on Priceline and so it was a great four-star experience for a three-star price. Rooms were comfy and roomy. Bathroom had a great double shower-head that was different and massaging. The restaurants at the hotel are overpriced and I would avoid them at all costs (including the $28 breakfast buffet). We would stay again if we got the same deal for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Crappy treatment of business travellers, incompetent counter staff and arrogant management”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTraveller579
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world and have been a Starwoods platinum member for 5 years. This hotel takes the prize for the most inept treatment of a business traveller by its staff - followed by the most arrogant, uninterested treatment by its management. I supposed business is good right now and they dont really care. A room right next to the elevator machinery, despite a reservation of a "deluxe" and room and even an alleged upgrade. Zero interest in finding a better alternative even when explained that it was impossible to sleep in that room. And after I e-mailed the general manager, I never heard back from him .... I suppose he is too important to respond. I heard back from the room manager instead, whose main attempt at being thoughtful was to explain to me that he will use this as an example to train new staff and an insultingly small award of extra points. Finally, I had a subsequent reservation a few days later - I asked him to cancel it, and he did so without making the slightest attempt to convince me to come back to the hotel. I guess business is good - they dont need to care.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot on the waterfront and steps away from Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: lopezbiker
Reviews.Content: This is a very relaxing and scenic spot to stay in Vancouver. We like to go up to walk, rollerblade or bike the waterfront around the seawall at Stanley Park or go on up to the Convention Center. There is a great view of the harbor and all the water activities. The rooms are spacious, comfortable beds with great pools- indoor or outdoor, good restaurants for casual eating environment and a spa onsite. Concierge service has always been helpful. The hotel is situated away from downtown, metro system and Robson street, so a taxi or car are needed if you want to visit those sites more than once in a day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a prime location”
Reviews.Author: Tripdiva4
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Westin Bayshore with friends prior to embarking for our Alaskan cruise and I enjoyed this hotel very much. As a Starwoods preferred member, I have stayed at many Westin hotels and I must say that this hotel is definitely one of the best. The hotel is in a prime location as it is near Stanley Park, downtown Vancouver, Gastown, and Canada Place where the cruise ships dock. Matter of fact, there is a wonderful path adjacent to the hotel to connect it to Stanley Park and I used the path daily to run. The hotel has all of the amenities that I have come to expect from a Westin or W hotel. The rooms were a tad bit smaller than I am used to but it didn't matter as I rarely in the room. The corridors on the Starwoods preferred guest floor could also use some updating. Houskeeping was very nice. The only problem we had was that the water fluctuated too much while taking a shower. We alerted the front desk and the problem was fixed. It may have been fixed too well as I was scalded a few times :-) Overall the service was excellent and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel on the bay with great views and excellent walking/biking area”
Reviews.Author: chicago2socal
Reviews.Content: This is a large hotel complex with 3 buildings. I stayed in the tower which has a small step out balcony facing the bay. Along with the usual Westin ammenities, the complimentary Starbucks coffee and Tazo tea was a nice addition. The hotel has two pools- one indoors with a jaquzzi and one outdoors-heated pool. The hotel is currently under renovation-facelift of the exterior. The hotel is a good walk to Robson and Denman streets for dining and shopping, so bring comfortable shoes. The restaurant in the hotel is pricey, so every morning I walked to Cafe Villaggio on the bay pathway for breakfast. The hotel has a Starbucks outlet if you want to stay inside and not venture out in the morning. The hotel offers complimentary use of an umbrella located in the guest room closet if needed for rain-nice touch!

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, good location and views, staff inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: VAtraveller17
Reviews.Content: We had booked our rooms way in advance (months) and requested adjoining or connecting rooms because we have two small children (4 and 2). On arrival we had two rooms on different floors. After some discussion they then gave us rooms on the same floor but on opposite ends of the L shaped hall. A few hours later, and several episodes with the check-in staff that varied from those trying to be very helpful to those who seemed to be completely indifferent to their error we received rooms on the same hall and floor several doors down from each other. They had to work after that to redeem this stay. The in-hotel restaurants are nice, and our wait staff was accommodating. The rooms were clean and nice, but nothing exceptional. The bathrooms were large and a definite plus. Our view of the water was also very nice. The hotel is an easy walk to Stanley Park and a bit further for the shopping district or Canada Place but certainly doable. It is on the waterfront. Overall, if I try to forget about the horrible check-in experience it is a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved it”
Reviews.Author: TuckerCanada
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was clean and the bed was very comfortable. The location was the BEST. You would be hard pressed to beat the view of Coal Harbour and the mountains and lights of North Vancouver, the access to seawall walks, the proximity to Stanley Park, and the multitude of restaurants made this a good summer destination. On top of that, the weather was warm and sunny and the hotel pool was a perfect way to unwind and relax. The only minor complaint would be the $36/day charge for parking. That is a bit steep compared to other downtown hotels. Good places nearby to eat: Lift or Carderos right on the seawall water front have good food, lots of selection and views of all the harbour traffic. Tavola Restaurant on Robson at Denman is a short walk away and has amazing Italian food including a yummy selection of crostini, homemade pasta and their famous brick chicken. If you take a walk to Chinatown be sure to take in the Night Market on Fridays and try some delicious street food. If you haven't filled up, stop on Hastings Street at Nuba for a delicious selection of Lebanese food.

Reviews.Title: “Always excellent, great location for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Cbkd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several times now. Centrally located for downtown Vancouver and near, Stanley Park which is great for families and whale watching, float planes, great restaurants. The hotel staff are friendly and efficient. Rooms are clean and reasonably spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MauraIllinois
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel - on the water and very near Stanley Park. We enjoyed the outdoor pool which was amazingly warm. We were disappointed with the view from our rooms overlooking a wall, but the staff at the front desk was able to be relocate us. The rooms were nice and the beds were very comfortable. The only thing....it was our first time in Vancouver, but every time we asked the concierge to recommend a restaurant or a tour the answer was always something like "They are all nice." We asked about an Italian restaurant, and the young man just turned the screen so we could see. We expected better service at a nice hotel. We were visitors there.

Reviews.Title: “great views”
Reviews.Author: skysydney
Reviews.Content: large hotel with drop dead views - provided you get the right room ! I was lucky for 2 nights to get 2 different rooms with majestic views . Great buffet breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: lbhamilton27
Reviews.Content: We were only here for 1 night, although we wished it was longer. The service was great and the view from our balcony was awesome. We watched the most beautiful sunset and sunrise from our balcony. The staff is very friendly and helpful with all that you need. We loved the comfort of the whole room. We ordered breakfast the night before, and it was served right on time. The food was great and we would definitely recommend it to other travelers. It's on the pricey side, and worth the splurge!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I have ever been to!”
Reviews.Author: sonia-ottawa
Reviews.Content: Great location, great service, very very clean etc. Just perfect, for families or other. I stayed there last year with my family and I have a friend who just came back and thought the same.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Great Hotel in the Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: MarinMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Vancouver for a family celebration and stayed for the first time at the Westin Bayshore. We've stayed closer to the main shopping district near Robson in the past, and I have to say that staying at the Westin was much more convenient and pleasant than I would have thought. The hotel faces Coal Harbour, and your room will either face the Stanley Park view or the Canada Place view. Both are pretty spectacular. Our room was on the 7th floor, and our other family member's room on the 9th. Ours had the Stanley Park view, and it was pretty wonderful. The only minor downside is that the outdoor pool is on that side, so you do get the gleeful screams of children swimming. The room is nicely appointed, and those Westin beds are super comfortable. The bathroom has kind of a strange barn door mechanism that precludes total privacy, but we got used to it. The showers are the rainfall kind of showers which aren't my favorite, but everyone else seemed to love them. Great storage in the room for clothes, and there is a safe that easily held my IPAD and valuables. The lobby is huge, and there are many areas for gathering with family to meet up for a Starbuck's coffee (great lobby Starbucks with efficient and friendly staff). The restaurant for breakfast has top quality food, and also super efficient staff. We were even given a "chef's tasting" of a smoothie that was delicious. Try the turkey omelet - sounds weird, but was amazing. The bar and grill restaurant has seen better days from a decor standpoint, but the drinks were well prepared, and again, the staff was friendly and efficient. Sitting outside is nice, but again, those pool folks are noisy. You can sit on the quieter side for a coffee outside Starbucks, but it is a little too shady and dull for such a magnificent location. Also be sure to walk along the seawall and visit Stanley Park. It is just minutes away, and the Canadian's brilliant separation of cyclists, roller bladers and pedestrians is something to see (and emulate!) In terms of transportation, I would NOT rent a car. It was $300 for four days of a car rental, and the hotel parking is $41 per day. Just take a cab from the airport, and you can walk just about anywhere else. There is also a new train from the airport, but we didn't take it. For a family celebration we rented a limo from Posh Limousines, and Dorel, the driver, was about as great as they come. For dinner, we went to Seasons in the Park, which is about a 15 minute drive from the hotel, and it was just over the top fabulous. What a view. And the food and service were both spot-on. Everyone visiting Vancouver should go there at least once. Even if for a drink. We also went to a new spot on Denman called Cosca. Mike, the owner, is so personable and wonderful. The Italian menu is extensive, and between our party of 6, we didn't have one dish that wasn't spectacular. I would highly recommend walking around English Bay, then dining at Cosca. We had the added bonus of one of the most amazing fireworks displays we have ever seen, but the sites and sounds there are always a treat. One last great tip. For a terrific meal, go into an Urban Fare market and visit their buffet. Fresh, beautifully prepared food, and a perfectly pleasant dining area to eat in. This is also a good idea if you have picky eaters, since there is everything from sushi to salads to chicken and fries. And on your way out of the store, stop and buy some of the locally made craftsman chocolates. The Westin Bayshore is our new go-to spot in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTravellers2008
Reviews.Content: I stay here 2-3 times per year on business. Outstanding location right on the seawall overlooking the ocean, Stanley Park, and a short walking distance to several great restaurants. The rooms I've had have consistently been corner rooms so have had a view in 2 directions - both amazing. Fitness room and pool (one indor and one outdoor)are also good. I keep coming back as its an upscale hotel, in an amazing location, with reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly quiet dowtown hotel with AMAZING views”
Reviews.Author: eryneo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just for the night. Our suite was outstanding on the top floor of the second tower. We were welcomed graciously by the front desk staff. The room was beautiful, not modern, but it is a westin. Classic Westin hotel, heavenly bed and rain shower were both amazing. The deck was so amazing to sit out on, I wish they would upgrade the patio furniture it would take the deck from an 8 to 10!! Great restaurants close by, convenient location. Though we didnt have time for breakfast buffet, as we were leaving we stopped to check it out and it looked awesome We will absolutely be back.

Reviews.Title: “amazing location, amazing service.”
Reviews.Author: flowergirl51
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at the westin bayshore earlier this month and loved it! the gentleman at the front door was extremely helpful and our check-in agent, Danielle was so amazing. she took the time to figure out what room would best suit our needs (i.e. we wanted to look at the water but also wanted to see the sunrise so she suggested we would love a room in tower building), she took the time to suggest restaurants and shopping areas we would enjoy. the bellman that helped with our bags was great too asking sincerely about our travels so far and taking care to explain the layout of the hotel and answering our questions, i think his name was Will. Our server in the seawall restaurant, Brian, was great too! All of the staff was great. We appreciated, too, being asked about our experience at check-out. Rebecca, at the front desk, was so sweet. the only thing we would critique about the hotel is it seems to be understaffed. the front desk agents were almost always alone or had a line-up. it doesn't look great for a 4-star hotel to be under-staffing the front lobby which is such a high-traffic area. overall, though this hotel, the view, the location and all the staff were amazing and we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LoLoLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: Located near Stanley Park, this hotel is a gem. Large and efficient enough to cater for business travellers, but still retaining friendly and personal service. Our room was tranquil, spacious and overlooking Coal Harbour, the park and the mountains beyond. We tried both the breakfast buffet at Currents Restaurant (great staff) and the Seawall Bar and Grill, and both were excellent, and the reception and concierge staff were friendly and helpful. The main plus is that the hotel is so beautifully positioned, just a short stroll around the harbour to the park, and a 15min walk along the sea wall to downtown. We wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views, great service, pricey parking”
Reviews.Author: Lifelearners
Reviews.Content: We had a two room suite looking east over the water and north to the mountains and Stanley Park. It was hard to leave each day because the view was so nice. Try to get a room with this view, it's gorgeous! We lucked out with a sunny weekend and were able to walk to Gastown and back one morning since this hotel is well situated for walking to Stanley Park and other downtown spots. Because the parking was very expensive, we took a cab to dinner a couple of times at night instead of driving. I loved that there were 2 baths since my sister and I were sharing the space. We found it a lot quicker to get out in the morning because we could get ready at the same time. We had a fridge and microwave which we loaded with our favorites in case we didn't feel like eating out. The rooms were quiet and we were entertained in the lobby by the filming of a movie in the restaurant area! The valets were superb and the staff was friendly, not snooty! This is huge for us because so many nice hotels have staff that are stuffy and not warm. If you have the money, stay here! Oh, and we had the best Seagull buddy on our railing...

Reviews.Title: “A great Hotel in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: daggern
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal on Hotwire with this hotel but it still gives a wow factor. This is a great place for families with downtown at the door and Stanley park within 15 minutes walk along the harbour front. There are plenty of restaurants within 10 minutes walk and lots to do. A great place for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great, with one exception!”
Reviews.Author: 4DallasTravelers
Reviews.Content: The hotel is giant and the accommodations are very roomy. We had a room with 2 double beds that offered plenty of space for me, my husband, and my son. The views from the top floors of the Tower Building are beautiful, and the room was nicely appointed. My only complaint is that the Westin STILL charges extra for WiFi access! How year 2000! I have stayed in Hampton Inns and Four Seasons and hotels in between, and I haven't run into an internet charge in a few years. Just build it into the price, for crying out loud!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: GregW_Oregon
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a combined busines/pleasure trip with my wife and two other couples. It is a large hotel with a main building and newer tower. We had a room on the 7th floor of the main building (a SPG floor) that had a great view out over the harbor and waterfront to the east. The room was nicely designed and equipped, with a comfortable bed and sliding door that could be opened for fresh air. The lobby can get a little hectic with the volume of visitors, but it is spacious and well-laid out. Check-in, doorman and luggage holding were all efficiently handled. There is a spa, which I did not check out, but I did use the small but nice exercise room. There are indoor and outdoor pools, as well. I only had a breakfast buffet and then drinks in the restaurants, so cannot comment greatly on the food service. The location is very nice for tourists, close to restaurants, shopping and a 5-minute walk from Stanley Park. The waterfront location is relatively quiet (except for float plans coming and going in the bay) and very pleasant. We took a dinner cruise up the inlet one evening on a boat departing right from the seawall next to the hotel. All in all, a very nice hotel for its type.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: HarrisFamilythree
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in part of a long trip thru Canada. Very good location and wonderful concierge service. The strangest thing happened when I went to check in. He tried to coax me into a room without a bed (pullout couch between 2 suites that had not been booked by either suite). I told him that was unacceptable for two of us when we had reserved a room with two beds and that I was too old to sleep on a pullout couch at the rates they were charging. He finally put us into a proper room with two beds, but it was weird. Beautiful lobbydownstairs, but the hallways were completely ignored during the renovation. We even went to a couple different floors to see if just our floor was overlooked and they all were. You go from this beautiful lobby to these low ceilinged dingy outdated hallways then into a reasonably nicely renovated (but tiny) room. The movable flatscreen and updated bathroom were nice but ceilings low and it did feel like "lipstick on a pig" with the hallways. Still, I would stay here again because the service and location were really excellent.

Reviews.Title: “I miss it already”
Reviews.Author: catteee
Reviews.Content: I checked into the Westin Bayshore for 6 nights in July while I was in town for a conference. FIRST IMPRESSION Upon nearing the hotel, we were a little unimpressed with the exterior. Unlike most Westin hotels that I've stayed in, this one seemed dated. However, as we entered the hotel, I began to feel much more at home. The lobby is beautiful and very spacious, and they even provide ice cold water infused with lemon (I definitely took advantage of this after a bike ride through Stanley Park!) ROOMS Though we arrived around noon, my room was ready. I was given a room on the 3rd floor in the lower building. Now that I think about it, I should have asked if there were any other rooms available on a higher floor. I had a view of the concrete building beside me. However, the other party I was with got a room in the taller tower with a beautiful view of the seawall, harbour, and Stanley Park. The room itself was very nice, with everything you're used to in a Westin hotel. There was a safety deposit box and a mini-fridge (accessible with the key, so I didn't use it). The washroom was spacious and beautiful, and even had a double shower head. Something I did notice, though, was that the place could have used a bit of a dusting (on the alarm and on the shelf underneath the sink). Something to note is that they have a program where you can refuse housekeeping for the day and be given either 500 starpoints or a $5 voucher to use in the hotel. The wait for the lobby elevators to the shorter tower can be a little long, but if you walk towards the Starbucks, there is actually a second elevator there for use. SERVICE The service staff were very helpful, and we got to know quite a few of them over the duration of our stay, such as Johnny, who recommended some of the best restaurants we ate in. They were always willing to provide answers to our questions and went out of their way to check things for us using their computers. Housekeeping was also very helpful. I left my curling iron at home and they were able to provide one for me throughout my stay. The only dining I did in the hotel (if this counts) was the Starbucks, so I cannot comment on this aspect of the hotel. LOCATION The location is an interesting one, being right by the sea wall and Stanley Park. It is about a 15 or even 20 minute walk to the convention centres and the heart of downtown, but I really liked the calm of the location. There are many eateries along Denman and also along the seawall for you to enjoy (I really liked Cafe Villagio right along the sea wall for breakfast). You can also rent bikes very close to the hotel (Spokes is where I got mine, right at Denman and Georgia) to take into Stanley Park. TRANSPORTATION The transportation staff was very helpful and made sure we got our taxis briskly (It's about a $7 taxi to the Convention Centre and Canada Place). There is also a shuttle - driven by a nice man named Viktor - that runs every hour on the :40 to the Pacific Centre. It picks up at the Pacific Centre to head back to the hotel around :45. We used the shuttle quite a few times, and Viktor was often nice enough to drive us right to our destination. We went to Chinatown early one morning and he took us right there, including letting us know where we should go and where we should stay more vigilant. On my last day, I rented a bike and needed to lock it up with the hotel. This was a very time-consuming process, as I needed to go over to the parking, ask for the bike room key from the attendant, and lock it up in this small, dark room. My bike was definitely safe, though. For those of you who are planning on taking the bus, walk down to Georgia Street and there will be quite a few buses taking you downtown. From downtown, walk to Pender and the 19 will take you back towards the hotel. FITNESS CENTRE The hotel has two pools - one indoor and one outdoor - as well as a small whirlpool and a fitness centre. I did use the fitness centre once, which was just off the indoor pool. It was an appropriate size but was jam-packed with machines. The machines were usable but were starting to show their age. They had weights, but were missing mats. I ended up doing warm-ups and mat work on a thin pilates mat that was there. There was a constant stream of families coming into the indoor pool, but no one looked cramped. Having stayed in the hotel for almost a week, I was very sad to leave. If I ever visit downtown Vancouver again, Westin Bayshore would definitely be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: designfanatic
Reviews.Content: Not anywhere near what is expected of a Westin. Not sure if this is just contained to this location or if Westin is sliding into the ranks of the Hiltons. Room was dated. Bed was great though. Hair dryer was like having a mosquito blowing on your hair. No mini bar. The starbucks downstairs does NOT have their usual breakfast sandwiches, probably so you eat their idea of a breakfast buffet. The buffet is on shelves, like the kind you would see t-shirts displayed at the Gap. Room service menu is ridiculous and the late night menu has nothing hot at all. We ordered a turkey wrap and salad it cost nearly $60 The wrap was something they probably made in the day and wrapped in cello. I would rather a starbucks pre wrapped sandwich for cheaper. Not even hot chips. The only good thing about this hotel is the location in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “unpleasent front desk experience”
Reviews.Author: jk0909
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here for a week during convention last week and the stay was ok. we then came back a week later from road trip to banff and encountered the worst front desk experience during our 20-day vacation in canada this time. the woman with curly blound hair and glasses named danielle helped us with us with the check-in. we were here pretty early, around noon, so originally we had high hope of getting a room in the new tower with the marina view. even though we are loyal spg member the woman didnt even bother to check with the computer for us and the atitude was unbearable! we then asked if there is room at higher floor but again she just rejected us immediately. we had pretty good vacation mood but it was completely ruined at that moment. the room was not ready so she asked to leave our phone number with her and she said she would call once it's ready. we never got the call from her and came back around 3. this time we were helped by a guy named johnny and we asked again if there is anything better avaliable. at least he took like 10 min to check into the computer for us and even though we were only able to get a room with a slight better view at the same floor we felt at least he made the effort of trying his best. finally he told us if we want to get a room in the new tower or a better view we should request earlier but we were thinking we were here earlier that day and made the request pretty early. we believe at that time many rooms were not check out and we were willing to wait for a better room. danielle completely refused to help us and we felt like a 4 star hotel with a 1-star service.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Wow”
Reviews.Author: spggold
Reviews.Content: Excellent choice for downtown hotel, right next door to stanley park, lots of resturants and shopping. The boat house was our favorite seafood fix, great miso Halibut, try the tuna taco it was in walking distance at the end of Denman street, there is a nice safeway about midway to pick up the forgotten and bottled water. Sign up for thier Safeway card and save some $$$. Spokes (bike rental) is on this street also . Rent for 3 hours for a great experience at Stanley park bike path or rent for the day and take a ride to china town. Downtown Vancouver is very bike and pet friendly. The Westin has remodeled the interior and working on the outside of the hotel. Nice outside and inside heated pool. Great Staff makes for a great Experince! Will go back

Reviews.Title: “Great views and location”
Reviews.Author: jubeefish
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed 2 nights at the Westin Bayshore as part of a two week vacation in Canada and Alaska. We were given a room in the main building that overlooked the pool and the inlet across to Stanley Park. Love the sliding door/window that opened and allowed us to feel outside in our 8th floor room! The room itself has been recently updated, but is a bit small. We had a king bed, fridge, nice flat screen wall mount TV, desk, chair and footstool. We didn't have enough room for our 4 pieces of luggage so we were constantly stumbling over them. There was no tub in the bathroom, just a shower with an overhead spout (I guess like rain). The shampoo and conditioner were in containers on the wall that while eco savy is still kind of tacky in my opinion. The hall ways were very dated and dark, but the public areas on the 1st floor were bright and welcoming. We checked out the pool and work out room but didn't use them. Didn't like the idea of having to walk through the lobby in our bathing suits to get there. Overall a nice hotel in Vancouver with awesome view and an incredibly friendly and helpful staff. Everything in the hotel (parking, food, etc.) was extremely overpriced, but there are plenty of good places to eat within a good walking distance and being able to see and walk to Stanley Park made it worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful location and great service”
Reviews.Author: bbon98
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin Bayshore was wonderful. My husband and I live in Vancouver and we wanted to have a vacation that was close to home, but not at home. The location can't be beat. Close to Stanley Park and to the marina it felt like we were in another city. We walked along the broadwalk and enjoyed the little shops. Dinner was excellent in the hotel and there are many eateries around the area. Pros: View was wonderful Room was lovely with a great bed All requests were met Cons: Hotel does overbook (it was the hockey playoffs) we were moved around. There really isn't a balcony to speak of No bathtubs Overall we loved our stay and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, grimy and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: JimmyD613
Reviews.Content: I travel a fair bit internationally with work, and I must admit the Westin Bayshore definitely does not stand up to the Westin's usual high standards. The hotel is old and tired, with stained carpets and beat up walls in the guest wing halls. Our room was on the seventh floor of the 'original' hotel, with a fantastic harbour view. Unfortunately, with the view came the noise. The windows are single glazed, and do not do much to block the noise from the boardwalk below. We had to call at 10:30pm for earplugs in order to try to block out the noise from the concert across the water in Stanley Park. The room was okay, but not stellar. The bedsheets were clean - no so the bed skirt, which sported an uncomfortable brown stain. The white cloth chair in the room was appalling - more grey than white, with obvious grime on the armrests and seat. Saturday evening service left a bit to be desired, as well. When we arrived there was only one person working at the check in desk - and later, when we went down to check with the concierge regarding things to do around the hotel, there was a sign on the concierge desk instructing us to speak to the front desk attendant for assistance... Finally, watch out for the extras. Between daily parking and internet fees, you'll be in for at least fifty bucks' more than what you signed up for. All that notwithstanding, the hotel location is VERY convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: krellres
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful, facing the Harbour front, the beds were extremely comfortable. Parking was expensive. Staff was friendly and helpful. Would definately reommend staying in this hotel, when you travel to this area. Great location and trolley tours pick up at this hotel also.

Reviews.Title: “A great choice”
Reviews.Author: United858
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few nights prior to a cruise. Location is amazing! The proximity to dining, waterfront activities and all things Vancouver is perfect. Being next door to Standley Park was super and not something I had researched. We rented bikes and had fun riding through the 1000 acre forested park next to the hotel! Wow. Platinum friendly - nice upgrade. The room was not ready upon arrival at 6 pm - poor form but they were quite nice about it, apologetic yet friendly. $75 in bar credits worked things out and room was ready in 30 min. The desert was amazing by the way. A special shout out to bellman Abe who was super helpful and gracious. He was there for us. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great, friendly hotel, Beautiful Setting”
Reviews.Author: livelaughlove1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Westin Bayshore for one night before the Santa Claus Parade. Our check in was seamless and because we have three children, we were given a very large room with space to spare for a rollaway bed. The view of the mountain skyline and Stanley Park were breathtaking. The beds were comfortable, room was spotless, and the bathroom amenities plush. This hotel is in Coal Harbour, on the seawall and within walking distance to the park. It is also within a walkable distance to the convention center and Robson Street. There is an outdoor and indoor pool, restaurant, and Starbucks on premises. Parking is very pricey ($36), but our Hotwire rate made it seem not so bad. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great summer location in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: HarrhAm
Reviews.Content: The only drawback is the lack of a good restaurant in the hotel. The pub and restaurant serve very ordinary food although there are several excellent restaurants within walking distance. Winters in Vancouver are wet so we don't stay there in winter.

Reviews.Title: “In a word - gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: BeachMumToronto
Reviews.Content: Location, location!! This hotel had the best location, I could not have asked for better. The rooms were stunning. A beautiful hotel and great food at the Seawall Restaraunt.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, great location with beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: JBradleyR
Reviews.Content: Great hotel overall. Very nice, sizable room, extremely clean, and beautiful views of vancouver harbor and Stanley Park. Wonderful Spa! One of the best massages I've had. Good room service, breakfast options, and a Starbucks on site! Good conference center for the meeting. very quiet overall, especially for a hotel with such a large conference center. Great access to the harbor, restaurants, and the park - short walks for all. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “one of the worst hotels where i stayed”
Reviews.Author: henryschoice
Reviews.Content: Do not est a clam chowder.I got a food poisening. The hotel is not a 4 star hotel in friendlyness and service the food is poor and expensive. People are nice but the quality stinks from the head (management) They ruined my holiday

Reviews.Title: “Poor on customer service skills”
Reviews.Author: NycApple
Reviews.Content: As a world business traveler, I’m very disappointed of the customer service that your hotel has provided. Today, I called the operator to ask for the possibilities of a late check out at 1:30 PM, the person over the phone (“Shiani”) yelled at me, stating “the latest is 1 PM”, I even told the gentlemen, “its ok, but can you please be more respectful when you are talking with me over the phone”, and he continued arguing, rather than communicating. The check in experience was very poor in welcoming me upon arrival. I’m here for a conference and I have to come next month for another event, which I’ll make sure not to offer my business to this hotel. I travel around the word for about 20 weeks per year, and I have quite extensive experience with hotels. I have to say that the Westin Bayshore hotel staff has very poor customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with lovely staff in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ausnic80
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon and loved it. We were upgraded to a king room with a harbour view and the room was amazing! We could watch the seaplanes and boats coming and going on Coal Harbour. The hotel is within walking distance of downtown and a lot of sights with Stanley Park a short walk away. The staff were very friendly and helpful, helping us out with directions, restaurant recommendations and all our other questions. From the outside the hotel looks a little dated but the interior is great, clean and modern. We would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JLynne52
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a business meeting/conference. Because I am a Starwood member, when I checked in the gentlemen at the desk upgraded my room without telling me. What an incredible surpirse when I opened the door to find a corner room overlooking the bay and mountains!! It had two walls of sliding glass doors and a large patio/balcony. It was wonderful!!! I was in heaven! The room was clean and very spacious with king sized bed and plenty of desk space for work. Also, a refrigerator! It was luxury! The gentlemen who checked me in, Mr. Michael Farguhasan, was delightful and very personable. All staff were pleasant and greeted guests everywhere. I liked the fact that they have gone "green" and ask guests if they would like to participate in that program by not having all towels replaced each day nor have the sheets changed. I like that environmentally aware approach. The meeting accomodations were also very comfortable and the conference meals were excellent! As was room service. And it is totally tobacco free! The gift shops had very nice merchandise too. I spent way too much! This hotel is located next to Stanley Park which made it very easy to walk each day and access some activities by foot. I went to the Vancouver Aquarium, inside the park, one afternoon - only a 20 minute walk with beautiful trees, flowers, and the bay and skyline of Vancouver. There are bike paths and walking paths everywhere. Lots of runners there as well. I highly recommend staying there!!

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: Heilda
Reviews.Content: I recently attended the hotel for a conference all weekend long. The staff was very poor on any customer service skills throughout the entire weekend. However, the rooms were clean and the beds quite comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: anonymous1984
Reviews.Content: I was a the Bayshore for a conference.Tough not to love this hotel. The location on the water and across from Stanley Park is just amazing. Nice facilities, friendly staff, and its close to everything else downtown. One area that the hotel could improve in is to upgrade the appearance of the halls in the old (non-tower) section of the hotel. Rooms are really nice, if a bit small, but the hallways feel a bit like a budget hotel. Love the Asian-influenced decor of the rooms, though, and you just can't beat the harbour view. And, Westin does seem to deliver on their promsie of "heavenly beds". Definelty the most comfortable beds I have slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location ... Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: pignolo62
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Westin for 5 nights. I am an SPG gold member and was upgraded to a junior suite overlooking Coal Harbour and the new convention center. This hotel is perfectly located at the beginning of Stanley Park, and just 10 minutes slow walk (fabulous walk) to the Vancouver convention center. The view is spectacular. If you come to Vancouver you have to stay on the bay, and the Westin was the perfect location as it is in a quiet angle of the bay but still very close to all restaurants on Robson, to the convention center and Canada Place, and of course, just besides gorgeous Stanley Park. I had buffet breakfast at Currents at Bayshore. I also had coffee at the Starbucks that has its own beautiful outside terrace within the hotel, and had lunch and dinner at Seawall grill & bar. All were very good experiences. The staff was always super attentive and polite, reception, concierge, cleaning, room service, a clear sign of a very well managed hotel throughout their departments. I tried also restaurants around and I was impressed with the simplicity and great food at Cardero’s restaurant (further away I had great Italian food at Cibo Trattoria). The Westin shuttle politely gave us a ride to the Harbour Air terminal nearby (not very far, but with luggage it was easier). Room number was 930 on the last floor of the main building. There is also a Tower building. I also had a nice therapeutic massage in the Hotel Spa (Vida), super quiet and professional. Overall a fabulous experience and this will surely be my first choice for hotels in gorgeous Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful quiet and spectacular location”
Reviews.Author: rochne
Reviews.Content: Bayshore is located on the Stanley Park side of downtown Vancouver, a quieter location on the harbour facing the mountains. The tower rooms are a good size and well appointed. Sliding doors open, fresh air, great ! The Seawall bar and cafe has good food / service along with a good selection of gluten free items. The Lift next door on the waterfront has excellent food and service, special place. A small deep indoor pool / hot tub and a nice out door pool heated all year. Outside pool currently being upgraded. Short walk to shopping. My favourite in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: WithaDoggieinSeattle
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon we chose this hotel and we were more than happy with our stay. When we mentioned it was our honeymoon we were upgraded to a corner suite overlooking the bay and it was absolutely gorgeous! The bed wass comfortable (soft but not too soft), the bathroom was modern and spacious, and we really liked that there was a self-programmable safe in the room. The meals in the hotel were a little expensive for what you got, but the amazing concierge more than made up for it. The number of things that their concierge desk was able to help us out with was wonderful!! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but pricy extras”
Reviews.Author: lulubelle45
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business for a week in October. We were upgraded to a suite ith a fabulous view of the water. The room had 2 very comfy beds and 2 tv's with a mini fridge. The closet was in the hall unlike some other rooms having it in the bathroom. Bathroom door didn't lock which shocked my roomate when she opened it not realizing I was there. Internet is pricy as is the parking though our convention paid for this for us. It was a bit if a hassle that the parking is located across the street so if you needed to go to your vehicle you had to gear up for the pouring rain. $36 to park is enough to keep me from coming here on my own, as is the $15 Internet fee. If money is no object, it's a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite how the website makes it out to be”
Reviews.Author: ArcGSD
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Westin Bayshore. My husband is attending a conference here and I'm with him. We've stayed at quite a few not up to par hotels as we've lived and travelled through the Canadian Arctic and anyone who has knows what I'm talking about. So here's my rant about the Bayshore. The room is dusty, there's hand prints all over the glass doors just begging for some windex, same with the mirror in the bed area and the bath area. DUST is everywhere. The curtains are stained and in need of a good wash. They apparently charge a "nominal fee" for internet which is 15.00 a day which is ludacris and not nominal at all. Parking was 36.00 a day for the parking garage across the street now I think it's gone down to 18.00 for the conference. The check in woman was unfriendly. The valet guys are great, so far the only service we've seen was from them from helping with our bags to just being friendly. We are travelling with our dog, so maybe they put us in a bad area of the hotel? But for what they charge a night, come on now. My husband usually is a non complainer but from the elevators being out of service and the poor quality of the rooms even he's said this is unacceptable for a hotel that makes itself out to be a luxury accomodation. I remember being here with my mom for a luncheon 15 years ago and I was amazed by the lobby and how everything had changed and I really expected more from the rooms. Even the bathroom isn't up to par, really just a small shower? My expectations were not met here and I'm pretty easy to please. My friends have told us the Fairmont Waterfront is the place to stay next time we'll take their advice.

Reviews.Title: “I ADVISE YOU TO STOP THERE!”
Reviews.Author: IdentityUnkown
Reviews.Content: I stop at the Westin not long ago. I was allocated in a twin room in the main building. The was comfatable, clean and was just great. They had services that changed your bed covers everyday!. It was a beautiful view and there is a cafe pratically round the corner, (VERY NICE CAFE). If you didnt want to walk, the Westin do provide a shuttle from 9am-5pm (or roundabout). Also, ALL members of staff were extremely friendly and are willing to help. However, the only downfall is that things are quite expensive in the hotel. ($6 for a can of coke) But, i loved my stay and its a truely great hotel, in a beautiful city!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Vancouver - This is an Amazing Pet Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anafricanincanada
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel are the best -the rooms are all great and you are close to Stanley Park - I love the fact that you have a mini fridge for your own use.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Location in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: get0uttat0wn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best location right on the sea wall and across from Stanley Park. It is also very close (5 blocks) to Robson street. Ask for a room in the tower that faces north for the best views!

Reviews.Title: “I expected more!”
Reviews.Author: Elisavil
Reviews.Content: At the arrival our room (2 beds) was not available, so they gave us a king bed room. We were travelling with our 2 years old child and sleep all togheter was not our dream holiday. They have only one restaurant, Seawall. It is not bad, but the service could improve. Once the waiters were not nice and not attentive for our child and gave us a mini table for 3: we didn't know where we could put the plates! They also brought the child food at the same time of our food. They should know it is normal practice to bring first kids dishes. The second night the food was good and we loved our waitress. The room has a tiny bathroom with the cabinet inside of it!! Is it normal? They had the shower only and it was very complicate for us to wash our child. They should think about it!
