The room itself was big enough, but the furniture was no good. I do not understand why fridge was empty. I would pay for that...FULL! Breakfast was very tasteful, but I would have loved an omelette... VIda spa is great. My therapist was super professional and the body wrap was just the cherry on the cake. They should definitely do some renewal in the rooms and in the internal pool as well (the water was too cold and it looked like a community swimming pool, not a Westin's). The view from our room on the tower was really nice. Harbour and Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, loved the Westin Bayshore”
Reviews.Author: seejogo
Reviews.Content: "Can you adopt me?" asked our Trolley driver when he realized we were getting off and staying at the Westin Bayshore Hotel; he must have know Howard Hughes stayed here before, as well as dignitaries from the Winter Olympics. More than the perfectly appointed hotel was the gracious and helpful staff, who went out of their way to assist. The Harbor View room was a delight, watching kayakers, dog walkers, baby buggies and harbor planes go about their business; great view and great people watching from that room. Room service and food/alcohol were EXPENSIVE, but hey, it's the LA of the North. Stay here, jump on the Trolley and check out the little restaurants around the hotel. Not the cheapest getaway but one you won't ever forget. And bring your umbrella.

Reviews.Title: “When it's warm and sunny it's divine!”
Reviews.Author: baggagecarrier
Reviews.Content: We stayed twice in October, both times it was beautiful weather - always a treat in Vancouver. The first stay we looked out over the float plane harbor while we basked in the sun shining into our room and at the outdoor restaurant watching the flights come and go to Vancouver Island and up the rugged coast. The second was time was a view over the yacht harbor (and the wonderful separate restaurant, Lift.) Unfortunately the full service restaurant iln the hotel has been closed except for breakfast - not a real problem in Vancouver with so many choices. The only other complain is that they charge for internet access when so many hotels now provide it free.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, if you don't have a car!”
Reviews.Author: TrentSeattle
Reviews.Content: My family got a good deal on a basic room here off the Westin web site. It was supposed to sleep 4 people, but when we got there we found that it was a single king bed without any pull out. We had the option of sleeping in 2 double beds but didn't think that would work well with two small kids who go to bed very early. So, we upgraded at a cost of $80 to the next level up, which was a junior suite with a separate room (king) and a queen size pullout. That worked perfectly and the room was nice. This was the best part of the stay. Pros: * on the waterfront so you have a nice walking/running area. * next to Stanley park * the room was nice--luxurious really--and the beds comfortable. Cons: * the biggest issue with us was the parking. We drove up from Washington, and after reading reviews of Vancouver decided it was safest to park at their garage. I had read online the cost was about $26. However, when we got there the cost was $36. What really was upsetting about this is two things: the parking garage is totally unsecured in a high-crime area, and it's across the street from the hotel in a public garage! That's a total rip off. There were signs everywhere saying to take all valuables out of the car, it was a high crime area, they weren't responsible for theft, etc. On top of that the Valet was worried about some stuff we had in the car and advised we haul it all to the room. Since that wasn't possible he told us to back directly up to a wall in a corner of the garage so people couldn't break into the back of the vehicle nor a side window. Seriously?? This is what $36 gets? We had no other choice but do it, and I made 2 separate trips out over night to check on the car. I also was lugging bags back and forth to the car. Way too much anxiety to stay at a place like this. * The hotel is being remodeled, which is understandable, but they had a work area in the main hallway to the swimming pool. No slippers were provided, so my family and I had to walk through the work area in bare feet. Not really a great experience. * The hallways and pool of the hotel seem dated. They are focusing on the rooms and lobby updates first. * the bathroom in the room had a sliding door that kept coming off its track. When it did you got locked in the bathroom until someone forced the door back out. A little scary for a kid. * Although the room was nice, it was set on an inside corner. We had a patio (which we didn't use) but had zero view from the room itself because we were in the corner. We looked at a wall (the patio wall) out the window of the bedroom, and out the main room window we saw the other hotel wing. So, overall, good hotel cleanliness, decent location, room was pretty good itself (except the view), the staff was nice, but the parking is a no-go, and they should tell you that a King room doesn't really sleep 4 as advertised. We ended up paying probably $100 more than we should have. There have to be other better places to stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price from Priceline Worth the $ 70.00”
Reviews.Author: comingforthesun
Reviews.Content: We tried Priceline for the first time and got a great deal of 70.00. The room was a King with a habour view which we got as an upgrade because we were members. The rooms are a good size. Our room had no bath, only shower. The beds were comfy and the quilts were great. It is a ways from entertainment or transit. We took a taxi up to Granville as it was raining very heavily. Paying 14.95 for internet is not good. Paying 35.00 for p.arking a night is not good. Luckily we took the skytrain down. If you can get a good deal on this hotel it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: wrldtvler
Reviews.Content: We booked a night through priceline for a great rate that almost offset the $36 a night self park fee ($41 for valet...). The hotel is in great shape and located right on the sea wall. Our room was "upgraded" to a marina view that was a great view of Stanley Park and the Northshore. From the looks of the place, almost all of the rooms would have some sort of water view, but it always helps to be a SPG member even if you book with a 3rd party. The major downside of this hotel is that it is an extra 10mins of a walk from the main downtown areas in comparison to the Marriott, Hyatt, Delta etc. Which is a bit of a pain if it is cold and dark, especially if it is raining. We had a hard time finding anywhere to eat after 11pm on a Saturday night until we went up Robson street. (of course we don't typically eat that late, but it was still annoying). However, the benefit to the location is being right on the seawall and close enough that a short taxi ride can get you where ever you need to go. Also, you can bring your dogs (40lbs or under) for free!

Reviews.Title: “Simply... a stunning experience!”
Reviews.Author: Joburg_Girl_SA
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Westin Bayshore late on Saturday evening after 28 exhausting travelling hours to reach Vancouver. We were immediately greeted by friendly check-in staff and the porter who assisted with our baggage showed us to our spacious room. Despite the fact that we got the room for a bargain on Priceline, we received a complimentary upgrade to a beautiful and highly practical water-facing room. This hotel had it all – two wonderful and most comfortable double beds to choose from, decent coffee/tea maker, great quality complimentary toiletry items (which were replaced daily), plenty of towels and a much appreciated bath which doubled as a shower – with plenty of hot water! The rooms were very comfortable best described as practically furnished – the chaise next to the window was a nice touch! Every morning we were greeted by gorgeous water views through the opening double sliding windows. The hotel is perfectly positioned right on the water’s edge and is only a two or three blocks from the city centre – offering the best of both worlds. Numerous conference/functions being held at the Westin Bayshore never interfered with our enjoyment or movement in and around the hotel. On two occasions the ever efficient concierge made excellent restaurant recommendations as well as reserving a four hour city tour on our behalf. Whilst on the city tour, we regretfully experienced a very unfortunate incident when my handbag was stolen at the very busy Granville Public Market. Upon our return to the hotel, I cannot begin to describe the fantastic compassionate assistance we received from all the hotel’s staff – from the security gentleman who came to our room to remove the little locks on our luggage (keys went with the bag) to the endless patience and utmost friendly assistance received by the telephone operator when we needed to make numerous calls to stop credit cards, mobile phones etc and change a number of flights and hotel reservations. Without our knowledge, the Westin Bayshore generosity even went as far as to pre-pay our taxi fare from the hotel to the airport when we departed Vancouver. I would highly recommend the Westin Bayshore hotel to anyone sharing a similar requirement to us. Thank you Westin Bayshore – we will most certainly not consider staying anywhere else in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: jkbc2010
Reviews.Content: The Bayshore is fantastic! The smell is great, the location is beautiful, and the people are so friendly it's amazing. Check out their outdoor pool in the summer and the unique breakfast buffet. We stayed here recently on a stop elsewhere and splurged for a upgrade harbour view room. it was in the tower and had an spectacular view over the harbour and was much larger than the other westin king's we've been in - all for only $20 more! Parking is a bit expensive (around $30 for valet) but much more convenient than the park yourself option.

Reviews.Title: “Overlooking the water”
Reviews.Author: feedthetraveller
Reviews.Content: Reason for stars: Very clean and great location Rooms: Clean. We were overlooking the water with a balcony. Very comforting Location: Very close to downtown and overlooking the water and a bit of Stanley Park. Value: We stayed for a week and the service/rooms were great. I would definitely return to the Bayshore when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: OceanLove3
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel for $95 on Priceline. The location is great, right on the water. That didn't mean much to us, since there happened to be a huge snowstorm when we were there in November and the last thing we wanted was to be near the water! You can walk to Robson and all the restaurants. Michi Waffle & Espresso on Robson is a must if you're here. We went back time and time again, it was that good! The hotel is a typical Westin, you have to pay for internet and their restaurant is not that good and overpriced. But with all the dining options around here, why even eat at the hotel? We had a car our entire time here and not once paid for parking. I love how people are complaining about the $36/night parking fee. Drive around and look for a spot. We parked behind the hotel every single night without an issue. No meters, no fee. I guess if you want the easy way out and not have to walk a block, you get stuck paying their fee. Just know free parking does exist if you're willing to find it! Overall, great hotel. Probably better in the summer, since we're not exactly winter people and the storm took even the locals by surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location & Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MiamiTraveler076
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on the water with good views... Not directly in the middle of downtown action but only a short walk to Robson Street. Parking was overpriced at $36/night for self parking across the street. Room was typical Westin comfort with great bed and nice sized bathroom & closet. The common areas were OK but not of typical Westin standards.. it was obvious that the hotel had been updated but not fully remodeled. Luckily the rooms were completely remodeled as far as I could tell.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, stunning views of the mountains and Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy128
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vancouver for business often and have stayed at the Westin Bayshore on two occasions. Get a north west mountain/Stanley Park view room and you wont be disappointed as Vancouver is one of the most beautiful cities on earth. The hotel rooms are clean and modern with comfy beds and the hotel is usually lively so you get to meet alot of people around the bar and in the restaurants. Close walk to Robson St. for some awesome shopping and eating and of course beautiful Stanley Park. Desk staff are fast and friendly. Downers: Breakfast was almost $30 and was only average in terms of food quality. Bit of a rip off. I learned my lesson and now eat at the many awesome local diners for breakfast. The dinner in the restaurant was ok but for the money there are a TON of better places to eat in foodie heaven Vancouver than at the Westin. Also, the sea planes landing and taking off can be a bit loud at times but you get used to it as it only adds to the Vancouver experience. When in Vancouver I recommend eating at Rodneys Oyster Bar in Yaletown. Interesting note: On the top floor of the hotel there is a 3000 square foot room that was built for Howard Hughes complete with a grand piano. I talked my way into a quick tour and it was stunning.

Reviews.Title: “digusting room”
Reviews.Author: coby61
Reviews.Content: We booked a nice weekend away which we don't get very often. Used price line to get us a hotel as we like to try different hotels and it is fun to see where we would get. We got a room at the bayshore for a handicapped person. The bathroome was one big shower that you were scared to walk on as it was for wheelchair use not bare feet. No counters in the room for all your toiletries, no bath tub which is always a luxury when we are away. No notice as to letting us know they were booking us for a handicapped room . I would never stay there again or recommend this hotel to anyone. The prices in the dining room are also out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning location !”
Reviews.Author: ChiFT
Reviews.Content: Stunning location, if I am only allowed one description for the hotel. The location is beautiful, the views are stunning. The hotel is going through some renovation at the moment. I had to return to the reception to get another room after checking into my first room. The room next door was being renovated. They had a fan drier to dry the wall paper/carpet I suppose, and the noise coming through the connecting room door was unacceptable. The second room they gave me was much better although another room a few doors away was again being renovated, doors open, blowers on etc, but once in the room, it was great. Very very comfortable room indeed. I could spend the whole day in the room. Food in the hotel - the bar and the restaurant - however, seem quite expensive - was it because it was Vancouver or was it because of the hotel, I'm not sure. It has a Starbuck in the hotel. I love hotels which has a Starbuck in the hotel. Not that I am a Startbucks addict, but they are always convenient for drinks and snacks for during meetings and breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Classy place, good location, tendency to sprawl”
Reviews.Author: jinox
Reviews.Content: Pretty decent hotel this, as one would expect for the money involved, lots of shiny marble and artwork around the lobby and hallways, large roomy rooms which all seem to have balconies, everything smart and clean, some great views and a good location by the park - bit of a walk to downtown but easily manageable and plenty of other shops/bars/restaurants not far away. The hotel itself is pretty large and spread out though, quite often found the walk from one part to another both long and complicated - main hotel bar is down about 500m of corridors from the lobby and conference areas so not ideal for business networking. Food laid on for the conference I attended was mostly pretty good and some of it excellent, never tried the standard breakfast etc but the light meals in the bar were decent too, and not too pricey. Staff were mostly pretty great, friendly and helpful, even after having kicked us out of our room for making too much noise the night before; generally very happy with my week here.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely love the hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: 2Bedfords
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bayshore proved to be above and beyond what we expected. The rooms were spectacular and the beds were oh so comfortable, the service excellent and the morning buffet definitely something worthwhile. We had a room overlooking the bay, which made us want to just sit and look out the huge windows. We were able to watch the float palnes come and go. The hotel is within walking distance to Stanley Park, and the great little hop on-hop off trolley picks you up right in front of the hotel. We will definitely stay there again if we are fortunate enough to return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: AVD29
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Bayshore for an overnight trip into the city. Even though the room was booked on SPG points we were upgraded to a beautiful suite. The room was contemporary, nicely appointed bathroom, great view. The location is great, just a quick walk from Stanley park...we had our dogs with us, so this was bonus. Restaurants within walking distance, Starbucks in the hotel (we didn't eat at the hotel at all). The service at this hotel is truly excellent. We travel a lot, and I can't remember the last time everyone from the front desk staff to the bell-service has been so attentive. Our compliments to the staff at the Bayshore!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, and the pool of course”
Reviews.Author: emandernie
Reviews.Content: Right beside Stanley Park, on the water being able to watch the float planes come in and out, and a great staff made our stay memorable. Rooms are bright and very large compared to other hotels in the region. If you don't want to pay the 25 dollar breakfast, there is a Starbucks on the premises. Off the main drag, it is quiet as well. And then there is the very large round pool with a depth of over 2 meters. You don't see that very often. Our granddaughter had a great time!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Westin in Vancouver ?”
Reviews.Author: replicantScotland
Reviews.Content: If you can pardon the pun in the title, this is a review of the Westin Bayshore in Vancouver. My wife and I stayed here for a week in June 2010. Our trip to Vancouver was for sightseeing and to meet up with some of my wife's cousins whom she last met 32 years ago ! You could say that Vancouver has changed a little bit in that time ! Our 'first' experience of the Westin Hotel group was impressive and its harbour location was ideal to explore the area around including downtown Vancouver, Stanley Park, Harbour tours, Crime Lab restaurant nearby (Fab !), Float Plane trips to Victoria etc, etc. Our contemporarily styled room on the eighth floor had the usual comforts one would expect, including a view of Grouse Mountain (when the cloud cleared away !). Direct streaming of the latest movies to the flat screen TV was a bit of a hit and we seemed to to a bit of 'catching-up' movie-wise this way. Food in the restaurants was pricey but excellent. Service good too. All in all a nice relaxing stay and would visit there again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NDK123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for 2 days in September and could not have been more pleased. The room was beautiful, the amenities were great, and the service was very helpful. We had a room overlooking the bay, which made us want to just sit and look out the huge windows. The hotel is within walking distance to Stanley Park, and the great little hop on-hop off trolley picks you up right in front of the hotel. We will definitely stay there again if we are fortunate enough to return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “great family home base for vancouver sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: TarHeelTraveller2
Reviews.Content: full disclosure - we stayed there on starwood miles - but the westin bayshore far exceeded our expectations of an older westin property. we had adjoining rooms for family of four (kids ages 8&11) facing marina with mountain views. terrific location and very comfortable rooms with upmarket linens. eating and recreation within walking distance or easy cab rides. being next to the park for biking, etc. was wonderful! enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: BCroadtripper1
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to this hotel. 1st was great with a wonderful room overlooking the pool and marina. This time we came for our anniversary expecting a similar rooom as we had purchased a superior room. Instead we got a dingy "handicap"room overlooking the air conditioning and a noisy walkway-no view and in poor repair. When we complained we were told we could have a room with a pull out couch to sleep on! The attitude of the front desk was rude and condescending. Despite complaining to corporate and the general manager there was no redress. We will not be back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: greybunny
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located next to the famous stanley park and the sea wall. The location is very convenient, the hotel is nice and clean and the staffs are hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Pole position”
Reviews.Author: Seawings1998
Reviews.Content: The Hotel couldn't have been in a better position, surrounded by marinas with the buzz of the city one side and the buzz of the float planes the other and a wonderful view of the waterfront. The staff couldn't have been more helpful and the room was a perfect place for us very weary travellers. The courtesey minibus to the downtown shopping ditrict was also very useful and easy to use with a very helpful driver that went out of his way to be of assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: timjed
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great location opposite Stanley Park and looking out over the harbour. All action view with cruise ships, leisure craft, seaplanes, mountains, sunrise and sunset - everything. Comfortable rooms with wonderful beds - very friendly and helpful staff Very good eating along the adjacent marina frontage Easy access to downtown walking, shuttle bus, cab

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, But Noisy”
Reviews.Author: janices7
Reviews.Content: Located right next to Stanley Park and on the bike/walking path that encircles the city, this hotel is perfectly located for exploring the best sites in Vancouver. It is also located near Denman street which has tons of restaurants. Unfortunately, we were placed in the back part of the building that stands only 4 stories tall (as opposed to one of the towers) so our view of the harbor was just OK. I would recommend this hotel to friends if they got a room on a higher TOWER floor. The big drawback of being on the harbor is the noise from the seaplanes and the smell of fuel from the boats. We couldn't really leave the windows open if we wanted any quiet at all. The room itself was decent, but the common areas in the hotel were beautiful. Perhaps that is why they decided to shoot a movie in the lobby and on floor 5 during the 3 days that we were there. Normally, I would think "how fun", but the filming just added to the noise in our room. We were on the 4th floor of a 4 floor building which meant a pebble/rock covered roof was above us. Problem is that they ran cables and set-up equipment for the movie on that roof so from 7 AM until they quit in late afternoon, all we'd hear was crunch, crunch, crunch as workers walked back and forth on the pebbles above our heads. Since it rained all 3 days in Vancouver, we were in the room much more than usual so the constant noise drove us crazy….you couldn't even listen to the TV and forget about sleep. The 2nd day I called the front desk and asked about the noise and told her the problem. At no point did she apologize…instead I got a short response and a "would you like to talk to the manager" to which I responded yes. Of course, I got stuck in voice mail instead of being connected to an actual person. I called the front desk on several occasions and got no answer after letting it ring on each occasion for at least 10 times. I suggested that they not put someone in a 4th floor room in the back building when they know they'll be tromping around on the roof for 3 days, but that got no response and at no point did they offer to move us to an alternate room. Bottom line is that the customer service was abysmal. That said, I am trying not to knock the entire hotel for a few sub-par staff members. The concierge was helpful providing information for local restaurants and shops. We did take a hop on/off bus tour of the city that I would definitely NOT recommend because there aren't that many sites in the city and you basically get shuttled from one hotel to the next with little to see in between. Most of the sites are within walking distance of the hotel with the exception of the Chinese garden which I would recommend taking a taxi to. My husband rented a bike for 3 hours and biked all over Stanley park and the rest of town - he loved it and would recommend taking in the sites that way. P.S. Did I mention the crazy guy across the hall who would sing at the top of his lungs until 11 PM at night?? Maybe I put too much stock in getting sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: CJM123
Reviews.Content: Large hotel right on the water with view of Stanley Park and the Harbour. Staff was very friendly, hotel large, spacious and accomodating. Our first night we stayed at the Marriott Pinnacle and next 2 here. Night and day difference. Loved the Westin. Close to everything and convenient. I stayed in the Towers section. It's further to walk, but quieter and overlooked the park, so very nice. The bar is great, right on the water. I did not eat at the hotel, but the 2 restaurants beside it were great. Out the door you hit the sidewalk where you can run for miles through the park!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: RKH245
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for a few days towards the end of a recent trip to Western Canada. It is wonderfully positioned with great views over Burrard Inlet and the marina, and is within easy walking distance of Canada Place and the city centre. The hotel itself is modern, comfortable, and well appointed. The food is good, the staff helpful, and the whole experience was excellent. We will stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Views with Access to Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: pborist
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Westin -- it had beautiful views and great access to Stanley Park. The staff was very efficient and friendly. Breakfast buffet was a bit pricey for what it was, but we had dinner one evening and received excellent service with reasonably priced and tasty food. If you have a car, be prepared to pay $41/night for valet parking or $37/night self-parking. This is highest I've seen in any city / hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: donny099
Reviews.Content: Location is beautiful - close proximity to Stanley Park; right on miles of walking, cycling & roller blading trails; beautiful views of Coal Harbour; minutes from Robson St; easy access to public transit. Our suite was clean, spacious, and modern; Outdoor pool was wonderful, with lots of towels and loungers, and bar service from Seawall restaurant. Staff was courteous, helpful, very friendly. Restaurants in the hotel were slightly expensive for our taste, but we could walk to any type of restaurant imaginable within minutes. Only complaint is $15 / day surcharge for wi-fi; In a hotel catering to business and conference crowd, this should be an inclusive.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: lil079
Reviews.Content: On our arrival we were upgraded free of charge to a suite in the towers with both a view of the city and harbour. Room was very spacious. lovely modern interior, beautiful beds with the opportunity to 'go green' and not have your room cleaned. If you opted for this they rewarded you with a 5 CAD voucher to spend in starbucks, located in the hotel. Breakfast is expensive but many alternatives nearby. All staff very friendly and polite. Perfect location for Robson Street and wonderful restaurants.Would definately recommend this hotel if thinking of staying in Vancouver and we hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, ok hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: BugLet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in Coal Harbour and is a stone’s throw from everything including Stanley Park, Downtown, Gastown etc. The vast entrance lobby is soul less and the ‘common’ areas and hallways felt tired. Check in and out was ok as was the concierge service. I got the impression that the hotel is geared up for business travellers more than anything else (we were part business/part holiday). We were advised to ask for one of the refurbished rooms which we got. It had terrific views across the bay to the mountains beyond. The room was a reasonable size, but seemed to have too much furniture in it which we were constantly moving around to get to the desk or window etc. The bed was huge and very comfortable. The room had tea and coffee making facilities, along with an empty fridge we was great. This should be available in ALL hotels. The bathroom could have done with being a bit bigger. It had one of those rainfall showers which I ‘m not a fan of as you end up getting your hair wet even when you don’t want to wash it (the plastic caps are never that good). The toiletries were ok. The closet was quite small and located in the bathroom so the clothes kept getting a steaming! We struggled to fit all our clothes on the rail for a one week stay. It has a fitness room and indoor pool which are both quite small. There is also an outdoor pool with loungers etc. The spa is nice, but I found the staff to be a bit condescending. I had a massage which was ok. It’s a very expensive hotel and we wouldn’t have stayed there if we were paying for it ourselves. The food was also expensive. We had breakfast from the buffet most morning as it seemed quite good value compared to ordering everything separately. It offered a good selection of food which looked and tasted fresh. There are lots of extras to pay including parking and internet access which, at something like $85 for the week, was expensive. We noticed that other hotels include this in the price.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Mone100
Reviews.Content: We visited Westin Bayshore with two young children and had a great stay. We had a corner room in the tower which was quite spacious and had beautiful views of Stanley Park and Coal Harbour. We have absolutely no complaints about the hotel and staff, everyone was courteous and helpful. Our kids really enjoyed the outdoor heated pool. The location of this hotel was perfect for us, it took about 20 minutes to walk to the Vancouver Aquarium and English Bay. There are also many restaurants within walking distance from the hotel. We decided not to rent a car and getting around by hotel shuttle, public transit and taxis turned out to be a good option.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ecdev_traveller
Reviews.Content: Definitely a place I would recommend to others and plan to stay at again. Conference facilities were good and the amenities immediately around the hotel are great. Beautiful walking trails and art displays.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location with Spectacular Views”
Reviews.Author: Parlonny
Reviews.Content: If location’s got a lot to do with it, then The Westin Bayshore’s got that, at least, in the bag. Situated right in the heart of Vancouver’s ritzy Bayshore with spectacular views of Coal Harbor and Stanley Park off to the left, the Westin Bayshore is as ideal as it gets when it comes to lodging in Vancouver. To be sure, it’s beginning to show some wear (the establishment could you a little sprucing up here and there), and if you’re one who’d rather leave the kids at home then you may have to do a fair bit of strategic planning in order to avoid those precious little ones. These potential drawbacks aside (depending on your taste, of course), it’s a pretty fine establishment. Check-in was pretty efficient and swift (perhaps given that I arrived pretty late without any other patrons waiting in line), and the attendant was pretty friendly. Rooms are quite spacious with oversized bathrooms and most feature views of the harbor. Usual Westin staples are present – brew your own Starbucks, ‘heavenly’ bedding, bath and body (who doesn’t love those white tea aloe scented toiletries), robes, and, a pretty impressive room service menu. There’s a spa onsite, fitness center with indoor pool, outdoor heated pool, and restaurants like the Seawall Bar and Grill, serving scrumptious fare overlooking the harbor. Westin’s breakfast buffet (you know how I love a good spread) though satisfactory, is a little sparse at $27 CAD. I found that ordering off the menu seems to be a better deal (again depending on personal taste). For breakfast items, Westin features what they call ‘SuperFoods’ which tend be of more nutritional value and rich in antioxidants. I tried the Blueberry and Orange Granola Pancakes and it was quite tasty – certainly recommended. Some tour operators are stationed right in the hotel, so there’s great ease in terms of making arrangements for expeditions right in the lobby area. The Concierge is also always at the ready as well to help if you happen to need assistance.

Reviews.Title: “good location but very poor service”
Reviews.Author: btebte
Reviews.Content: nice location , beatifull rooms but what a pity as far as the service and the personnal is concerned Checking area: they give the feeling that they are paid according to the number of customers they acn check in, no explaination , give the credit card , take your key and good by; Concierge: you ask for information , he answers take all the brochures , they are there for that!! the valet parking cost a fortune: 41$

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay in perfect Vancouver location”
Reviews.Author: MACTA
Reviews.Content: Was a bit unsure where to stay in Van not having been there in quite a few years, eventually choose the Coal Harbour area as a relative of ours lives nearby and we choose the Westin as we are SPG members and got a good price with a 15% discount as we prepaid (booked it 2 days befroe arrival). Glad we did choose the Westin Bayshore as we found it to be a delightful hotel in a perfect location (especially if you want to visit Stanly Park - if you do, you have to try the bike rides!). Its also easy walk to downtown areas, and we even walked to/from Granville Island (about 30 mins each way). Lovely room overlooking the Harbour (majestic views), great bed, and the service was great (eg when the safe locked - due to squeezing too much into it - the engineer was up within 5 mins to rectify it). We only ate once at the hotel but the california cob salad lunch was terrific on a lovely terrace (views nearly as good on the hotel restaurant terrace as on the nearby Carderos restaurant which is worth trying, or The Lift, also beside the hotel, which is worth trying for drinks, didn't eat there). The fitness room was one of the better ones I've encountered in many years using hotel gyms.(didn't use the pool) And they had no problem arranging a later check out for us. While we were there a TV series was being filmed one evening outside the hotel and we had to wait 2 mins or so before we could leave, this was the only inconvenience encountered! The previous review said TV reception was poor, we did encounter this problem but we only turned it on once as we rarely watch TV when visiting locations (even on business, who wants to spend leisure time watching TV!!); and there was no minibar (which I've encountered before in some Canadian hotels, although they did provide a fridge for you to put your own stuff if you like) and there was free bottled water each day; this was a minor issue and overall I'm happy to award 4.5 out ot 5 and recommend Westin Bayshore to anybody visiting Vancouver. Note - we used a private car service for the airport which was cheaper than the hotel quoted ($45 v $75), but this is often the case in hotels not just a Westin Bayhsore issue;

Reviews.Title: “GORGEOUS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelers3_10
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutley amazing.From the moment my family and I stepped through their doors, to the moment we checked out, the westin bayshore had stolen our hearts.We were lucky to get a habour view room that gave us views of the magnificent mountains surrounding vancouver.The heated outdoor pool was stunning.My daughter and I could float around while staring up at the mountians.This hotel is located in an area that gave my family and I access to everthing from restaurants to shops and convenient stores.One of the best parts of this hotel was the beds.Every night we would retire to heaven, they were so comfortable. I would reccomend this hotel to anyone looking for an elegant yet cozy hotel.I loved it here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: BethTO
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we ever arrived at a hotel and had the room already set up with a roll away bed! Room was spacious enough for family of 5. Service was great all around. Extra towels were brought quickly when needed, concierge service was outstanding (Especially Emily who arranged bus tour to Whistler, dinner reservations...). It was nice staying in the city but having water views and easy access to Stanley Park and westside area. Only complaint was crappy shampoo! We used miles for our stay so I am not sure about room rates.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Bed - Hellacious Service”
Reviews.Author: livewelldinewell
Reviews.Content: Location was amazing but the service was terrible. Worst Concierge desk I have ever encountered. We tried multiple people and they were all BAD! They sent us to the water taxi two hours before it opened and couldn't even handle a simple dinner reservation. They were to call and then leave me a message confirming but never did. Took three treks to the lobby, the last 30 minutes before we wanted to dine before it was resolved. Wireless? Forget it. Pay their $20 a day or walk to the Starbucks nearby. What a nuisance and a rip off!! My first and last stay at a Westin. Oh, and bar or food service? Don't bother looking in the lobby. NOT THERE! DId I mention the pool? Don't stay there for that. Plenty of deck space but NO chairs> Also no real security to keep non guests out! Another train wreck from a service perspective.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK accomodations, but watch out for extras”
Reviews.Author: BK13
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for its great location, which was even better than we had expected; great views from most rooms, close to everything, including Stanley Park, waterfront pedestrian areas, nice restaurants, downtown etc. The accomodations were average to slightly below average for a 4-diamond hotel; understated contemporary decor, comfortable bed, flat panel TV but mostly with analog broadcasts (and yes even snowy picture on some channels!), below par bathroom. Our main complaint was inadequate vetilation in the bathroom,combined with placement of the only clauset inside the bathroom. If you used it for hanging your clothes, you we get them steamed at no extra cost! This hotel was not only highest priced hotel in Vancouver (which may be justified because of its geat location) but they nickel-and dime you to death. Self Parking across the street is $36/day (unlimited in and out), Valet parking is $41/day, computer use in the Business center is $6/15 minutes plus extra for prints, internet access in the room (using your computer) is $15/day, plus extras for other amenities. If you want to exchange US currency to Canadian currency be prepared to pay 13% higher than the official rates. The hotel staff was polite but not particularly helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for walks and bikes”
Reviews.Author: WTravelerSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in the month of August. After driving for almost four hours, we arrived around 9pm. The Bell Captain was friendly and asked if we were checking in and needed help with the luggage. We didn't have much so we said no. The front desk was very friendly and accommodating. After checking in and going to our room, I decided to park the car myself since Valet was $41 CND/day (not including tip). The Bell Captain pointed to the self parking lot across the hotel and said this was $36 CND/day! After parking, I went back to the hotel. The Bell Captain was gone and there was a balding Persian Bell Hop at the front instead. I asked whether I can pre-pay for parking so that I don’t have to pay each time I pull the car out. He scoffed a response which was incorrect and gave a lot of attitude. I was turned off by his poor service, so decided to go to the front desk who quickly clarified my options. NOTE to future travelers: DO NOT PARK at the hotel’s self-parking lot! PARK at the “Public Parking” lot to the LEFT of the hotel’s self-parking lot. This will cost you $19 CND/day instead of $36 CND/day – and is practically the same distance. I wish I knew this beforehand… We had a great view of the water and the Sea Walk, however the rooms were a bit dated and probably needed some basic renovation. I’m sure the chairs in the room had really nice fabric at one time, however it was stained and looked a little worn. The showers was great and the bed still Heavenly. There were 2 pools – indoor and outdoor. We didn’t use the indoor pool which was a decent size, and instead used the outdoor pool which was a bigger and great since it was plenty hot that weekend. The hotel is located right on the Sea Walk. It’s a 10 minute walk to Stanley Park where there are plenty of things to do and see (like the must-see Vancouver Aquarium). If you have little ones, there is a cheap and good Petting Zoo in the park, including a 15 min Train ride. There were plenty of people out doing their morning walks. Next time I will bring my bike so that I can bike the entire 2-hour Sea Walk trail. The bikers and roller bladders had their own side of the trail so walkers don’t get run over. If you are hungry, skip the hotel restaurant and walk to Robson (5 min) where there are plenty to choose from (also a good place for shopping). If you want even more restaurant variety, walk down Denman (10 min) all the way to English Bay (20 min) and I’m sure you will find something that fits your palate. Aside from the bad first impression given by the Bell Hop upon arrival, and very expensive hotel valet and self-parking, this hotel is a decent property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, ideally situated but not for families”
Reviews.Author: UbiqueHatter
Reviews.Content: A previous reviewer has stated that this hotel is not suited for the tourist - I agree and amplify that remark to include tourists with children. This hotel is set up for the conference punter who is not spending his or her own money. There are surprisingly few facilities in the hotel and those that do exist are very expensive - breakfast for four cost over C$100! My children were regarded as adults but the room only had two double beds; imagine my joy at having to share a bed with my 14 year old son! In its defence, the hotel is ideally suited for Stanley Park and downtown Vancouver, the pool is the biggest I saw during our 4 weeks in Canada and the staff were incredibly helpful. But, as with all things Canada, bring loads of cash - you'll need it.

Reviews.Title: “Long Term Stay”
Reviews.Author: PHLBizTraveler
Reviews.Content: I recently completed 40 nights over a (3) month period at the Bayshore that was arranged with the great support of their Sales Rep Erwin Mah. I often have long term business in teh city and before this stay at the Bayshore stayed long term at both the Westin Grand and Sheraton Wall Centre. Although each has its benefits I would highly recommend the Bayshore. My previous decisions on which property centered on their location to restaurants, stores etc. and the Bayshore, by no fault of its own, had limited access to "downtown" venues. It always had the most scenic location over the others but the past 5 years it is hands down a great location with access to several great restaurants and cafes to Denman Street that I would recommend has it hands over Robson or Yaletown for local culture. The hotel had renovated its rooms and public space and continues to have some of the best views in Vancouver. What stands out is the manner that it developed to ensure that ones guess experience is never shaped by all the various services one encounters during a stay. From your check in (where after a coup,e of stays I was quickly recognized), the bell and parking staff (that had my car each day on time, to restaurant to the room attendants. One never needs to repeat a request made to anyone or if their was a problem each staff member was made aware of it including Mr. Mah. My long term arrangement was a win-win and Mr. Mah was able to understand the needs of my clients and my own requests that make a difference when one is going to have a home away from home. My room was always as requested, the newspapers always delivered I requested (once it was missed and that evening was a bottle of wine with a apology) and their was always a friendly hello from those that begin to notice you are a "regular" to those that just saw you for the first time. Once A wake up call was missed and one would think the world had ended with follow up calls from management to that evening when I called for my wake up the staff was aware of the problem and stressed on how she would make sure it never happened again (and it didi not). Never once did I need to mention it to anyone but the parking attendant that morning (who wondered why I was off my normal schedule!) but their CRM made sure e everyone that was connected to my stay was aware. I have another three month engagement in the Fall and know where it will be!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but pricey in high season”
Reviews.Author: RRmontreal
Reviews.Content: The Bayshore is a great spot to relax in Vancoucer, you feel like your at a resort, a big pool, views onto Stanely Park, the marina, and the city is right behind you. Rooms are small, looking a little tired. Staff took care of little problems bathroom faucet problems for example.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding position overlooking bay and Stanley Park”
Reviews.Author: CalellaDePalafrugell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked into this hotel for a conference, and we were so well looked after that we decided to stay for a week's holiday afterwards. Our change in plans meant that we had to change rooms, but both rooms gave us stunning views - firstly facing the seaplane terminal & being able to watch seaplanes taking off, cruise ships arriving & movement in the marina; and secondly overlooking Stanley Park. Staff in Seawall Bar were very friendly, and we preferred the bar & deck to the restaurant - the menus were the same. Bedrooms large, but I would have preferred more storage space and a second easy chair. The beds were the most comfortable we have experienced in an hotel for some time and, despite occupancy being 100% whilst we were there, the rooms were quiet. Fortunately the weather was excellent, so we were able to use the outside pool. Otherwise, the indoor pool would have proved too small for the number of guests.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch, friendly service and care”
Reviews.Author: Rabbit12
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I took a nasty spill from a bicycle in Stanley Park. I made it back to my room but realized my ankle was swollen. I phoned to ask for a wheelchair, which was delivered in minutes, followed by a first aid provider who immediately put me at ease and treated me professionally. A handwritten note wishing me well was left in my room while I was at dinner. Later in the week another provider checked on me (also, skillfully) and every staff member I encountered showed me care and concern. It surely made a bad situation much more bearable. Add to that a marvelous location, very tasty food offerings, a spacious and comfortable room, and I'd certainly return. But no more bike rides!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: Pasquali56
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay at the Westn Bayshore. The best thing was the proximity to Stanley Park and Coalshore Harbor. Our room overlooked the Harbor and it was amazing. We could see seaplanes coming and going, North Vancouver -- and part of the Olympic complex. The rooms are very comfortable and the beds are "heavenly" -- as advertised. The restaurant there is expensive. We ate there one night and it was just so-so. But we ate at Ciao Bella another night and had an amazing dinner; it's just a five minute walk away. For breakfasts, we picked up coffee and pastries from the Starbucks right downstairs. If you're looking for an intimate hotel, look elsewhere; Westin Bayshore is a huge conference style hotel. But we really enjoyed our stay there. Like all Westins, the service is stellar. And the location of the Bayshore, in our opinion, is the best in Vancouver. Again, be sure to visit Ciao Bella restaurant no matter where you stay.

Reviews.Title: “Setting, food, room, conference center were all 1st class.”
Reviews.Author: Nan4321
Reviews.Content: Most important to me was the gluten free menu which included about 8 dinners (I had 5) and all were delicious. Additionally they had home made gluten free rolls and buns, which were outstanding! My room overlooked the yacht club and mountians. Everything was clean and neat. I chose the green option several days; no clean sheets or towels, but I had plenty of towels. They gave a $5 voucher to be used for food, which I used! Service for side trips was excellent. The weather was mid 70's and clear blue skies/sunny! Conference rooms (for over 850 people) were excellent; technology was great and food was hot and presented efficiently.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the tourist”
Reviews.Author: chefsu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during our trip to Canada and Alaska First the good points...the location is fantastic and could not be beaten, the view from our harbour view room was amazing but at $600 including taxes was it worth it?? The staff were great. Now the low points...this is a great hotel if you are at a conference and on expenses!! The rooms are not thought out for the tourist market but for people staying on business...most rooms have no bath tub and when we did change rooms to get a tub you had to me mighty quick because the water leaked out!! There is no mini bar, there is NO wardrobe except a small rail IN THE BATHROOM!! hence we spent most of our 5 days living out of cases. The bathroom is tiny with only one small basin, for a room at this price this is not acceptable . The room was for 2 people yet there was only ONE easy chair. If you had breakfast in your room one person had to sit on the bed or at the desk which was large and imposing right in front of the window (as |I said great if you are on business) The corridors to the rooms are drabe and the doors painted a dark brown which makes it look more like a prison block not a luxury hotel. The main part of the hotel is large, empty and cold in our case filled with people attending conferences. There is only ONE bar which closes at 11.30 and was in the main empty and only ONE small resturant open for dinner which at 10.pm we were the only ones in their. The main resturant Currents is only open for breakfast unless your at a conference of course!! The hotel has NO atmosphere, no music playing..nothing except people sitting in small groups discussing business. As I said at the beginning this hotel is not for the tourist market which is a great shame considering the location and the fact that it does have a great pool. However just watch the prices for eating at the pool we paid $120 for a couple of drinks each and a light lunch too much!! This is a very expensive hotel to stay at to feel like a second class guest next time in Vancouver we will not be staying here to pay $600 for a room with a view and nothing else!!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: TCFLongIsland_NY
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels we have ever stayed at. Our room was well appointed, very comfortable, spacious and "green" (environmentally friendly). Great location with a beaultiful water view. A very friendly and competent concierge and bell staff. We encountered no negatives during our two night stay. Would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: dawgstar
Reviews.Content: On the spur of the moment, we decided to drive to Vancouver BC for the 4th of July. Our shetalnd sheepdog doesn't do well with fireworks-so it seemed like a great place for us ALL to "get away". I made a reservation-requesting a room in the main building (which we think is quieter)-and an early check in. We flew through the border, and arrived before noon. After a warm greeting by Todd at the front door, Truman (the dog) and I went to see about checking in. To my surprise-our room was ready! We -and Truman- were welcomed as returning "friends" and helped to our room. Thoughtfully, they had upgraded us to the top floor-at the very far end of the hall-(so super quiet)-with an amazing view of Stanley Park, the mountains and harbor. The staff at the SeaWall restaurant at the Bayshore created a special seating area for us-so Truman could be with us. Rene, James and Ellen took amazing care of us-bring Truman treats and late night scoops of icecream! We truly can't wait to go back-and take in a Canuck's game!

Reviews.Title: “sprawling and abit tired”
Reviews.Author: santafefreak
Reviews.Content: If you want a small, intimate hotel this is not for you. I found it just too big; lots of walking just to get to concierge or elevators. We had to move rooms once because the bed was uncomfortable for my husband's bad back and the second room we got, though larger, had a noisy air conditioning unit which drove me crazy all night long. The housekeeping staff behaved like I was asking for far too much when I called for more dry towels after using ours during the day and then while we were out they left new towels but they never took the heap of wet ones from the floor. Our safe broke and had to be repaired and the line ups to speak to the concierge took forever. The location is fabulous; right by Stanley Park and the view is great but perhaps there are other hotels with more to offer. Breakfast buffets are $27.00 and not all that good. There is lots of food but it's just not that well prepared. Staff can be surly in the morning as they get so busy. There are large tour groups coming in and other business groups using the hotel so it is not cozy. The hallways look drab and tired and the brown glossy paint on the doors and trim just add to the dated appearance. The linens on the bed feel fresh and new and crisp. The internet in our second room was not working and we had to fuss with it to get it going. All in all I found it frustrating although there was one staff person who seemed to work hard to please us. On our first night my son would not even get in the huge outdoor pool as it was filthy with leaves and debris and lots of bird poop. Can't recommend this hotel for the above reasons however the location can't be beat and the views were awesome.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice stay at the Westin Bayshore Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: JFR1Montreal
Reviews.Content: We are a young family from Montreal coming for the first time in beautiful Vancouver. We really enjoyed our stay at the Westin Bayshore Vancouver. The service was perfect, the room was clean and we had a great view on the pool and harbor bay. Also, the kids can enjoy the beautiful outside pool...there is one also in the hotel. At 6 pm. we liked to open the big window (secure) and feel the wind and sun coming in the room for a quick nap! The location is great because it is close from Stanley park and the majors streets (Denman and Robson street). Great hotel with good offers and great views! The only thing that is not great is that we had to pay 15$ a day for the internet... Enjoy your stay...we will come back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, lobby, service, restaurant and location!!”
Reviews.Author: BMWM5Driver
Reviews.Content: Wow, you gotta stay here. It's not as nice as the 3 Fairmont Hotels near bye, but the Westion Hotel does not disappoint for marina location, stanley park location, downtown location, restaurant locations and proximity night life or family fun in the Stanley park Beautiful suite, large glass shower, large desk area, flat panel TV and refrigarator. My room looked over the large but dated pool, and over loked the marina - we loved it. Its a bit noisy becasue of the sea plane airport but we liked being near all the action. Great service from Service Express, super clean and updated room, good checkin process, bell man was helpfull and the concegier was very knowledgeable. Hotel restaruant was good for breakfast, but there are several places in walking distance that are cheaper and kid friendly - including McDonalds for all the parents. Fullservice Starbucks located in the hotel. Stanley park has the Aquarium, the rowers club, great for jogging, weekedn art festivals.... all in walking distance from the hotel. No FREE internet in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Beds”
Reviews.Author: brunswick
Reviews.Content: A great find on Priceline for post-cruise stay. Located right outside Stanley Park and on the trolley hop-on-off line for sightseeing. Wonderful remodeled rooms are roomy and confortable. Noted is the 12 3/4" padding on their "Heavenly Beds." A plus in every room is a large umbrella - often needed in Vancouver. The staff at the Westin Bayshore was superb. They even weighed our luggage prior to departure to be sure we were not over airline maximum. The restaurant was pricey, but expected for the quality of the property. There are many local restaurants in walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great waterfront location”
Reviews.Author: guyledouche
Reviews.Content: Good location on the waterfront next to Stanley Park. A bit overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, located near Stanley Park, but far from downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: JR_in_NYC
Reviews.Content: Spent 1 night here with my wife. We used priceline and ended up at this hotel. We got a good deal via priceline. The hotel is located near the entrance to Stanley park, but a far walk if you would like to see the main attractions of Stanley Park, such as the totem poles or lighthouse. Somewhat far from downtown Vancouver. The hotel is about 4 long blocks from Robson Street where you can find a lot of Asian restaurants. Check in was fast and easy. We were put in the new tower building, room 1482. The tower building is further away from the main lobby so you have to walk farther to get to the elevators. The room was standard size, with a nice modern decor. It had a desk area, two sofa chairs, flat panel TV. The room had a mini balcony that you could actually go out to, but not large enough to sit out there. The bed was a king size bed very comfortable. There was also a mini-fridge. The bathroom was a little narrow, and my wife and I did not like the half enclosed glass stand up shower. It did not do a good job of keeping water from spilling out and cold air from coming in. Valet parking for about $38.00. There was no free wifi or wired internet in the rooms. Overall a nice hotel, would have liked it to be a little closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Usual Westin quality in a beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: megaposer
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights during fall season in the Westin Bayshore. The normal pricing is rather high, but drops considerably after September 30th. Hotel staff upgraded us to a harbour view room as on arrival (possibility was stated in the voucher from our travel agency). The hotel itself is modern and is directly located at Coal Harbour. The area primarily consists of high-end condos and it is just a short stroll to Stanley Park. You can also walk along the seawall up to the Pan Pacific Hotel and Convention Center. Walking down Denman Street is very nice, there are lots of smaller restaurants and shops until you reach English bay. It's not far to Robson street either and you can actually spot some heritages houses on the way. Parking is not free but they gave us ample time to leave our car near the entrance before we returned it to the rental car agency anyway. Standard rooms are a bit on the small side, but immaculate and the Westin heavenly bed really is very good. If you have a lot of luggage, you might feel a bit cramped though. Service is excellent - courteous and professional, though not much smalltalk or chit chat, this is mainly a business hotel after all. Overall it is a very good hotel, a bit farther away from downtown, but situated in a very nice location.

Reviews.Title: “great location, amazing views”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaLA
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for 2 nights. We asked for an upgraded room with a view - for $10/night extra. We were placed on the 9th floor near the suites and it was well worth the extra money (see pictures of room view). It was a little noisey one night because of all the graduation ceremonies that were taking place at the time but when it came time to sleep we didn't hear all the screaming from down below - I imagine this doesn't happen to often throughout the year anyway. The staff was very friendly when we asked for tour information. There is a roomcharge for internet usage and nothing available for free around the area. We didn't use the workout facility but it looked really nice - the treadmills each had their own tvs and the equipment looked very modern. The hotel is located at the beginning of the seawalk next to the entrance of Stanley Park. The rooms were very comfortable - it came with free water bottles, safe, fridge and lots of closet space in the bathroom. A nice feature was the two shower heads in the bathroom! We did not eat at the hotel but we ate at the starbucks located in the lobby area. There is also a nice restaurant a few feet from the hotel that has a nice view of the waterfront and downtown skyline. The Westin is a great hotel and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely beds, nice bathroom!”
Reviews.Author: IDICarol
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 2 or 3 times now. This past time is with a renovated bathroom (lovely). We were in the main building (rather than the tower) for 3 nights. The beds are heavenly (yes, they do live up to their names!), the staff friendly, the bathrooms modern. My only concerns are 1. The hottub (inside) is heavily chlorinated 2. The moisture build-up on the patio doors results in mildew, which was apparent in the track 3. I'm a very light sleeper, so the float planes in the harbour woke me each morning. 4. Parking is expensive $31/day Apart from that, it's a great hotel, in a fabulous location and we had no problems whatsoever. BTW, I travel a lot for business in first class hotels because I recommend destinations and properties to clients for meetings and incentives. My standards are probably higher than most travellers but then again that's part of what I get paid for!

Reviews.Title: “Off to a bad start but the Bayshore made it right!”
Reviews.Author: KimS29
Reviews.Content: Our party of four stayed at the Westin Bayshore for one night before departing on a cruise in mid May. This was to be our last night on shore of what had been a wonderful trip throughout the Canadian Rockies and drive over to Vancouver. A special evening had been planned to commemorate our very special journey over a year in advance. Vancouver is a beautiful city and since we had only one day and night to explore , our plans were many. As a SPG, I expect quality and value a nice place to stay. Upon arriving early we had been advised our rooms would be ready by 3:00 PM and one room was. Too shorten an otherwise lengthy story the second room was not available until 7:00 PM. Our reservations for dinner and the wonderful evening we had planned had to be canceled and anger and frustration took hold. Being tired and distraught I spoke to the Westin assistant manager, Nelia Santos. She listened and acted quickly to help make a terrible situation tollerable. She not only arranged for our dinner in one of the Hotels restaurants but saw to it tthe Hotel picked up the tab, we were able to salvage the evening afterall. The restaurant manager and staff was put on notice and they all saw to it that everything was wonderful. After a great nights sleep we were off on the second leg of our trip, the cruise. The Westin is a lovely property, located next to Stanley Park. We wish we could have stayed longer. If we ever make our way back to Vancouver we would love to stay here again. Our thanks goes to Nelia Santos and the management and staff at the Sea Wall Bar and Grill for taking a bad situation and turning things around, you saved the day and quite possibly the trip, truly!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest service imaginable”
Reviews.Author: ishkdf
Reviews.Content: We went to the Westin and were blown away. We had reserved a suite, but when we got there, they were overbooked and offered us a small room (with a great view) for a very discounted rate. When we returned a few days later, they gave us a much nicer room, but at the same rate. The food was great and the place was beautiful and the concierge had the best restaurant recommendations. Great location with an amazing view of the park and marina and a giant pool. You have to go there if you're in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to par with other Westins”
Reviews.Author: yuantsai
Reviews.Content: Westin Bayshore does not live up to par with most Westin hotels. We stopped here for one night before embarking on a cruise. When we arrived, the place was disorganized. Cars were everywhere and no valet attendant in sight. Apparently there’s a prom that night and the place was in chaos. We waited over 20 minutes just to check in. I am a Platinum member and there was no special service for Preferred Guest. The receptionist said I got an upgraded room but we merely got an average room on the 10th floor, not even a SPG floor. The room was worn and nothing special to justify the over $200 price tag. The hotel location was also off the city center. No much around except for Stanley Park if that’s what you’re here for. Otherwise it’s a good distance walk to Robson Street for shopping & restaurants. Parking was also terrible at a $31 self park per night. Overall with a bad experience and disregard for SPG status, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “They go over and above”
Reviews.Author: kvw
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Westin for an International conference - everything was fantastic! The food at the conference was excellent and generous. The staff who were helping with the conference were wonderful, we could not have had a better experience. We organized a "fun run," and had heard that part of the seawall at Stanley Park was closed. I went down to ask the concierge whether this was the case. The concierge (Norton), said he had run there the week before and it was open, but then said that he would go run after his shift and phone me to let me know if it was open - we were amazed! He did run the route and left a message for us on our room phone, it was incredibly helpful since we had 70 + people running the next morning! That is just one small example of how all of the staff went above and beyond. the location is exceptional, the rooms all very clean, the food very good. and the infrared sauna was also wonderful - worth a visit! Definitely would host a conference here again!

Reviews.Title: “Past Middle Age, But Still A Comfortable Date”
Reviews.Author: Jaquesspratt
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a ‘harbor view’ room in the main building of the Westin Bayshore, Vancouver, in mid May. The hotel was our favorite place to stay in the 1970s and 1980s, so this visit, post a renovation a few years ago, was of considerable interest. First the bad news. The once convenient parking lot, an integral part of the hotel property, has been replaced by building development. Guests’ cars now have to enter the cavernous parking basement of an adjacent condominium development. Although self parking is a stated option, most of the spots assigned to the hotel read ‘valet parking only’, forcing some, I’m sure, into this track in busy times. Self parking for us ran $31.00 per 24 hours. The lobby renovation has rendered the previous incarnation even more austere. Elegant-in-marble to be sure, but not warm. The room we were assigned was rather spartan– the norm in the main building – and had an adequate if tiny bathroom. Although sporting a flat screen TV courtesy of the latest renovation, the cable reception was quite poor, not that one would wish to spend much time at it in this environment. Of the two ‘Happy’ housecoats provided in the room, one was shop worn and yellowish. House publications in the room failed to provide any useful information about the bars and restaurants in the hotel, and except for the outrageously expensive room service breakfast menu, no other was found. A final blow: the invoice slipped under the door contained a double billing for the parking. Now the good part. The property still exudes understated class. Much of this derives from the spectacular physical setting, adjacent to Stanley Park, and right on coal harbor. The rest comes from the many moneyed guests who drive up in their Lexus,Bently and similar pedestrian vehicles, most with USA plates. The popular bar, in the wing that once contained Trader Vic’s restaurant, is warm, marine themed, and a touch tropical. It’s clearly meant to appeal to folks attending the big conventions which this iteration of the hotel is designed around. No tables for two, just for parties of 4-6 or more. We didn’t eat at the hotel on this occasion but the appetizers being served in the bar looked very attractive and were reasonably priced. The main restaurant has historically been expensive, but then, so has the hotel in general. The chefs seen in the corridors on occasion appeared to be very professional and seasoned. The beds in our room were almost as good as the Westin logo ‘heavenly’. The room was a wonderfully quiet environment looking over the interior garden pool and harbor. Those desiring a larger, more modern and of course more expensive room can book into the Tower building, where Howard Hughes camped out in the entire top floor for months near the end. There is a great looking indoor pool and gym, neither of which we visited on this occasion. There are several useful shops in the hotel, including a full-fledged Starbucks which opens at 6AM. The marine walk, surrounding the coal harbor sides of the hotel, is spectacular, and takes you past acres of amazing power and sail craft, as well as a chic new over-the-water bar and grill called ‘Lift’. The‘Cardero’s seafood restaurant is encountered nearby. The restaurant rows in West End Vancouver, commencing on the start of the infamous Robson and Denman streets, are less than a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best”
Reviews.Author: salvatoremike
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. From the customer service to the food, the rooms and the views. The location is one of the best factors too. It is central to everything a tourist would ever want to see. Stanley park is just a hop skip and a jump away. I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointingly Not the Westin Standard”
Reviews.Author: Rigs_10
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Westin hotels all over the world and this hotel is the bottom of the barrrel for the Westin franchise. My accomodations was made through a Montreal based travel agent Zeste Incentive which is equally horrible in their quality of service. Very unhospitable! Their head of staff , Brigette Mondor is totally incompetent. I would recommend for future guests of the hotel to deal directly only with the duty manager if you ever want anything done. The housekeeping service is reasonably good but the front office ,especially on check-out is hardly worth mentioning. Very disappointing indeed .The travel agent and the hotel sure needs some lessons in hospitality.. This will be the last visit to this hotel and I wouldnt recommend the use of the travel agent Zeste Incentive unless you are dealing with a different team leader.

Reviews.Title: “There is nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: magpie1998
Reviews.Content: In my work, I see an awful lot of hotels. And over the years I have become increasingly picky and particular about the sort of place I stay at. Those places have to look after the small details. The staff has to be pleasant and helpful. Thee food has to be good. The beer seelection in the bar needs to be interesting. The room has to be clean and comfortable. The Westin Bayshore is all of that. And the location on Coal Harbour, near Stanley Park, makes it even better. There is absolutely nothing to complain about at this hotel. OK, there are no coffee mugs with the in room Starbucks coffee. But that's a pretty small complaint when everything else is pretty well perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Beautiful View, Good Food, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: duncanjd
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to note what a great job the the staff of the Westin Bayshore did in late April in hosting a week of G8 Roma-Lyon meetings in Vancouver. I have been to a lot of these meetings over the years and I know how much attention to detail is required to make things work out well. The meeting rooms were comfortable and functional, the breakfasts and lunches were very good, the coffee breaks were well done, the reception was top-notch, not only the location overlooking the marina, but the food and drinks, and the hotel staff was kind, courteous, friendly and helpful. My room was fantastic, overlooking the water, and the view of the mountains and the marina was spectacular. In fact, it is difficult to find a view that is not beautiful in Vancouver. The hotel is beautifully situated right on the water, has great public areas and, of course, my favorite a Starbucks right in the lobby area. Some of my colleagues enjoyed swimming in the heated pool and going to the very classy spa at the end of a long day of meetings. I say to the Westin staff, congratulations on a job exceptionally well done, and I have written the hotel manager to let her know how well her staff performed. It has been a very long time since I wrote in praise of a hotel, but I thought that exceptional service and hard work should be encouraged and praised. I also copied our Canadian counterparts who were responsible for setting up the meetings so they would also know what a great job the Westin did. John

Reviews.Title: “There is no hotel better.”
Reviews.Author: Betty_123321
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and as far as we are concerned there is no other place to stay in Vancouver. We enjoyed our stay very much and would definitely stay there again. The staff is excellent and I would dary anyone to say otherwise. All of them go the extra mile for guests. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: TorontoTeresa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Bayshore in April 2010 for a business conference. The hotel is in an excellent location and both Stanley Park and the downtown area are a 10 to 15 minute walk away. Our room in the tower was very nice although quite small. It had a vew of Stanley Park, but the balcony was not big enough for a chair, so we could only enjoy it from inside the room (it would have been nice to be able to sit outside). Service in the hotel was consistently excellent. Every staff member I dealt with was friendly and efficient. The room was quiet (except for noise from the marina outside) and the common areas of the hotel were always spotless. The fitness centre was okay but the pool was not big enough for swimming laps. There were a few small things that surprised me at a hotel at this price point (my room was $289 a night). First, they seemed a bit stingy with the in-room suplies. There was no sewing kit, no shoe shine cloth and no city guide. Small things, but when I get to a strange city in the middle of the night, I don't want to leave the room to look for supplies and info. There was a coffee maker with a good selection of Starbucks tea and coffee, but it only came with 2 paper cups, 2 individual creamers and 3 sugar packets (they were replaced daily). Again, a bit stingy, and since there were no coffee mugs in the room we could not make more than one cup of tea or coffee each. The first day we had breakfast at the buffet downstairs and I was not impressed. It was $26, and the waffles and bacon I selected were cold and hard. When I spoke to the hostess, she had the kitchen make me a fresh order, but the supplies on the buffet were not changed. Some items on the buffet were finished and were not replaced. Finally, the room came with a card stating that customers could help the environment by declining room service. If you chose this option they will give you a $5 voucher to use in the hotel restaurants. This seems to be a new trend in hotels, but I find it truly ridiculous. How does it help the environment if my room isn't cleaned? They only change the sheets if your request it (which is fine with me), but if I'm paying close to $300 for a hotel room, I don't want to make my own bed and clean my own bathroom. It seems to me that they are using the environmental angle to get away with offering less service. On a related note, there was no bottled water in the room and a sign urged guest to help the environment by drinking tap water. That's a nice thought, but when I'm in a stange city and heading out to do some sight seeing, it's nice to be able to grab a bottle of water to take with me. If hotels are serious about helping the environment, maybe they should provide reusable water bottles or coffee flasks (I ended up buying both at the Starbucks downstairs for $12 each).

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: dennistarrant
Reviews.Content: I was absolutely floored with the high level of customer service and attention to detail. From the first impression valet car service to Nelia at the front desk on our check in; it was non-stop friendly, courteous, accomodating, respectful, attentive and service driven. I cannot wait to return here for some personal down time. Of course having a view of Stanley Park, the mountains and the ocean was a major plus in making our stay a memorable experience!
