Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with an amazing view, but may not be worth it to all”
Reviews.Author: bhseuh
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here over Easter weekend. This was easily the nicest hotel I have stayed in to date, and that includes all aspects of things - room, staff, amenities, etc. We booked it specifically for the view, and it certainly lived up to expectations. We stayed in the main part of the hotel (not the rennovated Tower), in a Harbour View room. The full length sliding windows are a wonderful feature, which really allowed us to enjoy the view. We looked out straight over the marina, with a nice slice of the city to the southeast and the water/mountains to the northwest. Watching the pontoon planes land and takeoff was a highlight of the trip. Watching the joggers on their way to/from Stanley Park in all sorts of weather did have a way of making one feel like a wuss. The room was very clean, and all furnishings were in good shape. The bed was comfortable enough to make me want one at home. We never once heard a sound from other rooms, save the occasional water flow through pipes. The hotel pool and hot tub were clean and comfortable, though it was too cold to try the outdoor pool. Everyone we spoke to who worked at the hotel was very kind, helpful and friendly. The location is also nice, depending on what you're looking for. It is in a bit of a quieter area, which we found extremely nice. Stanley Park is an easy stroll away, and a few blocks over are plenty of food options. Starbucks is in the lobby if you don't want to walk one of the 37 others within a two mile radius. My only possible gripe is with the price. Parking at the hotel, as in most major cities, is expensive at ~$30/day, but probably the easiest option. Breakfast, which we did not partake in, is ~$20/day/person. Internet is ~$15/day, and there is no free public access computer to use as an alternative. The overall price of the room is not outrageous, given the quality of the hotel. It was just a bit irksome that anything extra had a fairly hefty price tag attached. As a whole, however, I really enjoyed my time here and can't imagine staying anywhere else if I find myself back in Vancouver. I would highly recommend the Westin Bayshore.

Reviews.Title: “Its location next to the park makes it one of the best, relaxing places to stay”
Reviews.Author: WestCoaster31
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love this place. First of all it's located right next to Stanley Park, which is a huge, beautiful park that offers great views of the city skyline. It's a lot of fun to go out for walk or jog first thing in the morning. Secondly, the views are great. Even though you're in the heart of a major city you feel like you're almost away from it all. You wake up and you look at the snow capped mountains or the harbor. The staff at this hotel have always been friendly and willing to help. You can walk to the heart of Robson street in 15 minutes. They do have a shuttle from the hotel, too, that will take you there and pick you up. I believe it leaves every 30 minutes. The breakfast at the hotel is hearty but I have to admit, a bit pricey, so there are other little cafes near the hotel to get something to eat. The rooms are all nicely renovated and quite relaxing. There's a big conventional hall that's a part of the hotel but when it's busy you're life at the hotel is not impacted too much. If you want the mountain/sea views make sure you ask. And, the higher up you are the better the view you get. The biggest selling point of the hotel is it's location and of course, Westin comfort. You sacrifice extreme close proximity to the heart of attractions but it's really worth it and shopping, restaurants and what not are totally accessible by foot, the FREE hotel shuttle and/or taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, best location in Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: SaskTraveller5
Reviews.Content: After check in, my wife and I found 2 double beds looking onto a brick wall, so phoned down, desk indicated maybe change in a few days. Went to talk in person, clerk indicated move in a few days, asked for manager, he indicated move that after noon, and recieved king bed and view that we had booked 10 months prior. Good end to frustrating beginning. A beautiful hotel, rooms exceptional, restaurant too pricey for me. However, the location is the big benefit. Right next to stanley park, we walked through the park every day, around the sea wall one day. Walked up to the Aquarium, to various beaches,, rented a two-person bike one day. There are tonnes of restaurants within walking distance, and we ate African-Indian-Greek-Other every night. Walked to imax one night, took in 'Spamalot' by walking and taking the sky train. Very nice hotel in an absolute perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: My room was in the older part of the hotel (not the tower). The hallway leading to my room was rather dated and a bit shabby - however my worries were alleviated when I entered the room. The room appeared to have recently been updated. The bathroom tiles were gleaming, and there was tons of bathroom counterspace and storage room under the sink. The room itself was very spacious with a large computer workspace. Flatscreen TV and the clock radio accomodated an iPod. My room had a view of Coal Harbour in one direction and downtown in the other direction. The hotel staff were very nice and helpful. Umbrella in the closet was a nice touch! Very nice promenade along the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great views over the Vancouver Bay and beyond”
Reviews.Author: MagellansTours
Reviews.Content: We stayed here early January. The hotel is well placed for some of the main attractions (Stanley Park, Aquarium & Trolley) but is a reasonable distance to the main shopping areas downtown, although it is a pleasant walk along the shoreline. We had a clean, spacious double room with 2 queen sized beds in “The Tower” on the 11th floor overlooking Grouse Mountain. The beds were high but very comfortable and each covered with 2 large duvets. The room had a large flat screen TV and coffee making facilities (Starbucks). The room had good air conditioning, but that was needed as the windows seemed to be only single glazed, but even in January that was not a problem. The only poor thing about the room was the small bathroom and very shallow (eco) bath and that Wi-Fi came at a price. The pool in the health centre is small, but the outside pool is heated. There are several bike rental shops close to the hotel so it easy to hire a bike and cycle around Stanley Park and more.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Amazing staff+ the best food in the restaurant”
Reviews.Author: helensnow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last two days of our trip. Located right next to stanley park and also easy reach to Robson street and gastown was perfect for us. We will stay here each time we travel to Vancouver now. We checked in early and the room was ready and also asked for a late check out were they replied ; what time wuld you like to check out' We left at 3pm. They didnt charge us anymore Swimming pool and spa needs a bit updating but its ok. We eat at the restaurant located in the hotel and it provided gluten free meals along with normal meals. I eat the gluten free meals and OMG they were amazing

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay before the craziness of Olympics begin”
Reviews.Author: PaulTheTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Nice stay for a business trip. Comfortable rooms with nice views of the marina and mountains beyond. Close proximity to shops and restaurants on Robson St. (3 blocks away). Overall a nice stay and experience.

Reviews.Title: “smelly stale room!”
Reviews.Author: SPfreqTraveller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times before due to it's wonderful proximity to the seawall and downtown. Was so very disappointed this time with the room air quality (top floor harbour side view on 8th floor). It smelled old and stale (like old cigarette smell), and it appeared that new cigarette smoke was coming in from the warm air vent when we returned after dinner which is weird since they say they are smoke free. We called the front desk and said all they could do was put an ozone fan in there. Left the window open all night but smell did not go away...appears to be permanently in the rug and room. We booked this stay for a special birthday celebration and at the time of booking, we were trying to get an entire week at the Bayshore however, Bayshore was only able to provide the final 3 days so we booked the first 4 days with Westin Grand...what a difference! Westin Grand is wonderful...clean, fresh and impeccable service with personal touches everywhere. They even come by with water and fruit in the evening if you're home. Would stay at Grand before Bayshore next time. Gave this feedback to the Bayshore...they only offered a possible upgrade next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, overall nice hotel (not as new)”
Reviews.Author: ihatetourists
Reviews.Content: Here's the bottom line: location-wise you can't beat Westin Bayshore, it's right on the bay, across Stanley park (as you can guess from the name). Pay extra for a room with Bayview, you can see the bay, the mountains in the background, and planes landing on the water - you won't regret. The property was not as new - actually it looked pretty old and worn out. The service was nice, no issues. The only complaint I have is the construction noise - they placed me right in the epicenter of the renovation. But other than that it was worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Escape from the real world”
Reviews.Author: gmills003
Reviews.Content: The Westin Hotel Bayshore Vancouver is along the Bayshore drive and Cardero street. It is great to stay in here at The Westin Hotel Vancouver because of the oceanic view from outside. It is also away from the crowded places which most people go in to. The Stanley park is very accessible that you can walk to the ballroom within less than 5 minutes, adding up to this benefit it is also an exercise to walk. You can also walk from the hotel to Yaletown thou it's quite far. The hotel lobby has a very calming view with the mountain view and the trees. you can swim thru the outdoor pool with complete amenities and facilities and they also have the indoor pool as well. you can also workout on the gym if you feel the need of being healthy and physically fit. The hotel setting has full-lighting exterior at night. Guest rooms have the same scenery like to the view at the hotel lobby. They have the complete table setting for the currents restaurant and they also have the Seawall Bar & Grill, Patio for an outside view. Every meal plan is set according to the guests. They have the grand ballroom and The Stanley Park Ballroom used as function rooms whether you'll have your business meetings or any other kind of celebration. The hotel staff and crew are very accommodating. They assists me in all the things I want to do and they give a very good service. I met the needs and wants of my trip that time. I've done all the things I should do on my itinerary. I recommend this hotel so anyone who wants to have a relaxing and spacious time. I can really call this place a third place after my home (first place) and my workplace (second place). They have up to 44 Hotel Services which are very helpful for all the guests who stay-in the hotel so that they never have to go anywhere outside just to look for what they need and feel safe inside the hotel. the have this 24-hour customer service which is applicable to all guests that are inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, first time in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: SadSadGolfer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in November, my first time in Vancouver. The Bayshore is an excellent venue for a conference - food was great, service was excellent. Only had to buy breakfast on the first day (other meals were part of the conference package), and it was pricey: $50.00 with tip for two of us for ham & eggs with the trimmings. We stayed in room 1482, recently renovated, very nice, the bed was wonderful! The bathroom did not have a tub, so if you like your baths, better check before you book. Our view was City, but if you craned your neck out of the sliding door you could see the wonderful harbour and mountains beyond. The spa and pool were being renovated, so we didn't have a chance to use them - not a problem for us. Robson St., Gastown, and other central Vancouver attractions are within walking distance. All in all a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bayshore”
Reviews.Author: ucla_kat
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our trip to Vancouver and did not regret it. I love staying at Westins and this was no exception. Great location near Stanley park and to restaurants! The staff was nice and very helpful. The room and bathrooms were immaculate. And those heavenly beds! I wish I could afford one in my own house. Great stay, I would not expect anything less from a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “westin bayshore vancouver”
Reviews.Author: winchin1
Reviews.Content: away from downtown, needs car to travel around, lovely gardens.great "oceon "view from window but noise from activity of small planes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful but pricey with a great staff and a fabulous location.”
Reviews.Author: PugPericles
Reviews.Content: Hotel is large and caters to both leisure and business patrons. Meeting rooms are large and business events a constant. Lobby can be a bit chaotic but the staff manages it nicely. Concierge desk was extremely helpful but was understaffed. I usually had to wait in a slow moving line and / or leave a message for a return call. All service staff are wonderful and do anything they can to help. Food is wonderful but breakfasts are expensive. The fabulous morning buffet is $26.00 / person. A large pot of coffee delivered to my room was over $20.00. There are several small restaurants within a few blocks which are reasonable as an alternative and there's a Starbucks in the lobby. WIFI is not complimentary and the business center is small and unstaffed. Rooms are plush with fabulous beds and linens. We had an ocean / marina view which was lovely. Hotel is great if you're not worried about expenses or are traveling on an expense account.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, upscale hotel, clean, quiet, and magnificent views”
Reviews.Author: soiepu
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before our Alaska Cruise. We were given the top floor corner suite. The suite is very big, including a bedroom, 1.5 bath, and one living room. There is a balcony in each room and the views are incredible. The king bed is very comfortable. The shower is a little small but it is clean and modern (two robes are provided). The hotel service is excellent. The hotel is located in Coal Harbour where there are lots of shops and restaurants nearby. We enjoyed our stay very much. This is a great hotel and we will not hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly pet beds”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyM2
Reviews.Content: wonderful...heavenly Bed's for people & pets...awesome rainshower...

Reviews.Title: “vancouver fall”
Reviews.Author: HelenT3
Reviews.Content: Nice clean & friendly hotel, great position on the marina . Handy for Waterfront and shopping on Robson . Only downside was that internet was not inclusive in the rate

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bendyGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin Bayshore for 1 night on a Pre-Cruise package, the rooms were lovely and we had a room overlooking the harbour allbeit the noise from the sea-planes landing can be a bit off-putting they only land in the mornings and early afternoons. The bed's were very comfortable however I'm 5'7 and found it a bit of a climb to get into them. We ate at the bar/bistro at night and then in the breakfast buffet room in the morning, there was a good selection and fairly resonably priced for a hotel of this standard. The staff were very friendly and helpfuly too, I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: CruiseProTom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin both pre and post Alaska cruise. Especially enjoyed the view from our tower room. Located right on the waterfront convenient both to downtown and Stanley Park. Friendly, helpful staff. Food a little on the pricey side, but good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Pre-Cruise Stays or Vancouver Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: fierycale
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin Bayshore prior to an Alaska cruise on the Carnival Spirit. We enjoyed 4 nights at the Bayshore and found it to be the ideal location for a pre-cruise stay. We were a short walk from Stanley Park, which is a great family destination with its Aquarium, Petting Zoo and Miniature Train ride. We also were close to great eateries and ice cream on Denman St. You can find any type of cuisine you want on Denman's so the choices were endless. Our room overlooked the Harbor and Stanley Park so the views were beautiful any time of day. We also enjoyed a delicious room service breakfast (albeit, it was on the pricey side). As a personal travel consultant with Eden Exploration, I would definitely recommend the Westin Bayshore to my clients looking for a Vancouver getaway or pre-cruise destination. The location is perfect for anyone wanting to enjoy the best sights in Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, quiet”
Reviews.Author: PhiladelphiaDrumdoc
Reviews.Content: Room was not ostentatious, but still pretty nice. Services were very good. Good location--near a park and the water, easy to run, walk in nice scenery. Walking distance of more populated part of the city with good restaurants and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: johnpavlik
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on Coal Harbor and is the perfect location between downtown and Stanley Park. It is deservedly rated four stars. Lovely Asian inspired rooms and a most impressive lobby. We had a beautiful view from our room. The retaurant near the lobby serves only breakfast and it was very good, although quite expensive. It was $26 for the breakfast buffet and $17 for turkey hash and eggs. There is a very fun sculpture of six red men outside the lobby. The hop on and off tour bus stops at the hotel front door every hour. The staff was first rate. Parking was across the street and cost $24 per day. Be careful not to park in a handicapped zone. They are not clearly marked as they are in the U.S. My car was towed and it cost me over $100 to get it back.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: pukie
Reviews.Content: lovely staff. great room. Other guests a little offhand. great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay-again”
Reviews.Author: PartagasCat
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bayshore in early September as a birthday get away. Our second time staying here and again extra efforts made to make the time memorable. Service, staff, accommodations and the view/location second to none. We look forward to a return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful views, great staff”
Reviews.Author: jfoxpubs
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but good things to say about this hotel – my stay at was exceptionally pleasant. The staff could not have been more responsive and accommodating. Through a miscommunication [in my office], I arrived a day earlier than my reservation, to find that the hotel was fully booked. The very pleasant young woman at the desk quickly found me a spot in the sitting room of a suite with a sofa bed. It turned out to be a very comfortable room with a spectacular view! I stayed there for 2 nights, and then the staff moved me to a regular room, and very efficiently moved my luggage -- this room was also very comfortable and had a great view. I was attending a meeting with long hours but also working in the evenings to keep up with my day-to-day work, so I ordered room service each evening – and I was very pleased with the quality of the food. I also appreciated the 24-hour availability of the business center. Every employee I encountered, from front desk employees to housekeepers to the people who delivered meals, was very courteous, helpful, and pleasant. The rooms were more than comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “great trip”
Reviews.Author: bowman99
Reviews.Content: rating: 5 stars starting with check in: the young women that checked us in was very polite to us and answered all our questions. fitness: my wife and i did not use the fitness facilities but i did inspect it. great equipment and iff i did us them i would be very satisfied with the facility. dinning/buffet: we did eat at both restaurants and the food and service was exceptional. my wife and i were glad to eat at both. if i had to complain, it would be the price for the buffet. my wife and i thought it was a bit pricey, even though we had $25.00 per day discount. especially memorable: the westin hotel staff that helped us everyday that we were their. room: my wife and i think that this room was probably the best room that we have ever stayed in. we have traveled a lot all over the north america. recognize associates: the time we arrived the luggage person (todd) was friendly and talked to us as real people. he also asked us everyday if he could assist us with anything. one day i asked him for directions to one my venues that i had to compete that day. by the time my pick up arrived for us he had the directions for us. i also want to mention the velet who took very good care of my big truck, which was called my them the big white truck. i don't forget this knid of great service by these employees. in closing: my wife and i want to thank the westin bay shores hotel for the great service and friendly employees that work their. if we visit vancouver, bc again in the future you can bet we will stay at this great hotel. thank you. mike and marcia townsend

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BetaCygni
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of its proximity to Stanley Park. We wanted to avoid the hassle of driving into the downtown area to rent bikes and cruise the park. We also had a nice walk to the BC place area and Gastown to look for Vancouver Olympic 2010 souvenirs. We ate breakfast in the hotel twice and thought it was a very nice buffet. Not cheap, but the food was excellent. The parking under the building across the street was terrible. It was the typical underground parking lot with lots of pillars and tight turns. Since our location was ideal for what we wanted to do, we didn’t drive much, just one night to Granville Island. It was expensive and the rooms were small, but we had a great view of the harbor from the 6th floor. If you want a downtown location near Stanley Park, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: 4familyCalgary
Reviews.Content: For $299 a night I was expecting that I would be totally pleased with our stay after reading reviews and checking out the website. I'm always looking for a good pool since we have children who love to swim. We got there at 3:30pm and our room was not ready - we had to leave and return later. We booked a harbour view - well, we did have a harbour view but it was looking North (I believe) which doesn't give you much of a view you need to be on the other side so you can look out to the open harbour and see all the ships. That was a little disappointing - had I known what to ask for specifically when I booked I would have asked for the open harbour view. Check-in was slow - there was only one person at the desk which was surprising since I later found out the hotel was totally booked. We got to our room and the kids wanted to go swimming. We went to the outdoor pool (the indoor one is closed for renovations). It was quite cool outside and had been all week so we were expecting the pool to be nice and warm - what a disappointment! It was also cold. I went to the front desk to complain about it and did not get a satisfactory response. My kids were out in no time. The room itself was very nice. We discovered in the morning when we turned on the shower that the ceiling leaked in the room outside the bathroom door so water was dripping everywhere. Not a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: syanmor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights 13-15 Aug, we had never stayed in Vancouver before and picked this hotel from previous Trip Advisor visitors reviews.It was a wonderful hotel, beautifully clean, all staff encountered were friendly & helpful, our room was on the 8th floor in the main building, over looking the harbour & Stanley Park, cleanliness was 1st class, opening sliding doors overlooking the harbour, small fridge, in room safe, starbucks complimentary coffee,self parking or valet parking if prefered, restaurants were a little expensive, but we dined at the ' spot ' restaurant just a short walk from the hotel,We will definetly stay here again if we travel to Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Will not get better in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: cblackeyes
Reviews.Content: A well run beautiful hotel with stable, caring staff. The best rooms are high in the towers although the standard rooms are absolutely fine. The rooms have been refurbished to a high standard. Not all have baths and shower. It is in an amazing position near Stanley Park, Robson St and has direct access to the Sea Wall and the Coal Harbour Marina. It is the only hotel with a resort style deck and pool. I have stayed here many times, I am hard to please, and will definitely return. Gripes, they should not be charging for internet access and the breakfast, whilst superb, is not the cheapest ($26+tax+service making $65+ for two). They used to have a lobby cafe, now there is only a Starbucks in the lobby. There are plenty of outside cafes within 100 yards if one wanted a $10 breakfast. I was happy to pay the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but some definite issues”
Reviews.Author: IndianaTravelmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on vacation with our young children. Started off on the wrong foot when they didn't have the king connecting with doubles room we had requested. Staff was nice but didn't/couldn't fix the issue. One of the major reasons we booked this property was because of the great looking outdoor pool seen in on-line photos. Consequently we were really unhappy to find out that the outdoor pool was closed the night of our arrival for a private function(which as my kids pointed out didn't involve swimming in the pool but rather schmoozing by the pool). The property does have a fairly nice indoor pool but it was very frustrating to have a major public area like the pool closed down for the night. On top of that the party going on by the pool was very,very loud with (bad) music blaring. Staff was very unresponsive to our complaints about this(basically sorry but nothing we can do). This party was essentially going on in the center court of the hotel so it had to be bothering anyone with a room overlooking the pool. Then at 5am we were awakened by loud,drunk people next door-walls must be thin. Security did come up and quiet them down fairly quickly and hotel did send up a cheese tray to apologize the next day. Many of the reviews seem to reference the "tower". I think we were in an older part of the hotel-halls looked a bit tired. Room was ok and bed comfortable but nothing special. Outdoor pool area has lovely view and when we did get to use it it was enjoyable although too cool in July to swim by about 6pm(again the indoor pool is a bit warmer). The one(only?) reason to stay here is the location. We were thrilled to be staying outside of the congested downtown vancouver area. We loved being able to walk to Stanley Park and the aquarium(which we highly recommend). Definitely have more of a resort feel with the nice views of the bay. We ate at a really good seafood place nearby (don't recall the name). The breakfast buffet was very nice at the hotel(loads of fresh fruit) but fairly pricey. Probably would still stay here for the location but frustrating experiences made us less than thrilled with our stay

Reviews.Title: “Westin Bayshore was quiet oasis of calm for our extended family of 15.”
Reviews.Author: Trisha21
Reviews.Content: We had 7 Harbor view rooms on the top floors and every one raved about the sparkling view of the harbor and the lovely very clean rooms and great TVs. Most of all they loved the beds and the location of the hotel next to Stanley Park and out of the congested Downtown. We have stayed in Vancouver on several occasions and this hotel is the best value and most comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Vancouver BC”
Reviews.Author: trippNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bayshore has the best location in Vancouver if you're interested in staying on the waterfront, with a walkway along the harbor if you turn right on exiting the Tower entrance, and the seawall leading to Stanley Park if you turn left. The harborview rooms have beautiful water and mountain views. The Pan Pacific and Fairmont Waterfront, by comparison, are in the heart of downtown, near high-end shops if that's your preference, and near the Convention Center. Views, yes, but not a location on the water. The Juliet balconies at the Westin are small, but the fact that there is a large sliding window that opens is a big plus. So is the refrigerator in the room. And the rooms are big enough and nicely furnished. Even the two restaurants nearby are great. Both have patios on the water. The views from LIFT are spectacular especially at sunset. I love the horseshoe bar and couldn't find the Russell Lemon Ale, highly recommended, anywhere else. Crime Lab has great food and a terrific martini menu. Bottom line -- no matter where we went, we always were glad to be back at the Westin Bayshore. Incidentally, this is written about Tower harborview rooms, which are well worth the small extra rate.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: quaatchi
Reviews.Content: What a lobby this place has! It has to be seen to be believed - it's the size of many UK villages! We rolled up all hot and grubby after a long long drive (including getting lost in Vancouver!) and were treated like royalty by the doorman-valet guy. Then at check-in a member of staff approached with a couple of refreshing cool fruit drinks. A really nice, thoughtful touch. The room was lovely - cool but not suffering from that dreadful clanking air-con you so often find in hotels. We were only there for a couple of days but had a lovely time - the staff really want you to have a good time and continually offer you help and refreshments. We ate in the restaurant and the food was delicious and very fairly priced - cocktails by the pool was our favourite bit! Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Vancouver's Coal Harbor”
Reviews.Author: skywaker9
Reviews.Content: Well located, well appointed and with some of the best service I have seen at any hotel, the Westin Bayshore was a pleasure to visit. We stayed there for a week in June and the rooms were nice (with large well-appointed bathrooms, Heavenly beds and new nice TVs) and the view and location were top-notch. Just a few minutes from Stanley Park, the Bayshore has certainly become the place that I will return to every time I visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “beat the expectation”
Reviews.Author: rtlontheroad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of DT Vancouver. Very nice parks and sitting areas just a few steps away if you prefer to have own made lunch looking over the wonderful surroundings. Swimming pool is comfortable till 10.30 am, after this it is too crowded, only in summer I guess. We enjoyed the pool from 5 pm again. We stayed at the tower-part, this is renewed and the rooms are clean and ‘big enough’ for a 3-night stay. Only the elevators are really annoying; waiting time could be taking 2+ minutes!! Would get back next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not great”
Reviews.Author: RJS and Gale
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and generally nice views from the rooms. Décor somewhat tired but still above average. Staff very friendly, and want to be helpful. Concierge did a good job of getting us into the right restaurants, but a little sloppy on the details (talk with Emily for important help). Prices in the hotel for food and drink are outrageous -- much better fare just outside the hotel. But, any time in Vancouver is wonderful, and is in our top ranks for places to be.

Reviews.Title: “Great and decently comfortable stay but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: jjluke
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Bayshore for a cousin's wedding for three days. Overall it was a very good stay but the Hotel is not perfect. Booked through priceline and got a great rate but in return they assign whatever rooms they desired. In an effort to obtain a room with a King sized bed, I faxed a letter kindly requesting just a King and some nice places to eat, etc. Normally I'm not picky but it was a special weekend for us so I made that request hoping they would help. Besides, two doubles is more "sellable" than a King anyways. When I arrived, they advised the hotel was full and actually would have put me in a room with two doubles and after politely requesting again in person (this high-ranking hotel may have not gotten my letter?) they found a King room that needed to be cleaned, so we returned a few hours later - I wonder if the Hotel was really booked up, but nonetheless I was glad they accommodated. The service at the front desk is at par with your typical high-end hotel and they were accommodating. The room was on the second floor of the main tower and was well furnished and nicely appointed (bathrobes are a nice touch). Our bed was exceptionally comfortable. The pools and exercise room are top notch and it definitely gives you a feeling of luxuriousness.. However, not to be nitpicky, but as a high-end hotel I did come in with great expectations. The room itself was a bit on the small side and the view was poor (the front veranda). We could hear the water go on/off and flush at night and if people in the hall were loud at night, the noise permeates through the doors. This is the type of hotel you come back to sleep at and not live in for the day; it is Vancouver after all, so the sights and sounds are what matter. The mini-bar and restaurant's prices are quite pretentious for what you pay (ie. $5 for a bottle of water) so expect this coming in. The showers are beautiful and unique, but if you are a bath type person, this may not work for you. Also, the closets are actually in the washroom. And don't forget parking will cost you $26+ and if you self park the parkade is actually down the street. Also, internet will cost you! If you decide not to receive maid service, the Hotel will give you a voucher towards any restaurant, room service, etc. so we used this to offset the high costs of breakfast. A ton of restaurants and other amenities are nearby, even a Safeway so for cost-concious customers (not sure if this is the type who would stay at this hotel) there are a myriad of dining options. Overall, aside from the points above, if you are looking for the experience of a high class hotel, this is a good choice. The location is top notch right by Stanley Park and the hotel does offer excellent amenities. It does become a money pit once you factor in your meals, mini-bar and parking though, but again I imagine this is the type of hotel that wants to cater to customers with such luxuries.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in Stunning Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: ja2008
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Westin Bayshore. Overall, we had a great experience at this hotel. The rooms were very nice and kept very clean. We had a room in the tower with spectacular views of the mountains and the harbour. The service at the hotel was quite good however check-in is a bit slow but concierge service was extremely helpful throughout our stay. The outdoor pool does get quite busy and can be difficult to find seating. Also, bar service poolside was extremely slow, with only one waitress serving the entire pool. We probably would stay here again, however it is a bit on the expensive side for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: gram46
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends for 3 days before Alaskan Cruise. City Tours Trolley comes right to the door & Stanley Park is a short walk away. Right on the harbour but very quiet & very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location next to park”
Reviews.Author: AVRLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a conveniently located hotel before our cruise. It is a 10 minute cab ride to Balantine Pier and about 30 minutes from the airport. If you are looking for a hotel close to Balantine, the Westin Grand is closer. We were walking distance to the park, however, where they have an aquarium, extensive walking/biking/jogging trails, a totem village, etc. It was a good way to spend the afternoon. There are restaurants on the waterfront and a shopping district about 10 minutes walking away. We stayed in the hotel tower and had no balcony -- a balcony would have been nice with kids since the room was small. It was a little uncomfortable for a family sharing space, but we were only there one night and it was much bigger than our cruise cabin :). It was tricky getting cabs with three kids -- most cabs only accommodated families of four and apparently mini-van cabs are hard to get? The stretch limo from the airport ended up being about the same price as the Airporter shuttle for five and a lot more fun -- if you're a group, I would recommend looking for that at the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: 212Girl
Reviews.Content: Just spent a few days at the Westin, in a king sized room. As Starwood Preferred Member, was surprised by lack of accomodation of staff. Checked in early, room not ready. Came back at 3.15, had to stand in same line with one person working behind desk, incompetently. Another 30 minutes later. Annoying and unprofessional to have 1 person staffed with 20 people on line and two check ins later. Rooms small. Had king sized bed but very little room to maneuver. No bathtub in bath and "glass" shower curtain which only covered half shower = water all over the floor. Other than that, location is near perfection, right next to Stanley Park, a must if you are an outdoor enthusiast. Not totally convenient (taxi to interesting parts of town) but nice and quiet. Concierge knowledgeable and helpful. Outdoor pool was beautiful and warm, sitting almost by the water itself. Starbucks in lobby nice bonus. Also, no free internet, which is like archaic at this point. .35/minute in business center and $15 a day in room. Absurd. Also no spa, kind of surprising for a westin.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, views and great staff”
Reviews.Author: jacob123
Reviews.Content: Hard to find fault with this hotel. Upgraded on arrival which always helps! Beautiful views and such friendly and helpful staff. It's not cheap, but then you pay for what you get. The views from the hotel are stunning if you have one of the sea facing rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced!!!”
Reviews.Author: ColletteLovesTravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is way overpriced for what you get. The room was small and poorly laid out. The closet was in the bathroom. You couldn't stand in front of the sink because the toilet was in the way. There was no place to put our suitcases without rearranging the furniture. Internet was $15 per day. Checkin was terrible - I had to wait a half hour. Parking was very expensive. The harbor view was not very good. The one bright spot was the concierge - very helpful and good suggestions.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful experience at the Westin Bayshore”
Reviews.Author: NMACTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently had an overnight stay in Vancouver. We had a harbor view room and it was wonderful. We were able to see the ships coming in and out and also see the park next to the hotel. The room was very well equiped and the bedding was so fresh and comfortable. We had all we needed and more. Check in/out were effortless. We were even able to get an early check in. We hope to be able to go back when we have more time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel! Would recommend!”
Reviews.Author: inspiration100
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large with a great view for the most part, the lobby is HUGE with a starbucks and a gift shop. I was in the tower with a decent view, but ye be warned, they have some rooms with horrid views of the ceiling of the lobby. The hotel should not have rooms like these. Otherwise, this hotel is pretty much perfect. This is one of the best areas of Vancouver, so walking late at night felt very safe. It has the usual Westin amenities including the heavenly bed, the double shower heads and the desk with a chair.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: Spi-kids_LA
Reviews.Content: Just completed a stay at Westin Bayshore this past weekend after an Alaska cruise. It is very close to Canada Place (1o minute Taxi ride) which opened up the day for us. Early check in to our web special priced room was ready for us at 9:30 in the morning. We stayed in older section in a room w/o a view. Room was nice...flat screen TV, new furniture and dream beds. Excellent base camp if you looking to explore Stanley Park and North Vancouver attractions. Walked to Stanley Park and used Trolley ($2 for adults/$1 children) for all day access around the park. Aquarium was good (buying tickets in advance is a big time saver as the wait to get in was 30 minutes). Good restraunts close by and hotel staff was very helpful with maps, suggestions and recommendations. We did not eat at hotel but elected to do local scene instead. Indoor pool & spa was nicde at the end of a long day of exploring. We would definately stay here again at the right price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILoveTexas
Reviews.Content: We arrived mid-morning after a cruise, and were invited to check in right away. Our room was bright, airy, and comfortable, with a beautiful view of the harbor. The location of this hotel is magnificent, and the spacious, open design of the lobby gives it a resort feel. The staff were exceptionally helpful and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: RosieOO
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel right the on the waterfront. Beautiful views. Within walking distance to many things. If you have little luggage you can even walk to the cruise docks. We just felt it was very pricey and the room was looking worn. I would stay here again and would use Hotwire again to get the good price.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need.”
Reviews.Author: atlhppwt
Reviews.Content: With a location, and views, that are second to none, the Westin Bayshore feels like a special occasion splurge. But a Westin website special offer allowed me to upgrade from my bare bones budget hotel for just a few extra dollars. To top it off, I received a complimentary upgrade to a corner room when they realized it was my birthday. I had stunning views of Stanley Park, the mountains, the harbor and marina and a gorgeous skyline, especially at night. They really made my trip special. Currents Restaurant, which serves breakfast, was pricey and didn't offer particularly good value, which is typical of restaurants in luxury accomodations. But there are plenty of dining options nearby at all price points. Weekends are very busy, with weddings, graduations and all manner of special events taking place and noisy revelers can detract from the peace and quiet of the resort atmosphere. My only complaint is the noise created by the heavy doors to the room. They close automatically but slam with such force they shake the walls. With people coming and going into the wee hours, it was very disturbing to be jarred awake by slamming doors.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly as promised”
Reviews.Author: GaryMel
Reviews.Content: Westin Bayshore is located next to StanleyPark in a wonderful area. We enjoyed walking along the Seawall in this world class city. The hotel lived up to the high expectations we had set for it, even got a 3 nights for the price of 2 special through Expedia. My wife would have liked a spa, but apparently that is coming soon.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel and its great staff literally "saved" our trip - Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: NMTraveler48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived at the end of an extended trip starting in Seattle, Washington, through Victoria, B.C., and ending in Vancouver for our 40th wedding anniversary. Never having been to Vancouver, I had no personal experience to draw on, and depended on doing research on the internet before I booked a room in another upscale Vancouver "boutique" hotel for this surprise trip for my wife and me. Upon arriving at the other "boutique" hotel, we were extremely disappointed in their room, their facilities and their staff, but were at a loss as what to do, since we had no other options immediately available to us. I called a friend, and he recommended I call the Westin Bayshore, as he and his wife had stayed there before. I called Westin reservations, and began what turned out to be one of the most enjoyable experiences I have ever had with a hotel and its staff. When I explained our predicament to the reservation clerk, Kathy, I was pleasantly surprised when she went well beyond my expectations to help us get a room, at a great rate, even though it was last minute. She stayed on the phone with me until I had time to talk to my wife and to check with the people at the "boutique" hotel to see if we could leave without any penalty (fortunately, they did allow us to do that). I booked the room, and we then proceeded to drive directly to the Westin Bayshore, where we were greeted as we pulled into the porte cochere by the head valet, valet staff, and bellman, who unloaded and parked our car while we were directed into the hotel and the registration desk. After a quick check-in, our bellman took us to our 16th floor corner room in the tower building. Our bellman hung up our clothes, set up our suitcases, filled our ice bucket and asked if there was anything else he could do for us before leaving. Our room had magnificent views of the harbor and the city out of its floor-to-ceiling glass windows and doors onto the balcony, and was immaculately clean and beautifully appointed with its contemporary wood furniture, a well-stocked mini-bar, great closet (with plush his-and-her robes), generous drawer space, an in-room safe, flat-screen TV, one of the most comfortable king-sized beds I've ever slept in, a beautiful bathroom with granite countertops and a glass-enclosed tile shower with a large center shower head in the ceiling. What a difference compared to the "boutique" hotel we had just left to come to the Westin! After we were settled in, I went down to Concierge, as my existing reservations for our anniversary dinner were at the aforementioned "boutique" hotel's restaurant, which I no longer wished to patronize. Emily, who apparently takes care of the concierge duties at the Westin Bayshore, recommended two excellent restaurants; "Seasons" in Queen Elizabeth Park, and "Sequoia Teahouse" in Stanley Park. At my request, she then made arrangements for both restaurants, one on the night before our anniversary and one the night of our anniversary. When we went to the restaurants, we were pleasantly surprised to receive free hors d'oeuvres, compliments of the Westin Bayshore concierge. I can't say enough about the great accommodations and wonderful service at the Westin Bayshore. We will definitely be coming back to Vancouver and staying at the Westin on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a stayover -- at the right price”
Reviews.Author: Nondumblond
Reviews.Content: After a great deal of research, we used Priceline to get a relatively inexpensive room at this hotel the night before an Alaska cruise -- was placed in a fourth-floor room that overlooked the hotel, the Bay, and Stanley Park. Service and room accoutrements are stellar -- cannot be faulted. However, as it is a 'business' hotel, it can be pricey if you're not careful (i.e., wireless internet at a significant cost, to say nothing of room service). Did not care for the 'rainfall' showerhead, or the design choice to put a relatively small open closet in the bathroom area. However, the rest of the design choices were spot-on and very comfortable. If we could pay the same price, we would definitely stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “it was great but....”
Reviews.Author: Maple_Man1977
Reviews.Content: On check in, they messed up our rooms; however that was sorted out quickly and management provided champagbe and strawberries. The room view was gorgeous and sensational. The room was very clean and tidy. Stanley Park is a stones throw away with very easy access. The location was great, close to shopping and attractions. The only sad part is the value, including an overpriced hotel restaurants (not that great). I had way better at less expensive places. The room service was ridiculously priced, local phone calls and internet access should have been included. All in all we had a great time, but would consider alernatives next time.

Reviews.Title: “Best room service I've had”
Reviews.Author: mimi_bird
Reviews.Content: Usually I only order room service if I am dead tired and can't get myself out but I have dined at Westin Restaurants at other hotels when I wasn't a guest and found them to be pretty good so I decided to treat myself after two long weeks of business travel. For the first time I can remember ordering room service at different hotels I actually thought the food was delicious! They even had a good vegetarian option with rice noodles. They were accommodating to my special requests (no portobello! no spinach!) The food was fresh, beautifully prepared and presented and hot when delivered.My arugula salad was prepared with delicate baby arugula and tasty ripe cherry tomatoes and perfectly tossed and dressed. I have eaten at Hilton, Marriott and other hotel restaurants that were awful. I am glad Westin has brought the standard for cuisine up a notch and hope the others will take note. Poorly prepared food with no healthy options, wilted salads, undercooked potatoes. etc, etc just won't cut it anymore! Will stay at a Westin whenever possible. Plus I love this hotel - every inch of it! From my chaise lounge by the sliding glass doors when I can enjoy the marina view to the spacious modern yet warm feel of the lobby. Service is top notch almost every employee is more than gracious and super helpful. Westin decorate their rooms so tastefully - clean lines, rich wood tones, soft neutral colors. I feel so relaxed here. Complimentary robes, spacious bath, etc. etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: creekside_mx
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. They were having a problem with leaking water pipes on the main floor so the ceiling was leaking in the main hall areas and near the Starbucks. So, it was a little smelly. They were quick to deal with the problem, but they are going to need to do some repairs ( there are now holes in the ceiling)

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel, newly renovated, good waterfront location”
Reviews.Author: Minibarmuncher
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the newly renovated Tower rooms....the renovation is well done and the result is your standard Westin guestroom....clean, contemporary and pleasant. Hotel is very large and has a business/ conference feel to it in the public areas. We were there over a weekend and it felt a little quit...definitely not a boutique feel. Great location on the water with excellent access to the big park area with wonderful walking and running trails, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: kbhr
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Westin Bayshore after lunch in Nanaimo harbour and a short trip by sea-plane straight into Coal Harbour, so the location and convenience couldn’t be beat! Originally allocated a room facing the harbour but after a quick call down to reception we moved to room with view of Stanley Park (and the sunset). We were on the last leg of a two week tour of Alberta & BC so although it was all thrilling, we were ready for a day of rest without having to travel too far to enjoy the sights. Once we had unpacked and settled in my friend went down to the outdoor pool for a swim while I rested for a while just admiring the lovely views out over the water to Stanley Park. Once the sun moved round from the pool it got quite chilly so we thought we might try the Jacuzzi by the indoor pool but having changed and went down, it was very busy with families and young children, so not really the relaxing experience we had in mind. Instead we decided to change and head to nearby restaurant by the waterside that could be accessed through the garden of the hotel. All the travelling had caught up with us and we had an early flight next morning so spoke to concierge about booking a taxi to the airport for 6am, but they assured us there would be plenty of taxis available in the morning, and sure enough there was. The room was a good size with very comfortable bed and spacious bathroom and check-out was fast and efficient and all for a reasonable price. A very good overall experience, only wish we’d had more time to enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “A very good stay”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pro55
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Westin Bayshore since 1983 and can honestly say I've never been disappointed. My most recent stay was no exception. As others have mentioned, the staff members are uniformly great, making guests feel at home and at ease immediately. The doorman watched my car while I checked in without forcing me to park and then retrieve it within just a few minutes' time. Although I arrived quite a bit before noon, the desk clerk found me a room on the 7th floor that was ready for occupancy and got me right in. The concierge was happy to answer all my questions and provide me with a map of the local area so I could find my way. My guest room (724) was very Asian-modern and incldued high-end amenities like a flat-screen TV, robes in the room (without having to be requested), and an increasingly-rare commodity these days: a minibar. It also had the famous Westin Heavenly Bed but, interestingly, no Heavenly Shower...or tub. The bathroom had only a shower, but with a "drench" showerhead, similar to those at the Savoy Hotel in London. Very pleasant; just a bit of a surprise. The Bayshore has a self-service business centre (yes, spelled "re"; you're in Canada, after all), an indoor pool and spa, a fitness centre they're in the process of refurbishing, and an onsite restaurant and bar. With the hotel located on Coal Harbour, many (if not all) of the rooms have great views, either of Burrard Inlet, Stanley Park, or the mountains. It's a few blocks from the popular shopping area along Robson Street, but it's not a bad walk unless the weather is horrible. And the area immediately around the hotel is fairly built up, offering a selection of cafes, restaurants, and a bit of shoping as well as nice places to walk. There are a few drawbacks of which one should be aware. The Westin Bayshore has an attached conference center; therefore, things can get a little crazy if there's an activity or two underway. Also, as an older facility, the walls are a bit thinner than many newer hotels and I could easily hear the two women next door when they returned to their room after what I have to conclude was an evening of partying. It's not that they were especially loud; they just weren't church-mice. When I mentioned that to the clerk upon check-out, he was most conciliatory and urged me to call the front desk next time and allow them to intervene. Once again, the excellent customer service I've come to expect from Westin. Next time I'm in Vancouver, I'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Bayshore is the Best!”
Reviews.Author: JimboLA
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Westin Bayshore Vancouver. Certainly the waterside placement and location near shops, parks and attractions was wonderful, but I must rave about the staff. To a person, every single staff member from valet, bellman, check-in, waiter to housekeeping were exceptionally friendly, helpful and kind. Really the most overwhelmingly positive experience I've ever had in a hotel. I'm only sorry we only stayed there one night on our way to Whistler (the Westin Whistler was fantastic too). We had a newly renovated room with a great view. Vancouver was buried under a snow storm, but the Westin hummed along as beautifully as the view. The restaurant wasn't open when we got there for dinner, so they opened it early for us! Nice! I chose this Westin because they actually have rollaway beds so I could fit my family of 4 in one room. The room wasn't huge, but it was ample for all of us and had been nicely re-done with an HD LCD TV. We'll definitely go back there. Exceedingly pleasant and a good value!

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in Great City”
Reviews.Author: beauxl2002
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bayshore is stylish and classy hotel, with good access to the Marina and Coal Bay area. The Bar has a nice view over the Burrard Inlet towards the Coastal Montains, but as its a Westin, its a bit pricey. Areas such as Gastown and Robson St. are a little further away, but ok to walk to if you have the time. Unfortunately we were given a room on only the second floor, with spectacular view of - the lobby! And we had to wait till gone 4pm for our room to be ready (We`d arrived at 1pm). So pro`s and con`s, but to be honest it doesn`t matter were you stay in Vancouver, you`ll love the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent service with high standards”
Reviews.Author: TravellerDave
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Bayshore October 23 -26th. The hotel was booked as part of a business convention and we could not have been happier with the Westin. The location of the hotel is right on the harbour adjacent to Stanley Park with a commanding view of harbour, Stanley Park and the city depending on the room. We were on the 7th floor in the lower tower facing the harbour/city. The room has been recently renovated and although the bathroom was a bit on the small side due to the size of the vanity, it suited us well. The shower was a bit different with a plate glass partition and no door. The shower head is an overhead 'rain' style that falls directly on you. Takes a bit to get used to it and it does swivel. The room was of a typical size with a comfortable king sized 'heavenly bed' and a wide choice of pillows to choose from. The television is a 32" LCD mounted on the wall directly accross from the foot of the bed. There are about 60 channels and specialty pay per view, however, none were high def except the rental movies. There are two comfortable chairs and a small table next to the balcony window. Although there was no balcony in this particular room the floor to ceiling glass window/patio door slid accross and virtually opened up the room. The views from most rooms are excellent, however you need to be at least 5-6 floors up to clear the service buildings. All of the tables in the room were glass covered which gave the room a modern contemporary look. There is a mini bar fridge and electronic safe available. Closed space is limited and located in the bathroom. An iron and ironing board is also supplied along with two oversized housecoats. The service in this hotel is above standard. Everyone was pleasant and most helpful. The foyer is expansive and very impressive. There are two pools, one outdoor adjacent to the seawall and an indoor with a large hot tub. The business facilities were standard with only two computers on a cost to use basis located in a separate room on the mall level adjacent to Starbucks. The meeting rooms are large and the grand ballroom is able to handle a sizable crowd. The bar is located next to the seawall and offers the standard fare with an excellent view. We did not try the restaurant as it seemed to be closed everytime we checked. There are excellent places to eat within a few minutes walking distance. Both Stanley Park and most of downtown are about a 10 minute walk. This city caters to health conscious people with many walking/biking trails entwined with the streets. Pets are welcome virtually everywhere and the pace is a bit more laid back then other large cities the size of Vancouver. The Westin is a high quality hotel with excellent amenities and outstanding service. I would not hesitate to recommend this facility to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more!”
Reviews.Author: julieann80uk
Reviews.Content: We visited the Westin the week of the 11th October. I emailed the hotel before we arrived to check that we had a renovated room and happened to mention that it was my partners birthday. When we arrived we found a bright clean and well presented room, all recently done. It appears that they have completed all rennovations in the main building. The beds were as comfortable as any i have ever slept in and the bathroom although not huge was exactly what we needed and was immaculate. The view from our room's balcony, of the harbour were breathtaking and we watched the Sea planes taking off each day. It is only a ten minute walk to the shopping area if that is what you want but it is also secluded enough that you can forget you are in a big city. After giving us time to settle in they brought a piece of birthday cake to the room and a birthday card for my partner, although he didnt get much of the cake!! The staff were always friendly and polite and could not do enough for us, i cannot praise them enough. Vancouver was beautiful but the stay was made even better by the fantastic hotel. I would definitely visit again, it is by far the best hotel we have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Drobeta
Reviews.Content: Great location. The rooms are O.K., the heavenly bed is wonderful. The bathroom is quite small. Not many dining options for a hotel with 500 rooms. The Seawall Bar & Grill is mediocre and overpriced (for example fish & chips were CAD23, but not available for 2 consecutive days). The WiFi is CAD15/day + tax while other hotels offer free internet. The personnel is absolutely wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Gringo69
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bayshore on two separate occasions during a two week visit to Canada - once for three nights and another one night stay later on. When booking my vacation, I was assured that all my hotels were of excellent quality. In the case of the Bayshore, I'd beg to differ somewhat. Check-in/check-out: no problems here, though you might have to queue. The staff were friendly and pleasant, but didn't offer me any help with my luggage. Facilities: there's a pool (which I didn't try) and a number of shops (including a Starbucks, which is handy if you don't want to eat breakfast in the restaurant). Eating: I only ate once, sampling breakfast. There was a decent range of food available, though it was fairly expensive. Service was reasonable, nothing more. Room-wise: I stayed initially on the third floor, and then on the ninth floor. Both rooms were of a good size and had a decent-sized bathroom. For some reason, though, the shower did not have a door that closed, so if I had a shower, the bathroom would rapidly fill with steam. In addition, the storage where you hang your clothes is right next to the shower, in the same room, so you might end up steam-cleaning your clothes if you take a long shower. Beds were not all that great. I had a huge number of pillows to choose from, most of which were too soft and one of which was too hard. So, no pillows for me. Noise-wise, the third floor room was appalling. This was thanks to the many seabirds in the area, which made a huge amount of noise at all hours of the night. This meant that I got very little sleep at all during my first visit (not aided by being jet lagged). The ninth floor room was somewhat better, perhaps due to its height and being on a different side of the hotel. Location-wise, the hotel is perfect for Stanley Park, which is five minutes or so walk by foot. It's not much good for anything else, so you'll need to catch a bus or walk to down-town. There is a convenient taxi stand right outside the hotel. If I had the opportunity, I would not stay at the Bayshore again, mainly due to the location and the noise from outside.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: newyorklover123
Reviews.Content: Close to Stanley Park! On the water, decent rooms and beautiful grounds and views (on those rare clear days!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Views!”
Reviews.Author: 2DogsCalgary
Reviews.Content: What a great stay in Vancouver! We were upgraded to one of the tower rooms with a partial city view and partial marina view. The table and chairs were placed in just the right place in the corner of the room to take advantage of watching the sun rise over Burrard inlet and of looking at seaplanes coming and going frrom the nearby terminal. The table was also just the right place to have a room service dinner overlooking the water. We could have seen the "Celebration of Light" fireworks display from our balcony but decided to go with the crowd to English Bay, instead. Comfortable beds in a newly renovated room. Registration was quick and easy even though there were several tours checking in at the same time. Very soothing background music was piped into the public areas of the ground floor. It was nice one day of our stay so we took advantage of the splendid waterfront, outdoor pool -- lots of people but still one could find a quiet area. The water with wedges of orange and lemon was very refreshing! We did not take advantage of the indoor pool, but it also looked pleasant. We travel with an English bulldog and and chihuahua and the Bayshore could not be a better place for them.. They were a hit with the staff and there are many areas beside the hotel where they could be walked. There also is a good pet store, with some unusual items, a block away towards Georgia Street. The Bayshore was a wonderful retreat in Vancouver and we are looking forward to our next stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Watch the Float Planes Land”
Reviews.Author: NG2000
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location and hotel at reasonable price online! Stayed on the 8th floor of "The Tower", which is the newest building of the Westin. Great view of the harbor! Also could see the pool. Watched yachts come and go, and the float planes banking in just above my skinny balcony. Stanley Park is just next door, which is beautiful! Service was not very personal. Took them 2 phonecalls from me, and over 30 minutes to bring my bags up from the lobby on check-in. There were only 3 luggage carriers there at the time, so NOT that busy. No breakfast included. Breakfast buffet is $25 Canadian. Television tiny. Wireless internet available.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: resortReport
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. The service is great. The rooms are clean and nicely remodled. The location is ideal. I visited the Four Seasons hotel. Dont see how it is better. The location is bad, the lobby isnt any better than the Westin. I didnt see the rooms at the Four Seasons, but the Westin rooms are fine enough. Even the rooms yet to be remodled are fine enough. The food was good, but expensive. Service was timely though. Stanley park is located right next to the hotel. Seriously, the only bad thing about the hotel is the carpet in the room. Dont know why they chose the scheme.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: TA_user_in_England
Reviews.Content: It was a late decision to stay here (we'd been thinking of staying downtown) but we were so glad we did. After a transatlantic flight it was the perfect place to recover from jetlag and ease into our holiday. We chose refurbished rooms in the original building with views over the swimming pool and harbour towards Stanley Park. No balcony but floor to ceiling windows which slid open so you could sit in the window and admire the view/watch the world go by! The most comfortable beds of our stay (and the standard was high)! We experienced very good service everywhere we stayed in BC and Alberta but the service here seemed genuine (rather than saying all the right things but without really meaning them, a subtle difference). The concierge was brilliant and helped us with pharmacy, restaurant booking and bike hire. Other staff (too many to mention) were equally good. The buffet breakfast in Currents was amazing (both quality and quantity) and set the bar impossibly high for the rest of our trip. The staff there were excellent, very hard working, friendly and helpful. If you want to be in walking distance of downtown but without the hustle and bustle then stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and spacious!”
Reviews.Author: umbrellaman
Reviews.Content: Stayed here three nights for a conference. Although a bit dated, the rooms are spacious, well furnished and clean. The staff is very helpful, from the front desk to the concierge to housekeeping. The location is terrific - on the harbor next to Stanley Park and just a few blocks to several great eating streets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Roxol
Reviews.Content: Probably the best waterfront location. Spacious hotel, friendly staff. Contemporary rooms with very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: chibeachcomber
Reviews.Content: After growing up in the Pacific Northwest and driving by the very prominent Westin Bayshore Inn on my many trips to Vancouver, but never having had the opportunity to stay there while I lived in the northwest, but after having moved away many years ago, I finally got the chancel this past week. What I found was a hotel whose outer shell still has vestiges of its 1960's beginnings but whose interior appointment were completely re-fashioned into very elegant and modern experience. Warm, and inviting use of beach, maple or birchwood finishes with warm and rich marbles and granite floors, this hotel is superb in many aspects. The view from my 2nd floor room was a pleasant vista of the nearby marina and a japanese style pond. The mountains North of the City were also clearly visible and the overall atmosphere was exquisite. The marketing claim for the bed is "heavenly" and I'd have to agree with that assessment. The main thing I found that could be improved was the shower experience. You had to reach through the overhead rain shower to adjust the temperature. So you're guaranteed to get a cold rain starting your shower. I feel I got a 4 star hotel for close to a 3 star price during my stay so I feel that "relatively" good values are available at this resort. The restaurant service for breakfast was good but very pricey but I soon discovered that all restaurants in downtown Vancouver are very pricey so might as well enjoy it there.

Reviews.Title: “Like space and comfort”
Reviews.Author: frenchbosh
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel. Just the place to relax and be comfortable. Beautiful rooms, spacious and well designed. Service from all staff a joy to find. Placed right on the the harbour although some views of the sea obscured slightly by ships and private boats moored outside. The useful trolly bus stops right outside to orientate yourself when you first arrive although alternatively the hotel runs a complimentary coach service into town. Stanley park a short walk away and good jogging/cycling flows around the harbour walk. Several Seaplanes to Vancouver island are also located nearby. Food is of a high standard. A wonderful way to unwind pre or post Canadian/Alaskan adventure

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: smithdixon
Reviews.Content: Recently got back from a stay at the Westin Bayshore in Vancouver, BC. Was quite impressed with the property; a beautiful hotel, on the water, in a good location. My room was a little on the small side but the service i received more than made up for that. The staff were friendly and accomodating, and to my delight there was a Starbucks right in the hotel. (HUGE bonus for me.) I am a big fan of the Westin properties, the Heavenly Bed is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: thea_g
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Bayshore while in Vancouver for a conference. The lobby was well maintained, with a new fruit juice for guests throughout the day. The staff was helpful and friendly. Guest services, including restaurants, gift shops, and a Starbucks were convenient, but expensive. My room had a gorgeous view of the bay and runners and bicyclists heading to Stanley Park. Heating/cooling was controlled by a convenient thermostat with both C/F scales. The room was decorated in an average fashion. I enjoyed the comfy beds with down comforter and the large flat screen television. I was definitely not a fan of the remodeled bathrooms that included a glass wall that only enclosed half the shower. It made for a chilly shower and concerns of making a wet mess on the shower floor. I was also annoyed with the ways they try to nickel and dime you. There were no vending machines. Bottles of water were $6 in the room and $2.50 in the gift shop. They charged for the business center, which is free in many hotels. 30 cents a minute for internet, plus an extra charge for printing. It was an additional $20 a day for internet in your room. Overall, I would stay there again. The beauty and comfort of the hotel outweighed the annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “lovely experience at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hola_y_saludos
Reviews.Content: I was at the bayshore for 3 nights and it was a lovely experience. the location was nice, check in was pleasant, and the recently remodeled room was clean and comfortable. i found the beds and pillows comfortable and the room pleasantly quiet. the only complaint (given the new remodel) was the fumes from new carpet/ furniture were a little strong. overall a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view”
Reviews.Author: cabes2
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 18th floor and the view of the harbor was awsome. I thought the hotel room was comfortable and the property clean with good upkeep. However, they do nickle and dime you with everything else. They charge off the wall prices for dining, parking and wireless internet. It's a bit too much for the quality of stay in my opinion

Reviews.Title: “Fixer upper”
Reviews.Author: TheBigEZ
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the view from my 16th floor balcony and the staff was extraordinary, but the hotel is in desperate need of a remodel. Perhaps until that happens, they could knock 20 percent off the bill!

Reviews.Title: “Tired, but great location”
Reviews.Author: Mozza47
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bayshore steals the best location on the waterfront in Vancouver, but it is an old, tired damsel desperately in need of a makeover. It never ceases to amaze me how a company like Starwood can portray the image of a brand such as Westin as a five star upscale hotel and still leave tired old places like this one using the brand. Don't they have an alternate brand that caters for old dungers? For sure, the Westin Bayshore is a great location, and yes, if you time it right, there may be a doorman, and yes, the lobby is spacious, and yes, the reception staff are wonderful. But oh dear, the rooms..... and the noisy old clunky lifts.... and , and , oh dear. I'll probably go back there, and you probably will too. Because it is in the best location, but imagine what it could be!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: demicent
Reviews.Content: We needed two rooms for our Pre-Alaskan cruise accommodations. I managed to get the reservations through Priceline at a jaw-dropping low price. I called the hotel a month prior to check-in to ask a simple question about the rooms and the person who answered treated me like we had cooties. Oh...we booked through PRICELINE. Well, I should just call Priceline if I had any questions, then. IF that's what I need to do, fine, but I was stung by his deliberate rudeness, and convinced that our stay at the Westin was going to be rather unpleasant if the staff were on a par with him. We arrived at the Westin a few days before our cruise, and checked in. The bell staff and desk staff were very friendly and efficient. I could not believe that we were given gorgeous rooms overlooking the bay, considering that we booked them for a pittance and we had Priceline cooties and all... Our rooms were clean, large, fresh smelling, with comfortable beds and great linens. We never heard any noise from other guests. See some of the other reviews for comments regarding what you will see out the window if you are lucky enough to get a bayside room. Staff continued to be friendly and helpful throughout the trip. We did not dine at the hotel, other than one poolside soda. There are many fine restaurants within a five minute walk of the Westin, and some gas-station type convenience stores. We did use the valet parking which was very expensive, but sometimes it is worth the convenience. When we went to check out, there were a couple of errors on the bill. There were extra drinks charged to the poolside tab. And both our room and our daughter's room were each charged for the valet parking, even though she did not have a car. Desk staff quickly removed the extra charges. I would have rated this place a five if the first man I spoke with on the phone wasn't so rude. We looked at a lot of hotels as we toured Vancouver. In my opinion, the Westin occupies the prime real estate. Quiet at night, fresh air, incomparable views. If I am ever lucky enough to return to Vancouver, I'm staying at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “What a View!”
Reviews.Author: ChicCat
Reviews.Content: Had to stay at the Westin because my regular, the Renaissance hotel was sold out. The staff seem friendly and the property very open. When I checked-in, the fellow at the front desk said he received a call from the Renaissance saying I was a VIP guest. The desk agent upgraded me to a suite looking over coal harbor & the mountains. Incredible! It is located right next to Stanley Park and in a mainly residential area. I was here for only one night and I have nothing to complain about. If I wasn't so attached to my regular hotel, I would be staying here on a regular basis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ParkerOttawa
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this Westin a couple of times in the past two years, and it is truly a nice experience. All the staff are very helpful and pleasant. The location is excellent. The hotel is going through some remodeling and updating. Our room was not yet renovated but very, very nice with a lovely view of the harbour area. Only downside is the cost of the internet. So many places have free wireless these days.

Reviews.Title: “Review of Latest Two Stays @ the Westin Bayshore”
Reviews.Author: m3rlind0g
Reviews.Content: Over the past two years I have stayed at the Westin Bayshore about a dozen times. The latest were in February and March 2008. My most recent visits were up to expectations.
