From the doorman, to the front desk, the hotel cleaning personal, all do their jobs with a goal to make you happy. If you are not, let them know and they will try their best to correct the situation. I always chose a Harbor View room, which I find is a good size. The bathroom is a wee bit on the small side but it does work. The dual head showers are great. The view from your window is truly a 10 - 20 million dollar view as the condo's that surround the hotel, cost that much. Watching the sea planes take off all day long, is very relaxing. There is a nice size indoor and outdoor pool plus indoor hot tub that is hot plus a steam room and sauna's in the ladies and men's locker rooms. The exercise area is top notch, no token one piece of each type. You can certainly maintain your workouts here. I have also eaten at their Sunday brunch which currently is about $45 per person. The amount and variety should please almost anyone. From custom made Omelets to Smoked Salmon & Oysters on the half shell, you can certainly eat your moneys worth. The location in my opinion is great. You are only 5 - 10 minutes from the business district or the oodles and oodles of choices for shopping or eating. At the corner of Denman and Davies (about a 10 minute walk) on the 2nd floor is a Chinese Restaurant called Won More. If you like Hot & Sour soup, this is a great place to go. The beef and black pepper dish is also great. There is a Greek restaurant that would be a good 20 minute walk or 7 minute cab called Stepho's on Davies that serves good Greek food at reasonable prices and their Tziki sauce is loaded with garlic. The greatest strength that the Bayshore Westin has is that it is very quiet day or night. No blaring sirens or loud party goers. A good night's sleep is easy to find here. (plus it does not hurt that the beds and pillows are very nice)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff, great living accomodations!”
Reviews.Author: faithc
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I enjoyed this hotel immensely. The concierge was superb, and went out of his way to help us in every way possible. The living quarters were beautiful, and most importantly, comfortable and clean feeling. It is within 10 minutes walking distance from the main street in town, Robson.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TectonicGreg
Reviews.Content: The hotel makes you relax as soon as you get there with an airy soft wood paneled lobby, and you're bound to get a room with a great view of Vancouver harbour or Stanley Park. I felt really pampered when I was there. It's much better than staying in a usual downtown business hotel. As soon as you walk out the door, you can also step right onto Vancouver's famous Seawall walking path. You can walk into the heart of downtown in about 15 or 20 minutes along the habourfront, or reach the English Bay beaches in about the same amount of time. I'm a big fan. It's also well set up for business, with my room having a long desk with lots of space to plug in my laptop and an easy to find set of power outlets, a phone jack and ethernet cable.

Reviews.Title: “impeccable everything”
Reviews.Author: CSCFBahamas88
Reviews.Content: Rooms, are not to believe. Very big and modern and beautiful. Service is impeccable and quick. Location is also perfect, views are amazing and there are lots of walking areas right downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: edyang
Reviews.Content: When it comes to price, location and service, I find the Westin Bayshore to be unbeatable. Other hotels in Vancouver may be more opulent. They may be more trendy or funky. They might be right on a corner of Burrard and Robson. But my opinion is the Bayshore has the best combination of everything I am looking for. First is the location. Right by the harbor and Stanley Park, it is driving distance to most shopping areas in downtown...but that to me is a positive. I'd rather stay in a quiet hotel that is not on the hustle and bustle of a major street. Step outside the hotel and you have the clean air on tap. Watch seaplanes land and take off. Sit back and admire the towering forest tops with the blue and white mountains in the background. Second is the service. I've always been very delighted with the service at the Bayshore. Doesn't hurt if you're a Starwood Preferred Guest. Third are the rooms. Older, but very well maintained. Cons? It's a drive to most Vancouver shopping districts. The only parking options are valet $26 or self-park $23. You can see what they're doing here. Wireless internet access, now standard, is $14.99. In this day and age, why can't hotel chains just suck it up and offer this for free instead of nickel and diming customers? All in all, the Bayshore is the first place I check when I come to Vancouver. Rates are generally quite reasonable if there isn't a major convention on site. Most will be pleased with the choice.

Reviews.Title: “Below Average”
Reviews.Author: coffeechik
Reviews.Content: Stayed overnight at this place for a Christmas party. As anohter review said, the lobby etc is nice but the rooms are old. The concierge grabbed the keys out of my hand to "hang on to them" for me when I went in to register. The guy behind the desk had such a thick accent he could have told me to dip noodles in the pool and then square dance for all I understood. He was not friendly nor did he smile. The rooms are old and the bathrooms are poor. Our marble counter top had a piece of marble about 3 inches long a d 1/2 ince deep guoged out of it. The caulking and grout around the tub was covered in Mildew. COuld not for the life of me figure out how to close the plug in the tub. The "heavenly" beds are nice but no nicer than I've had in many hotels this year. FInally, they did not provide the correct size of coffee "Pod" for the coffee maker, we were given no key to the mini bar and the bottles of water we were told were "provided"in the room were $6 a piece! Other than the lobby and the location it was not much more than any Best Western.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the view”
Reviews.Author: relaxed_dude
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and two boys on the way to a vacation in northern Vancouver Island. We had a room with view of the coal harbor, the mountain and Stanley park. Really nice. The boys liked the pools. The location is great because, while you can have the view, its also a short walk from the streets with nice restaurants. The service was good, but I got the feel that this is more of a business/convention hotel, rather than a vacation hotel. I will stay here again when I am in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel along the water”
Reviews.Author: Gung_ho_in_TO
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a nice hotel. It is spacious and has the amenities one would expect. It's right along the water so you can take a nice morning stroll along the walk path. You're also near Stanley Park, which is a cool place to visit if you have a chance (I didn't this time). It's a little off the main strip but you're a short cab ride away from almost everything. And really, you can walk as well, it's really not that far - most things are walkable in Van if you're willing to put the effort into it. The hotel restaurant was good for brunch. I paid extra for the "Traditional Harbour View" but was a little disappointed with the view. Sure I was facing the water but all I saw was the marina and the parked boats as I was on a low floor. Overall, my experience was good at the Westin. ps. I was there for business so price/value really wasn't that big of a consideration but I usually try to be cost conscious nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Views from tower rooms are amazing!”
Reviews.Author: warmless
Reviews.Content: Vancouver is a beautiful city and the views from this hotel epitomize this statement. We stayed in a tower room in October 2007, and you would have to see the setting to believe it! The room looked over the bay, Stanley Park, city buildings, distant mountains, and lights in the distance at night. But aside from the views, the location is incredibly convenient for all that Vancouver has to offer, and is also convenient if you are a business traveler and attending meetings. The service delivered by ALL staff members was superb - from the housekeepers to bellman, everyone was genuinely interested in caring for their guests. One thing I really thought was nice was that several members of the staff would say hello and remembered what you may have mentioned the day before when you talked to them (e.g., where you went for the day) and would ask how your excursion was. All in all, if you are looking for a wonderful place to stay to experience such a vibrant, urban city, then this is the place to be. And yes, they are renovating the rooms. As with all Westins, the hotel lives up to a high standard. Yeah, some rooms may be in need of an update, but they are working on it. One thing I think many travelers think is that all hotels should be in a perpetually new state, like they should renovate their rooms every three years or so. This hotel was probably built 30 years ago. I think they have done a good job keeping it up. Let your vacation experience guide you and concentrate on other things rather than if the faucet looks old or the furniture may have a ding on it... Just a piece from a frequent traveler.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Bayshore is a good choice”
Reviews.Author: DollyDreamer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Pan Pacific in Vancouver and many fine hotels all around the world. Whilst the Bayshore is not exceptional it would definitely be my choice for my next visit to Vancouver. Especially since it is due for rennovation in September I think. We were upgraded from a traditional to a deluxe room which is much more spacious. Had we stayed, as a family of 4, in the tradtional room we would have been too cramped. The position of the hotel is the best in Vancouver, water front and near Stanley Park. What more could anyone want? Breakfast was good abeit not the best buffet I have seen -the pancakes were ready made and left to wilt way too long but there was lots of nice fruit) the outdoor and indoor pools were a bonus and the small gym was well equipped. Our view was the best with a corner room. I found front desk and concierge very helpful and overall it was an efficiently managed booking. Downsides? Impersonal, this is not a cosy boutique hotel, tradtional rooms are way too small, one of two lifts serving the main building was not functioning as everyone else has said, I thought the breakfast buffet layout did not lend itself to hygiene - the yoghurts and muesli were too exposed to all the users, the gym was a little grubby (sweat droplet marks all over floor, running machines and windows), Seawall restaurant and bar a little uninspiring (however, lots of choice nearby, try Cadero's) and internet charges too high. Sometimes one just needs to check emails and a $5 dollar minimun with a .30cent a minute charge is absurd. I went to one of the many Vancouver internet cafes where I accessed my email for $2. However, as I said, this hotel gets my vote.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireStLouis_Mo
Reviews.Content: The view from our room was great - got to watch the seaplanes land and take off on the harbor. The conceirge, Norton, was fantastic! All his recommendations for meals were terrific and he planned our sightseeing tours which were great. Service was great all the way around. We really enjoyed staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Man, what a view!”
Reviews.Author: a410traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property on August 10th with friends before embarking on a Princess Cruise to Alaska. The room was very nice even though several earlier reviewers had lead me to believe that the rooms were out of date and generally shoddy. The bathroom was of a good size and the amenities weree exceptional. The "Heavenly" bed was comfortable but not in my opinion exceptional. For a good, cheap breakfast or lunch I Recommend "Bojangles Cafe on the Water" Just turn left as you leave the hotel and walk about a block and a half. The view of the marina was world class

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: gg99
Reviews.Content: Our family's stay at the Westin was terrific. The location is unbelievable - you have a great view of the harbor and you can walk or bike into Stanley Park in no time. Being an east coaster, I was up early, and watched the sun rise from my terrace, while the cruise ships came into the pier. The lobby was beautiful, and for a city hotel, the outdoor pool was large, inviting and clean. There's a Starbucks in the hotel for the early morning coffee. The Corporate rate that I got made the hotel a great bargain. The room was comfortable and clean, although the hotel is clearly not new. We had a good-sized room with a terrace, but the wear of 30+ years is starting to show on the guest rooms and in the hallways. The indoor pool and health club were as you would expect for a large hotel. All of the staff were helpful, especially the bell desk and the greeter. The concierge were cordial and helpful, but not especially knowledgeable. They were able to make reservations for us for dinner and for rafting, but when we asked about taking an aerial tour, they said to just go down to the airport and we could take a flight immediately - that advice was incorrect - you definitely need to book ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Serene Escape”
Reviews.Author: Resort_Employee
Reviews.Content: My latest Starwood Hotel stay brought me to the Westin Bayshore, which is the only resort-style hotel in Vancouver. If one were to compare the locations of Vancouver's downtown hotels, the Westin Bayshore, in my opinion, has the best; its waterfront location is peaceful and serene. The hotel is within easy walking distance to all of the downtown attractions/shopping, as well as Stanley Park. Here are the highlights of my stay: Pro's: - Gorgeous waterfront locale. - Beautiful Lobby with acres of marble, blonde-wood accents and a large, cozy fireplace. - Friendly, courteous staff. - Views from the rooms are great! North/North-West facing rooms of the Bayshore Tower have the best views (Mountains/Ocean etc.). - As always, one cannot go wrong with Westin's Heavenly Beds - Exercise Room is very nice, and there are two pools on site (Indoor and Outdoor). - The Starbucks in the lobby-area is nice and convenient. - Currents Restaurant: excellent hotel restaurant that serves breakfast and Sunday brunch. It can be a little pricey, but the food is definitely worth it. The brunch buffet is amazing. Con's: - The hotel is large and has an expansive layout (can be confusing to navigate the hallways at first). - The elevators for the main-building were not all operating, so sometimes we had to wait a bit for the elevator. - The hotel's biggest fault is its age: though it was renovated in the late 90's, the hallways and rooms are showing some wear-and-tear. The main-level public spaces are perfect, but the guestrooms definitely need some upgrading (one of the hotel employees mentioned that this is rumoured to happen soon). - Seawall Restaurant: this is where the hotel serves Lunch/Dinner. Eating lunch here might be worthwhile, but dinner is overpriced for what you get (the waterfront views are appreciated, though). - Because the hotel has a large convention centre, it can get quite busy (especially evenings on weekends). Overview: Despite the hotel's shortcomings, with regards to outdated infrastructure/guest rooms, it excels in guest service, location, and atmosphere. The Westin Bayshore manages to successfully provide a resort-ambience in the downtown of a bustling metropolitan city: this is a great feat in and of itself. A return stay is definitely in the works.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: ATL75
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Westin Bayshore. We booked through Priceline and got a much better price than we would have otherwise, so I don't know if I would've been as satisfied had I paid full price. The exterior of the hotel, lobby, and other public facilities were beautiful. The location on the water is also very nice. The room itself was okay. Very comfortable bed and the dual showerhead was amazing (we actually thought about buying it!). The hotel is walking distance to Canada Place, Robson Street, and Stanley Park. We were disappointed with what seemed like the hotel "nickel and dime-ing" us or trying to squeeze every last cent out of us such as charging $16/day for in-room internet access, $0.30/minute for use of the internet in the business center with a $5 minimum charge. One last example of this was when we chose to self-park. We unloaded our bags, then my husband was just going to help me get the bags to our room and then return to park the car. Mind you, it was 11pm (not busy at all). The valet attendant told my husband that he couldn't leave the car there since we were self-parking. That was kind of annoying. But overall, we had a nice time staying at this hotel and would stay again (if we could get a reasonable price).

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, moldy rooms,rude concierge”
Reviews.Author: bcbg1983
Reviews.Content: Here is what I wrote to the hotel upon departure,need I say more? I should have listen to the other reviewers To whom it may concern, After reading many bad reviews on tripadvisor.com about your hotel, we decided to keep our reservations anyway as we already paid for the rooms and we've always had a great experience with Westin around the world. We did get an upgrade to a harbour view which was great although I'd like to point something out that actually came up on tripadvisor.com. My mother stayed in room 516 (my husband and I in 515) and her wallpaper was not only falling apart but there was some mold underneath. I called guest services and after 45 minutes, a tech came and put a blue pin to hold the wallpaper and told us that , that way, we wouldn't have to look at the mold anymore... i don't know about you but for the price of the room, mold is never out of sight, out of mind in my book. I explained my concerns to a guest service agent who gave 2 people of my party of 4 a complimentary breakfast for the next morning but although appreciated i feel that $70 was not fair compared to the moldy room situation. Last but not least if Morton at the concierge was extremely helpful and professional, Colette on the other hand was borderline racist and very rude. I asked her about Richmond and she said "I wouldn't know as I would not shop in that area". As an SPG member, my husband and i felt that the experience was awful. Next time if we are in the area we will probably stay at the Soleil or the four season hotel. I hope STARWOOD will review whether or not the bay shore should be on their hotel list. Thank you for listening

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Position by the Harbour”
Reviews.Author: TJ862
Reviews.Content: The hotel has one of the best locations for Vancouver and its worth staying there just for that alone. The room was very good with great views across Stanley Park and the harbour. The floatplanes fly past on approach to the harbour but you get used to the noise. There are a number of eating out options as the hotel is expensive. We used the Starbucks just off the lobby area and also ate breakfast in the hotel which was very good. Curiously we had an elevator problem like many others. There was always one elevator inoperative during our 5 day stay.There was a TV crew in filming around the pool area on one day which made for an entertaining morning. You can walk into Stanley Park in less than 10 minutes and then there is a huge area to wander around, well worth a visit. You can also walk to the Cruise Terminal and Gastown in about half an hour. We even walked to False Creek in about 35-40 minutes and took a little ferry across to Granville Island which is well worth a visit. The floatplane terminal is only about a 15 minute walk (but don't forget your photo ID if you plan on flying!). We would definitely stay in this hotel again, even if its just to go back to that location and walk along the harbour front and soak up the views.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so good rooms”
Reviews.Author: Saavy_Traveler_7
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a GREAT location. It is on Coal Harbor, next to Stanley Park. So, from a room with a good view, you could see the beautiful harbor and/or Stanley Park. It is only a 20-minute walk from Robson and Burrard intersection, where all the downtown shops and restaurants are. We were able to park for free on the street all six nights we stayed at this hotel, which was great. Of course, you would have to move your car by 9AM (11AM in case of one of the side streets). Even though the lobby and the restaurants look great, the rooms need major renovation. We were in a room on the 6th floor of the main part of the hotel (not the tower), a so-called Starwood Preferred Guest Floor. The bathroom was small and without any ventilation, which made the room rather musty. Worse than that, there was unpleasant mold on the bathroom tiles, the shower fixtures were beat-up, the wallpaper was wrinkled up in a couple of areas, and the door paint and trims were in bad shape. The room itself was better and the beds were reasonable. There were two elevators for the nine-story part of the building (not the tower part). One of these was broken during three of the six days we stayed at this hotel. Often you would see long lines in front of the only remaining elevator. There were no stairs to use; we were not allowed to use the emergency staircase. It shouldn't take a hotel more than three days to get an elevator fixed. I have mixed reviews for the hotel staff. I felt they could have done a better job (show more interest and attention, provide fuller answers to questions) of answering a few questions we had about points of interest and local events. Yet they were nice enough to try to make up for the hotels shortcomings and took some charges off our bill when we pointed out some of the problems.

Reviews.Title: “Many service, maintenance problems”
Reviews.Author: marcosmom
Reviews.Content: We had a Starwood Preferred Room on the 8th floor. It's nothing special in terms of a room - even a bit on the small size. But great view of the harbour. We had a number of service problems during our stay which were echoed by MANY other guests. 1. One of the main elevators broke down and remained unfixed for the entire 3 days we were there. People were waiting for a long time for the elevator. 2. Skip the SeaWall restauant in the hotel. I called the concierge to make reservations for the restaurant for Friday night and was told that the restaurant as a policy did not accept reservations and that we just should show up. Well, we showed up and were told by the hostess that all their reservations were filled long ago. We asked how long the wait would be, first they said 30 minutes and then finally they said probably 1 hour. I asked for their help to find us another restaurant - the two hosts - one male and one female - unhappily called two other restaurants for us. And then the female host suggested "why don't you try the White Spot?" (White Spot is the equivalent of Denny's in Canada.) It was insulting suggestion when I told her we were Westin guests, it was Friday night and she saw that we were obviously all dressed up and planned to be at a nice restaurant. 3. Concierge more problems - There is only one concierge and the hotel was full and had a conference. The concierge's phone was never answered the entire 3 days I was there - it always went directly to the voicemail. You had to go downstairs and stand in line - always at least 2 people in line in front of you - and wait. 4. Bugs in the swimming pool. LOTS of dead bugs. I counted over 20 insects floating right next to the shallow steps area where the kids were all playing. I called the spa maintenance to let them know - they said they'd send someone, but I did not see anyone cone to clean up the bugs. 5. I had two reservations for my stay - and told them when I checked in. On my third day - I was locked out of the hotel entrance (side entrance) coming back at night because my key doesn't work. I finally was able to get in - and the receptionist told me - "oh, we deactivated your keys because your room is under two separate reservations." It would have been nice for them to tell me when I first checked in and told them so - instead of this nasty surprise of being locked out of the hotel. All in all, this is not on par with other Westin's and need a lot of improvements in service. I am a Starwood Preferred guest and this was the worst Westin I've stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a pretty view”
Reviews.Author: MuchLoveForTravel
Reviews.Content: We booked the flight and hotel package from Travelocity - which we thought was a great deal. We stayed 4 nights at the hotel and really didn't want to leave the place! From our room - we could see the mountains and a bit of the harbour. The room was nicely decorated and bed was very comfy for a hotel bed. We would definitely stay at this hotel next time when we go back to Vancouver! July's weather was perfect!

Reviews.Title: “OK...room w/out a view was not worth $$$”
Reviews.Author: Sweetee Pie
Reviews.Content: I had to book a hotel last minute on Fri. July 20 2007 and a lot of hotels in town were sold out. I received a room with 2 double beds with no view for $255/night. Not the most glamorous room for a Westin but it was what it was...just a plain room. Washroom was small with no ventilation so room got a little musty after taking a shower. Beds were ok nothing amazing. Outside of the room, the property was very pretty and well maintained. FYI - Valet parking was $26 and internet was $14.95/24 hour period. I would stay here again and make sure that I got a room w/ a view well in advance!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - good vacation choice, particularly for families”
Reviews.Author: KentishMole
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights on a family vacation - 2 children, aged 3 and 1. Location was perfect, away from the hustle of the downtown area (although easily walkable) and ideally placed for Stanley Park. Also some very good restaurants close by. We had a tower room with view of harbour - I would strongly recommend these. Room was very spacious, beds fantastically comfortabble. Only downside was smallish bathroom (as others have commented). I found all the staff very friendly and helpful, and having a starbucks in the restaurant was also a plus. We didn't try the outdoor pool, but the indoor pool and jacuzzi was great - especially for the children. Would strongly recommend and wrong come back if and when we return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation: yes – Business: NO!”
Reviews.Author: misstracyjo
Reviews.Content: I wish I had only positive feedback here, because the staff were just great. Really the best front desk service I’ve encountered at a hotel. The location is great. The rooms are on the verge of being out of date, but still clean and comfy enough. But this hotel is NOT the place to have a business meeting. If you hold a meeting here, the charge for wireless is $250.00 for the first user, and $50.00 for every user after that. Wireless access from a room is reasonable (though in most hotels it is free). But for business or meeting access, the same equipment is mysteriously hundreds of times costlier. I attended a digital library conference here where participants had no Internet access. In the workshop I attended, the conference had paid the $250.00 fee so that presenters could demonstrate Internet resources, and it didn’t work! Further, they had scheduled a wedding with hundreds of people about 20 feet away from the conference rooms! You literally could not hear the presenters speak; they were drowned out by sing-alongs and the Bee Gees. So I paid for a conference where the presenters could neither demonstrate nor be heard. Absolutely would not recommend this hotel for business.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great views of the bay & mountains”
Reviews.Author: HOaKIE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed two nights at the Westin Bayshore while vacationing in Vancouver. The Westin has a great main lobby and the room was very nice. We stayed on the 4th floor (not in the tower) and had a great view of the bay and the mountains. Our room overlooked the heated pool. We could walk to Stanley Park in Vancouver as well as most of the west end of Vancouver. We felt very safe in this area of Vancouver and had easy walking access to many restaurants, shopping, and both sides of the bay area of Vancouver. There was occassional noise in the morning from seaplanes taking off and landing in the bay, so it could wake you up if you are a very light sleeper. I got a kick out of watching the seaplanes land in the bay outside our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!!! Must read if you're going to Vancouver...”
Reviews.Author: corinne311
Reviews.Content: After being stood up by someone I met on the Internet (I know, learned my lesson), I decided to go through with my vacation anyway, being that I had already pre-paid for everything and I'd never been to Vancouver. The minute I found out that my "counterpart" wouldn't be accompanying me, I contacted the concierge at the Westin Bayshore and informed him that I'd be traveling alone in a city I'd never been to. His name is Norton and he assured me that he'd help me find the best places to go and was sympathetic to my situation. As it turned out, he was working at the time I got into town and was extremely helpful in finding the best places to eat, go out, sightsee, etc., depending on my mood. The hotel itself was immaculate with a great pool (where I had a massage in a nearby cabana), tasty room service, wonderful/friendly staff and was centrally located. I travel for a living and this was one of the best hotel stays I've had and I was sad to leave. I spoke with other guests who had been to the hotel on previous occations and said that this is the only place to stay in Vancouver. The last picture I have in my head is Norton (my fave concierge) trying to help me zip up my luggage in the lobby after I'd shopped for the afternoon (check out is at noon and my flight was early evening so I had some time to kill). The zipper broke (my fault) but it was very funny and I thought it was great that he was really trying to help me. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Vancouver, one of the most beautiful cities I've every been to. Oh....and be sure to ask for Norton!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice front...Terrible back”
Reviews.Author: Waterman88
Reviews.Content: The new check in area is great, and makes you think the whole hotel is that nice...That's not the case. The hotel is really very old. The deck in our tower suite was tiny, and there was about 1 foot clearance from the door to the railing, which was rusting, and filthy. The bathroom was old, and the entire room was from the 70's. The hallways were dim, and had a yellow glow to them. It was gross! On the other hand, the room service food was good, and the breakfast buffet was amazing. Overall, a terrible hotel. Next time I am in Vancouver, I will book the Fairmont Waterfront, and I reccomend the Westin staff hire cleaning and design crews to bring their hotel into the 21 century!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: omnitravel
Reviews.Content: It met all of my expectations. One down side was the $26 valet parking charge ($23 if you self-park - which is a bit of a walk). Would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Incredibly Disappointing Experience”
Reviews.Author: USCgirlie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Westins around the world, and usually thoroughly enjoy my stay at these properties. As such, I expected an enjoyable stay from the Westin Bayshore, as I know it's a resort property as well as a recipient of a Conde Nast award. However, my extended stay with them had significant problems from the start: 1) The room itself: The room was in major need of renovation, as wear and tear of the carpets and the walls were evident. Stains highlighted the condition of the carpet, and it was a bit surprising/disorienting to see a stain on both the bed's white sheets as well as the comforter. My room, at approx 300 sq ft, was the smallest Westin room I've ever stayed in. Honestly, the Westin Berlin's gigantic bathroom was just 1/4 smaller than the bedroom in the Westin Bayshore. 2) Bedbugs! This was a big point of disappointment for me. During and after my trip, I was/am extremely itchy and have developed red bumps and welts on the skin. My traveling companions, also have the same symptoms. I understand that bedbugs aren't uncommon in hotels - however, I do expect more from a Westin than a middle-range hotel. Being that the bed's sheets and comforter had stains on it though, perhaps it is not that surprising... 2) The bathroom: Again, the size of this bathroom was incredibly small. Two people could not be in the bathroom at the same time, as there was just not enough space. Most disappointing in the bathroom, however, was the shower. The famed Westin dual showerheads was not a high point at this particular Westin -- one of the showerheads did not work. Additionally, water pressure for the other showerhead was low. The most uncomfortable aspect of the showers, though, was how the water temperature kept on alternating between warm and cool. 3) The "view" - this is a minor one for me. My room's "view" was of the hotel's own conference center. Not very pleasing. Additionally, the Westin was hosting a high school prom during our stay and we had the pleasure of hearing the loud music's bass due to our proximity to this conference center/ballroom. 4) Service/Checking in - As a Starwood Gold member, I've always been offered a complimentary upgrade upon checkin at Starwood properties (Westin, Sheraton, Le Meridien, etc.). However, upon check-in, the staff informed me that the 300-sq ft room I was assigned to, with a "view" of the hotel's own conference center, would not be eligible for an upgrade. By itself, not being upgraded is not a problem - however, coupled with the other problems presented at this Westin, it further dampered my experience. 5) The Good Points: Although I do not plan to stay at this property again, based on my poor experience here, I did thoroughly enjoy the hotel's spectacular, convenient location. Its setting amongst the harbor is gorgeous, and it is walking distance to Robson Street. Additionally, I liked using their gym. They had many machines (ellipticals, treadmills, bikes, stairmasters, weight machines) in addition to exercise balls and free weights. Overall, I encountered too many problems in my hotel room and definitely see it as my most disappointing stay at a Starwood yet.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bayshore”
Reviews.Author: HappyTourist1966
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the Westin Bayshore. We had a tower room with an incredible view of Coal Harbour and the surrounding mountains. The view was so incredible that some Vancouverite friends of ours took photos of the view from our room!! The hotel is located downtown right next to Stanley Park in a quiet area. The hustle and bustle of Robson street and the rest of the downtown core is a short (but uphill) walk away. The room we had was quite large and seemed to have been recently renovated. The beds were very comfortable and the bathroom was a reasonable size. The service was excellent and more than justified the high price of the room. If you needed anything it was just a phone call away. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The maid service was particularly outstanding. For example, the evening turndown service also included tidying up of the room and bathroom if it was a bit messy. Since we were travelling with two kids we skipped the pricey breakfast in the hotel and walked about five minutes to the White Spot restaurant just up the street and ate for half the price! We attended a wedding at the hotel and the reception rooms, food and service were all fantastic. It is an expensive hotel but you get so much for your money. If a hotel is just a place to sleep then there are less expensive alternatives , however, if it is an important component in your overall vacation experience then do not miss the Bayshore!

Reviews.Title: “An Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: margo43
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Starwood hotels before....this Westin was a little above average. The Marina view room was a nice view. I did not feel that paying the normal Westin rate was worth it, in this particular hotel. Left after two days and went to the River Rock Casino in Richmond which was half the price, much newer and despite it's location in an industrial boat yard ,seemed to be a much nicer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous views”
Reviews.Author: JasonBrownTx
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a few nights for my honeymoon. Bay-side rooms offered spectacular views of Coal Harbor and nearby Stanley Park, and the hotel was within walking distance of nice local eateries and the like. Would recommend this hotel to anyone, particularly paying the extra $$ to get a bay view from your room. The attached picture is a sunrise from my room. Gorgeous!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Fresh Breathe campaign at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kfrooke
Reviews.Content: We loved our one night stay at this hotel. The best part is that we were able to have our dog with us, at a luxury hotel. The websites don't tell you, but your dog needs to be under 40lbs. Ours is 60lbs., and when I called to verify the conifirmation booking, I told the hotel staff about him being larger. I was told, "Well, it's not like we are going to weigh him". Regardless, we decided to use the side entrances and the fire stairwell to let him in and out of the hotel to reduce the inveitable noise of his claws trying to grip the beautiful marble floor as you walk in to the registration area. The hotel was immacualte, and smelled good too. That sounds strange, but it has a "Heavenly" odor to the lobby, and the fresh Vancouver air outside was refreshing to encounter as we opened our sliding door in the room, to the harbour side of the main building. Staff were wonderful. Beds were awesome. The dual shower heads were the ultimate in high end accomodations. We recommend it highly!

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: brigbc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned today from a short two-day business trip to Vancouver, where we attended a conference at the Westin Bayshore Resort and Marina. We flew in by floatplane from Vancouver Island and landed literally at the hotel's doorstep. Needless to say, this was extremely convenient. On the day we were to arrive I called the hotel to confirm our reservation and to ask if we could get a room with a king-size bed. The person who answered was not friendly at all and didn't seem to be interested in helping us. She simply stated that the rooms had not yet been assigned and that there was nothing she could do at that point. This was a first for me, as I always call a hotel before arriving to verify that everything is okay. I have never received this kind of answer before. Check-in was quick and easy. The person at the reception desk was pleasant and accommodating and we got a room with a king-size bed without any problem. The room wasn't great. It was kind of small, especially the bathroom, which was also quite dingy. The paint on the door was chipped and there were dark stains that definitely should have been cleaned. The heating system was not working properly and the room was consequently on the cold side. The restaurants at the hotel are very average and after trying them once we preferred going somewhere else for our meals. All in all, this is not a bad hotel, but one that needs to adjust a few things. The location is great but that would be the only reason I would stay there again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: The Twin Cities of Minneapolis and St. Paul Minnesota
Reviews.Title: “Great location, comfortable rooms but uninspiring hotel”
Reviews.Author: ASD392
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice for a business conference. The location is good. Lots of restaraunts nearby, Stanley park is a short Jog. On the harbor so very scenic. As somebody else stated get an upper room for the view. The rooms are typically Westin. Clean and functional. Heavenly beds are truly that - along with the dozen or so pillows they give you in assorted shapes and sizes. This is a great place to stay if you are on business or jumping on or off a cruise ship. I think you could do better if you were going to spend more than a day or two here on vacation. Supposedly the pool is nice (I have only been there in February). Beyond that its a big cement and brick building with oversized public spaces. There's no real personality or comfort to it at all. Somebody mentioned lots of couches - it's like sitting on a sofa grouping inside an airplane hanger. You've got to get out of the building as quickly as possible to enjoy all that Vancouver has to offer. Its a fantastic place for a short business trip or to hold conferences or meetings. We have an annual conference there every year and the staff does a superb job. For my vacation I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view!”
Reviews.Author: Roberto7
Reviews.Content: My husband, baby, and I stayed at the Westin Bayshore for a week mid August 2006. Hotel: This hotel is in an excellent location (Coal Harbour/West End). It is right along the seawall, and is a 5 minute walk to Stanley Park and 15 minutes to English Bay beach. The room we stayed in was on the 17th floor and had a SPECTACULAR view of the ocean facing the marina. We would highly recommend that you stay on a top floor and request an ocean view. Every morning we would open up our sliding doors and eat our breakfast while gazing at the scenery. As a side note, our room had a mini fridge which we used to store fruit and milk for our breakfasts. Safeway (corner Robson & Denman) is a 5 minute walk from the hotel, so purchasing basic grocery items to store in your room is very easy. The room we stayed in was a little on the small side but very clean and new (maybe 350 square feet). Although we did not spend much time in the hotel, it does have a huge main floor with plenty of couches and love seats to use. The outdoor pool was nice, but very small. If you intend on getting a chair around the pool go early and secure a spot! We cannot comment on value because we used aero plan points to book the room (it would have been about $300 + per night). This hotel is also minutes away from Denman St which is a haven for food lovers like us! Restaurants: Places we liked! Vera's Burger Shack - best burgers we have ever had! (Denman St.) Mondo's gelati - best we ever had, so many flavors, I had 14 in 7 days! (Denman St.) Cupcakes - you should try it once. (Denman St.) Banana Leaf - amazing Laos food, only a few tables get there early. (Denman St.) Pho Number 1 - very inexpensive subs and ok soup (Denman St.) Falafel King - amazing beef swhwarma, must try it!!! (Denman St.) Nates Pizza - great cheap snack to go. (Denman St.) New York Grill - lots of basic food for cheap. (Denman St.) Modern Burger- great burgers (if you are into fresh/homemade type burgers), fries, and milk shakes! (Kitsalano area) Restaurants: Places we did not like! Samay's Hot wings - chicken fat and skin in the chicken swhwarma DISGUSTING! (Robson St.) Zakasushi - just ok, more hype then it's worth! (Denman St.) Other: Time Square Inn is definitely worth looking into if you would like more of an apartment style vacation. We took a tour of it and will be staying there next time we are in Vancouver. It's much cheaper ($189 per night) then the hotels, and has much more space (living area and kitchenette and in room laundry) 650 square feet. It does not have a ocean view but is on the corner of Robson and Denman which is also an excellent location. Tips: - Laundry mat on Denman if needed - HUGE outdoor family swimming pool along seawall down from English Bay (end on Denman) - Go to the aquarium in Stanley park - You can rent bikes on the corner of West Georgia and Denman - All restaurants are very very small in downtown. If you have a stroller like us for the baby, go early! - Most hotels have free shuttles to the mall down Robson. Have a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel, Spotty Service”
Reviews.Author: Toronto22
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two young children. The location is awesome - right on the sea wall, within walking distance to Stanley Park and the aquarium. The staff were fine, but you never got great service, and were often ignored. For example, we phoned one night to ask how we could warm up our toddler's bottle (hoping there would be a microwave in a lounge somewhere). We were told we could use something in the hotel kitchen, were asked to wait while they checked, and then were put on hold for 5+ minutes - we finally gave up. We also called one night to ask where the nearest laundromat was - and they didn't know and didn't offer to help. We ended up looking it up in the yellow pages. Strangely, they had a great kids' menu for dinner, but nothing for breakfast (and the buffet downstairs was expensive). There is a kid-friendly WhiteSpot on the corner. Valet parking was worth the extra cost.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: tynwald
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel in a superb location particularly if you get a room overlooking the harbour front. The staff (front desk , restaurant and friendly/knowledgeable concierge team) were first class in every respect. The rooms very comfortable. Breakfast was outstanding and the home-made croissants the best I`ve ever tasted. The one negative was the limited menu in the restaurant at night and the total absence of a Coffee House for light meals/drinks. In the mornings there is a small servery where coffee and muffins can be bought but it closes late morning without alternatives later in the day. Certainly a hotel we would seek to stay in when next in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a "who cares" attitude”
Reviews.Author: fotoboy
Reviews.Content: When my sister announced that she was booking us a room at the Bayshore as our wedding present, we were thrilled. The Bayshore has been a Vancouver institution for years, and has probably the best location in Vancouver. As it turned out, the wedding was the best, but the hotel, and particularly the service, was awful. We arrived late, in great spirits after the reception. Entering the room, a bouquet my sister had sent was lying on the desk, no vase, no water, and decidedly limp. Although it had been booked as a wedding night gift, there was absolutely nothing from management, not even a note or bottle of cheap bubbly. The room was adequate. In the morning, they had slipped the bill for this experience under the door, and I saw how much my sister had paid for this (which in itself I thought was truly crass). We were determined not to let this get to us, but I couldn't leave without filling out the "client (dis) satisfaction" form that goes to the manager. Response to date - nothing. We have stayed in many good hotels, and this experience was definitely sub-par, especially for the price. By contrast, we honeymooned in San Francisco at the Hotel Vitale, where management sent us a beautiful iced bottle of Laurent-Perrier champagne, which was just one example of the class and level of service of that hotel. The lesson - don't equate price with service, at least at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised at Reviews!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rinkman
Reviews.Content: I am very very surprised at the reviews this hotel is getting. Ok the bathrooms are small. But when you are in one of the greatest cities in North America....how much time do you really want to stay in there anyway???? The hotel was built before large bathrooms became a need for some obviously. The staff was so helpful, a couple of them walked with us outside showing us the way to get places! The outdoor pool was very inviting and sat right on the harbor. The views from my room were awesome. Stanley Park, the bay, seeing seaplanes coming and going, boats everywhere, and the "walkway" in front of the bay right outside my window made the city shine. Unlike complaints I have seen about elevators at the Grand there are no problems with that here. The lobby is very nice IMO. The exercise room is very well kept up, with all the latest equipment. The indoor pool (ok), steam room (awesome) and sauna (awesome) all were maintained and clean. I do not understand closing at 11pm though .......I wish the management would keep it open 24 hours as the "health club" would not keep any guests awake if people were using it. I do wish wireless was provided for...however there are several places all within a 10 minute walk that do provide it and that made me go out and walk! Bike rental places minutes away to rent a bike and go anywhere in the city or roam gorgeous Stanley Park. Robson Street and shops not far either..... I will 100% go back to stay here, infact I am July 2007! Another fyi......I used points while I booked another room on hotwire....The hotwire reservation was upgraded with a rather expensive charge, when I asked again about why such a steep fee they reduced the rate to something much more fair and honestly quite nominal. Sometimes you just have to ask!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Average Hotel in World Class Location”
Reviews.Author: MonkeyGreen
Reviews.Content: The location of the Westin Bayshore is superb. Right next to Stanley Park in the center of Coal Harbour, views, views, views from the public spaces (but not necessarily the rooms). The outdoor amenties including the pool and marina make this a better choice in summer that winter. That being said this as the worst Westin I have ever stayed in. The hotel is definitely catering to the convention trade and lacks any sort of personality. The hallways are overheated and smell of mildew. The rooms are nothing special (I had a King Tower Room) and need new carpet. Beds comfy but its the Heavenly bed. All in all there are a lot of better choices in Vancouver, I would not stay here again,

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful views, o.k.rooms”
Reviews.Author: veggie-dave
Reviews.Content: I agree with those who say this is number one location in Vancouver, especially in the summer. Views over the harbour and Stanley Park are wonderful. Whilst the hotel itself is fine I do feel the rooms let it down. We upgraded to the Towers and when asked if we go higher than 6th floor were told it had the best views (still trying to work that one out) As commented on, the bathrooms are tiny and not meant for spending any time relaxing in. The small walk out balcony serves no purpose as you cannot stand let alone sit on it. My advice would be for summertime this hotel is a good bet but at any other time you might want a hotel which has more of a feel that you would like to spend some time in it

Reviews.Title: “Truly Heavenly beds!”
Reviews.Author: mazdauk
Reviews.Content: After sitting at Heathrow for hours and being (wrongly) told we could not take books on board any hotel was going to look good after a 10-hour flight. The Westin looked better than good! Slightly concerned on check-in to be expected for only one night, this was swiftly corrected (as we had booked and paid for 4 nights!) and we were allocated a room one level up with a side view over the water towards Downtown (and a birds-eye view into reception if we were interested!). First essential was a trip to the indoor pool and jacuzzi to unwind - an excellent start, the water warm and surroundings clean. (The outdoor pool was very private - shame really as it cut off the view - and a lovely place to relax with a book while being served your choice of suitable drinks and food!) We had eaten quite heavily on the plane, but the boys (12 and 6) were very hungry so we went to the Seawall Bar & grill for a drink and a snack - excellent quality food, drinks and service. Not a cheap option (although the kids meals were very good value) but nice to eat looking out over the harbour. The beds were very high quality, with a selection of pilows and the firmness cushioned by a down matress topper. Perfectly situated to walk along the waterside path to Stanley Park or Downtown, even with little legs.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: perdita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for the final night of our Canadian holiday this year, having been in Whistler for the rest. It was the perfect end to a wonderful holiday, the hotel is beautiful and the service excellent. We stayed on the 6th floor of the tower with a harbour view room and I think it was worth the extra over the standard rooms as the views were superb. Really handy for Stanley Park, we went there three times in the two days of our stay. The pool was nice, although the water was a little chilly for my tastes. We didn't try the indoor pool but it and all of the health spa facilities looked good. The 'Heavenly' bed and 'Heavenly' showers that they boast about are worthy of boasting, the bed was at least a super-king size and was very comfortable and the dual-headed shower is a fantastic idea and great to use. We will certainly stay there again. I see that the chain has another hotel in Scotland so we will probably check that out too, if it is anything like the Westin in Vancouver it will be worth visiting.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: mkata
Reviews.Content: After a wonderful Alaskan cruise through the Inside Passage to Vancouver, we were prepared for a bit of a letdown at the Westin Bayshore Resort, especially since we got such a great rate through Hotwire. But we were pleasantly surprised to get a harbor view room with a large balcony. We received top-notch service from an attentive staff that helped with tour arrangements and transportation to the airport. The hotel is conveniently located between downtown and Stanley Park and the Coal Harbour area makes for a delightful stroll morning, noon or night. After spending a week with a tiny bathroom aboard the ship, we found no problems with the often-maligned size of the Bayshore's bathroom. There's also a nice security feature that restricts elevator access to the floors to card-carrying guests.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Berneses
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Bayshore for two nights August 17-19th and it was fantastic. We were on the 4th floor and had a FABULOUS view of Coal harbor and the marina and the mountains. The bed was comfortable and cozy. Normally we stay at inns and bed and breakfasts as we don't like the "generic" hotel experience, but this was perfect. The location is excellent whether or not you are taking cabs, walking or driving. We drove over to Grouse Mt. and the Park (wonderful) and cabbed to other areas of town. Walking distance to Gaslight District. The hotel grill had an amazing classic margarita. Would return to this hotel in a heartbtae!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely my best decision”
Reviews.Author: SenseIntoDollars
Reviews.Content: I looked up rates on Hotwire for a five night stay in downtown or westend Vancouver. There was one offer that stood out. The three star and 3.5 star properties were offering prices of $55, and then ther was a 4 star listed for about the same, so I thought, "take a chance." Including tax, after conversion, I paid $67 a night including taxes and fees. I expected a room with a view of a wall. I got a room, on the 4th floor, city view; a very nice find given the normal $235 nightly rate. On the second night of my stay the room above was noisy. I found out later that workers were renovating the room (at 11 p.m. on a Sunday night). I called to discuss this with the front desk; security got the workers to leave, and in the morning, I was upgraded to a towers room ($385/night) at no extra charge, and given a room credit for dinner, as an apology, as the hotel didn't expect contractors to be working after 5 p.m., or on weekends. Now I had a room overlooking the marina and Stanley Park, great sunsets, and nearby to both pools. If I return to Vancouver this will be the place due to it's location and style, along with a professional attitude of customer service. It pays to expect less than what you pay for, and be polite when you have a problem. Sometimes you are surprised and receive rewards beyond what you deserve.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel with a great view”
Reviews.Author: dblacksam
Reviews.Content: If you stay in the tower of this hotel the views are amazing. We could see mountains, the park, water, boats and blue blue sky. The room itself was nothing special - bland and business-like and the bathroom was small yet the shower was one of the best I have experienced in any hotel in the world. Guest services were extremely efficient and helpful and responded to a variety of requests in no time at all. We didn't use the outdoor pool but it did not look very appealing to me. The only meal we ate in the hotel was breakfast on our first morning - we did not repeat this experience on the second morning! The service was sullen and slow and the food wasn't great and was certainly over-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent, full-service hotel”
Reviews.Author: exprof
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything! Wonderful pools, convenient eating venues, helpful staff, luxurious beds, spectacular location. Ask for a harbor view room. Make sure to walk along the water. Dine at the Sequoia Grill -- in neighboring Stanley Park. There are also plenty of informal eating and gelato shops and food stores within a block or two of the hotel. A 5-star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your typical Westin”
Reviews.Author: DLB1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 8-12-06 for one night following an Alaska cruise. I have always appreciated the quality of the Westins I've stayed at in the past but this place didnt measure up to the other Westins. Yes overall it was much nicer than your average hotel and it is in a good loaction on the Marina, very close to Stanley Park and a $6.00 cab ride form the cruise terminal. No they dont provide local transportation or even to the airport. The property is need of a facelift/remodeling. The overall appearance of the rooms,and common areas were outdated and need to be redone. In addition to needing new pain, wall paper, tile etc. There was a horrible stench in the hallways like from raw sewage. For the price I was a little dissapointed and will find another place in Vancouver next time I return unless I find out the hotel has been remodeled.

Reviews.Title: “Pleaasant, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: flyerfan22
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 rooms using Hotwire - got a great deal of $104 per night (before HW fees). We were staying in Vancouver for one night after a cruise, and we did not have a car so we wanted something close to restaurants and the airport. The Westin did not disappoint! It only took 10 minutes by taxi from the Canada Place cruise terminal ($6) Unfortunately, the rooms were not ready when we arrived around 10 am. It was understandable since it was way before check-in. The only complaint we had is that the clerk didn’t even check for availability. He just said “no, check is at 3. Nothing is available now.” We were skeptical since he didn’t even check the computer. Anyway, we checked our bags with the Bellman and explored the city. Stanley Park is right there at the Westin, and is a beautiful park. We walked about 1.5 KM, then hopped on the free shuttle through the rest of the park. We returned to the hotel around 1, and our rooms were still not ready. We left 1 member of our group resting in the lobby (not feeling well), and walked to Robson Street and Gastown. Both were interesting for window shopping and last-minute souvenir shopping. We returned to the Westin at 3:30. Finally, our rooms were ready. We had 3 rooms next to each other on the 8th floor of the North Tower (801, 802, 803). Not a good view (overlooked the roof of another building), but the rooms were spacious and comfortable. The beds were VERY comfortable, and we were very happy to have nice robes in the room. We looked at the pools (one indoor and one outdoor) and the gym. Both looked very nice, but we were too tired to use them. We arranged with the bellman to have van taxi’s at 5:15 the next morning (our flight was at 7:30 am). The taxi’s showed up at 5:10, and we were at the airport by 5:40 am ($30). We highly recommend the hotel – it was within walking distance to lots of nice places, and is a beautiful (albeit expensive) hotel. Note: It was not necessary to exchange US dollars for Canadian dollars. Taxi’s accepted US dollars, as did every shop we visited. Change was not available in US dollars.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view.”
Reviews.Author: gabirds
Reviews.Content: I notice that this hotel is getting some poor reviews, but we enjoyed our post cruise stay here, helped mainly because we really liked Vancouver. We were given a marina view room, the bedroom sliding glass doors open to reveal a beautiful view right from your bedroom, far better than a balcony ever could. You can even lie on the bed and watch TV while enjoying the view. Westin's featured beds and linen are a dream. Location is perfect. We walked around the marina into Stanley Park. English Bay is only a ten minute walk, so too is the city center. Rent bikes two blocks inland. Restaurants around the bay and in the back streets. Travel center in the hotel booked our trip to Capilano Suspension bridge and the Skyride Gondola to the top of Grouse Mountain right from the hotel. Reception staff were "starchy". Lobby has no atmosphere. Dining/drinking options in the hotel very pricey, breakfast $25. Bathrooms on the small side. Hotel is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Better Management”
Reviews.Author: lepage
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Bayshore in the past, and it has always been great. This year, we checked in during a Vancouver heat-wave in order to give ourselves, and our children, a nice break. Here are the problems we encountered: 1. Our suite was not ready when we arrived 2. The lady at the front desk informed us that there was no food served pool-side. None. I asked if I could bring a cold drink and was told "no". We were stunned, as we were starved and had to wait for our suite to be cleaned. Turned out, she was dead wrong, which was very disturbing and unprofessional 3. Our children's cots were not set up, as was requested 4. Despite being 90-degrees, there were only TWO umbrellas by the poolside. I was practically in tears and my husband had to borrow umbrellas from the restaurant which caused quite a commotion. The restaurant manager agreed that it was absurd and dangerous to have no umbrellas in such intense heat 5. The poolside tables & chairs are cheap plastic, the service is very slow, and the poor staff are expected to wear clothing that is ridiculous - long pants, no hats, etc. It was painful to watch 6. Poolside staff was inadequate - tables were piled with dirty plates and glasses 7. There are no pool toys available - bring your own 8. There was no kettle in the room to make tea and it took nearly half an hour to have one brought to the room 9. Our bill was wrong and we had to wrangle with the manager The Bayshore is beautiful but currently, it is badly managed, which is a real shame.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and expensive”
Reviews.Author: VacationingProf
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed with this hotel. We were upgraded to a deluxe tower room with harbor view, but even then the room was very small with a tiny bathroom. The hotel is in serious need of a renovation. They nickel and dime you on everything, despite being quite costly. When we phoned down for a late checkout, we were told that it would be at a rate of $50 an hour, despite the hotel not being full the next night. (We subsequently went to ask at the front desk and were very quickly given one for free). The restaurants are unbelievably overpriced. The inside pool room was quite cold - everyone was getting out shivering. As we keep saying, this experience is enough to make you not want to stay in a Westin again. We won't be.

Reviews.Title: “Was Average”
Reviews.Author: JohnDaniels
Reviews.Content: Hotel has impressive views if you get the right room, try and get either the tower or the east face of the main building. We stayed on the third floor where the view was O.K but not the best. Walls are thin so had a couple of noisy nights from other guests (kids screaming etc.) Small bathroom but functional. Didn't seem to bother the hotel that they wanted to do repairs / refurbishment of the room above starting at 9am!!! Wasn't impressed. Would recomend if the price is right! Would have been disappointed if I had paid full price!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but some problems...”
Reviews.Author: boingo_tx
Reviews.Content: First of all we got a room through Priceline for $100. so naturally we got a tower city view, but it was still worth it since we were on the 19th floor and a corner room where we could see the city and Stanley Park. Very clean hotel, the heavenly beds are great, but yes the bathrooms are small. Location is fantastic since we went to Stanley Park, Capilano Bridge and Grouse Mountain. Lots of places to eat down Robson or nearby streets. My only beef is that we rented a car and had to pay $20-$23 a night for parking. Not bad, but the hotel really should take care of that. Just another added cost. The Starbucks coffee place in the lobby is good since the hotel restaraunts are outrageous for breakfast. (Dinner too) The workout gym is great. Really a nice hotel, I guess the parking situation and the hotel restaurant pricing are the only problems I have with the hotel. Staff was great and helpful. I do like that you can choose the time they will clean your room up. I stayed up late, got up late, and rarely left before 10:30am. So choosing your own time is helpful. Don't pay full price, try to get a good deal when you can.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: irishgal2
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here for 5 nights and we both loved it, from the location to the staff, nothing could be faulted. We had requested a room with a view, however there were none available when we booked in. We were told that there was one available the next day if we wanted to move. We decided to and were delighted with the room we got. The views of the harbour were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Spic 'n Span Rooms - Wonderful View!”
Reviews.Author: WORLDLYLADY
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel much more than others we've stayed at in the last couple years. We usually stay at Hyatt Regency hotels, but this was our first time at a Westin. My husband and I were very impressed with the quality of the rooms. I must share that we scored this hotel on Priceline 2 months ago for $125 a night plus taxes for a grand total of $150 a night USD. We were NOT disappointed. We even knew to request the tower rooms for an upgrade fee, and upon check-in we did exactly that. However, the nice check-in fellow talked us out of it since they'd already assigned us a Harbor View room. It was a fabulous view looking inward toward Stanley Park and the Harbor, with a view of the mountains as well. Check-in guy told us if we wanted to go to the tower, it would only be a city view anyway. Hotel was pretty full. Check-in guy told us that the day before he'd checked in 150 Priceline and Hotwire customers! The service was excellent at this place. We got off a cruise ship and arrived here at 10:45 a.m. and were able to get right into our room. They put us on a preferred Starwood floor too. I had signed up for Starwood before embarking on our journey so maybe that had something to do with it. I do love the non-smoking feature of this hotel. We loved that we could open the sliders (no balcony though) It was nice having fresh air. However, someone was smoking marijuana which wafted into our room, and the man next door to us, he complained as well. There was a very loud wedding going on late into the night with LOUD music and we called the front desk as did several other people, and management took care of it immediately! It was simply a matter of turning down the bass and closing an outer door that led into the courtyard which our room faced. We loved the amenities of this hotel. The bathroom, although petite, is not that small compared to a cruise ship bathroom. So to us it seemed like a spacious bathroom after dealing with phone booth-sized shower stalls on the ship. We ate at the restaurant downstairs which has the outdoor patio area. Can't remember the name -- but we had two great dinners. Service was a bit slow, I must say. But it afforded us a chance to just soak in the great views. We lucked out with 80 degree weather the entire trip. This property is approx. a one-mile trip from Canada Place cruise terminal, and we walked with our luggage all the way from there to this hotel. We stayed here not even one week ago. We will go back to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Sophie2604
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay at the Bayshore in 2 years and it has got better. There is a new GM in place and the only thing that let it down before was the staff and their service but you cannot fault that now. It is quite simply the best location in Vancouver, there is a handy downtown shuttle bus and the Harbour/Stanley Park views are superb. The rooms in the old wing are tired and due for shut down and renovations. Food in the bar is good. I love the Stanley Perks coffee shop and the outdoor pool. Right on the seawall for a real authentic Vancouver experience. I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful property”
Reviews.Author: Moosi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel for one night, June 20/21, 2006. The location was excellent and quiet. It is in a primarily residential condo area right on the water. An easy, very scenic, walking distance to downtown and Stanley Park. It has both an indoor and an outdoor swimming pool and an exercise gym. Two restaurants are on site and others close by. Ours was a pleasure trip but the attached Conference Centre attracts a large business clientele. The Hotel is extremely clean and well looked after and the staff were helpful and friendly. We were on the fourth floor of the main building and overlooking the water. The room was quiet with the exception of a bang when the door to some of the adjoining rooms were shut. The only negative was the very small bathroom. We would highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: cheddyanne
Reviews.Content: Stayed with friends for six nights from 10th June. Although the bathroom has to be the smallest in the world (only fit one medium sized person at a time) and was looking out at a brick wall (did not help to be a starwood member as far as outlook was concerned) we still enjoyed our stay at this hotel. Has the best location in Vancouver and the staff were so friendly and helpful. Being close to Denman Street is great, lots of very good restaurants particularly for breakfast, try the Russian restaurant, great home cooked meals!

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheds
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Bayshore on the last night of our holiday around British Columbia. The staff were superb. Unlike others on your site, we asked for an upgrade on arrival- nothing venutered, nothing gained- and were given a complimentary upgrade, although maybe we were paying more than your other reviewers. Travelling with our children, we found the room to be spacious, clean and, had we known about the view before we got there, we may even have paid for the upgrade as it is just stunning. We didn't want to close the curtains at night, so as not to miss any of the vew. Can't really fault it. Yes, it was 26 dollars to park the car over night, but this compared favourably with London hotels and they don't have sea and mountian views. This hotel was 10 times beter than the Graville Island Hotel we started our trip in, which is very much more highly rated on this site and not much less money. The postion of the Westin is perfect for tourists like ourselves - just missed the breakfast in Granville Island market, but you can't have everything.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Bayshore was great for the hotwire $$”
Reviews.Author: travelingurl
Reviews.Content: We went to Vancouver for our wedding anniversary trip. I had booked the hotel through hotwire for a price well below market. When we arrived, we had been given a room on the 2nd floor with a view of the rooftop equipment. Additionally, the room had two double beds. I called down to the front desk and explained that wouldn't work, the front desk personnel offered to upgrade us to a Harborside room for a fee, but quickly offered the upgrade as complimentary. When I went to the front desk to retreive our new keys, she told us that the Harborside Room she had suggested was not available all 3 nights of our stay and that she had upgraded us to the Tower instead. Our view from the 6th floor of the tower was terrific--we were able to watch the sea planes land and overlooked the marina and the park. In the end, the hotel was a great base for our weekend of dining and celebration. Weather was less than ideal, but we're from Seattle, so a few clouds didn't bother us. The park was easy distance and the hotel is well situated for a nice evening stroll along the waterfront. While the buildings were older, the rooms (as far as decor goes) had been updated. Built items, like the size of the bathrooms, were tell tale of the buildings age. The main common spaces had all been updated, and had a contemporary/well maintained feel. The concierge and valet were very helpful. We didn't try the hotel restaurants, but the brunch buffet looked good. For what we paid, I wouldn't hesitate to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Quick Check-out!!”
Reviews.Author: sadiekins
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay in an excellent hotel. Rooms are lovely. My husband is disabled and it did have a great accessible room. But two concerns made me feel that this hotel has some problems to work out. First, they encourage you to use Quick Checkout. I believe this is easier for their staff as there were no line-ups at the front desk at check-out time. They leave a form and paper invoice under the door of your room on the day you are leaving. You sign the form to authorize the charges although there is no final amount shown. Then you receive an e-mailed Folio of your account. The Folio account was very confusing. The charges on it appear to be more than they should be because the show the "Credit Card Hold amount" - except nothing indicates it is a Credit Card Hold amount. In my case it just showed an extra $80.00 charge to my Visa. I had to contact the hotel for an explanation. Staying at a Westin you can collect Starpoints. My e-mailed account says I'm entitled to 320. My paper invoice says only 23. The hotel does not know why there are two different amounts. I really think that what you receive in an email confirmation from any hotel, especially one with the Westin name, it should be clear and correct and you should not have to waste your time figuring it out and contacting the hotel. My other concern was that because my husband is disabled and I have to push him in a wheelchair to our room I requested assistance with our bags. As there was no one available, I was advised they would be immediately brought up to our room. After waiting 25 minutes and no bags brought up, I went to the lobby and there they were sitting in the middle of the lobby - anyone could have taken them.

Reviews.Title: “There are better deals out there...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location is good Pool and hot tub are great concierge is helpful non-smoking hotel Cons: $40/night upgrade for the tower rooms onslaught of ads for buying their "heavenly" stuff, which wasn't so heavenly $15/24 hours for internet (isn't the modern world about free wi-fi???) no mention about the free shuttle ("take a taxi" which will cost you a ton) small, i mean TINY, bathroom shower head is too short for someone that's taller than 5'8", bathroom is dark mold/holes in the ceiling $23/day for SELF parking I went through priceline and got a great deal, but then the $40 upgrade (as the other reviews have said) was a bit of a scam. I didn't appreciate all the ads in the room. If I want to watch commericals, I'll turn the TV on! I think I could definitely get the same price and get free parking and free internet and a free pool at another place just as convenient. I wouldn't stay here again, but I suppose if it's what you are looking for then it wouldn't be so bad. The location is wonderful and the view is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific base for a great area”
Reviews.Author: bobwood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Bayshore for 10 days from April 9th and found the hotel a super base from which to explore Vancover and the surrounding area. The hotel staff were on the whole very friendly and eager to please, especially in the seawall restaurant, where the food was good value. I recommend the oversized pint of Okanagen lager to wash down their generous portions of local fish - the fish and chips is substantial. The only drawback if you want a really quiet restaurant is the number of young children in there before 8.00 - not overly annoying, but you are very conscious of them. Also reserve a seawall table, the sight of so many jogging/cycling/skating past while you tuck in is bound to amuse ...on both sides of the glass!! Excellent fitness centre in the hotel though - if you do want to keep yourself under control ! Room on 19th floor of tower was brilliant with superb views of the harbour by day and night - try to get an upgrade if you are initially given a room in the main block, it is worth it! If you hire a car from the Hertz outlet in the hotel, ask if you can leave your car in one of their reserved spaces if they are free. The charge in the main car park is $26 per night, in the rear car park it is $18 per night - if space is available and you have a hertz car that is obviously quite a saving. I recommend visiting the Granville street market area, many of the craft outlets there are very individual and the work on sale is all local. The road to Whistler is well worth the journey, although you may get held up by the improvements currently taking place in readiness for the olympics, Whistler itself is rather brash and loud - you'll either like it or loathe it , the new environmental centre at Squamish is well worth a look. If you are feeling really brave try Harbour planes flight over the glaciers and lakes - about $230each, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel to hold events and to stay at”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view! Great walking distance to TONS of shopping and restaurants. The concierge was so helpful in finding a nice little French crepe place for breakfast. I had a dance competition there and the ballrooms are huge, very beautiful and decorated nicely. The staff did a great job keeping the hotel tidy. Check in was a long process but overall a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “My favourite in Vancouver”
