Reviews.Author: itinerantnomad
Reviews.Content: Interesting to see such variability in ratings in some of the reviews. I have never stayed in the Tower, but prefer the main building, and always get a room near the marina end of that building....last time I was on the 8th floor, and this time on the 4th. Stunning views of the water, boats, Stanley Park. This time I was in 415, and noticed that the X15 rooms are corner rooms, and have more space. Perhaps helped that I have a Starwood membership, but it's at basic level, so don't think I was getting any preferential treatment. And I'd booked direct on the hotel website for a cheapo C$129 rate - a steal. Tried Cardero's restaurant (almost right beside the hotel) for the first time, and had a great evening...I would recommend it if you want to get out of the hotel but don't want to go far. The Westin Bayshore's spectacular location right on Stanley Park, and the peace & quiet of the area, continues to make it the only place I would stay in Vancouver. PS This was the view from my room last time on 8th floor, and 4th floor was just as beautiful!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vancouver Waterfront Hotel at the moment”
Reviews.Author: orcas33
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a room with a view, this is your hotel on the Vancouver Waterfront right now, the Fairmont Waterfront and the Pan Pacific being surrounded by loud and busy construction sites for another many months. Be sure to ask for a room in the tower. Now, if you like a big bathtub and a large bathroom, this hotel is not for you, theirs are disappointingly the tiniest I've seen in North America. But the view on the harbor, Stanley Park and the mountains is just great. Seaplanes are landing nearby but you don't hear them if the bay window is closed and they stop after dark. The Westin "heavenly" beds are a real treat too. The spa and pool (indoor, I did not try the outdoor) are clean and airy. The reception staff is really nice. The only flaw (apart from the bathroom) was breakfast: everything was cold and soggy and staff invisible. But you're just a few blocks away from most of the best eating places in downtown Vancouver. As long as the Pan Pacific is lost in noisy chaos, the Westin Bayshore is to me the best waterfront hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “We'll definitely come back to the Westin Bayshore!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetera
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Westin Bayshore from the 28th of January through till February the 2nd. We got a $60US a night rate through Priceline. An unbelievable price considering on the website it was about a hundred dollars more. My boyfriend checked pretty quick and we were off to our room on the 7th floor. He didn't ask for anything specific but we got a corner room and it faced the water. We had a tiny balcony but it was nice. The room was pretty spacious and appointed really nicely. The bed was truly heavenly. One thing that really was great was the shower. I stayed in a Westin the week before in San Diego but the water pressure wasn't as strong. This shower head was amazing. Westins have a double shower head. I really didn't want to get out of there! The only thing is I don't really care for their Heavenly bath products. I wish they were like the W and offer Aveda or some brand name product. One great thing is that now Westin is a completely smoke free hotel. No more smoking in any of the areas or rooms. Woo hoo (sorry smokers)! I forgot the name of our doorman but he was amazing. Really helpful and gave us his name and asked us to ask for him if we had any requests or needed anything. Service was pretty good so far. Parking over the course of the 5 days wasn't really a problem. I could always find free street parking. During dinner hours once I had a tough time but just parked by a meter because we were going to step out again anyway. It's pretty nice if you want to save some money. Valeting the car costs about $18/day and if you self-park it's $12 and you have to walk to a garage which is beside the street parking anyway. You might as well street park for free. The signs say 2 hour free parking from 9am-6pm Monday to Saturday. They don't really check up and you just have to move your car by about 11am. I was pretty happy about free parking. The hotel has an indoor and outdoor heated pool. Inside there's a hot tub and a eucalyptus steam room as well. There are seperate men's and women's saunas in the washrooms as well. There's a fitness area that is "Powered by Reebok" that looks really good. I didn't use it but I would have if I felt more motivated. Haha...I just watched people sweat from the swimming pool. We didn't really eat at the hotel. There's so many great places to eat in Vancouver so we just dined out most of the time because we had our car. We did grab some muffins and juice at a cafe about half a block from the hotel. There's also a corner store where you can buy juice and water, rather than dive into the mini-bar. There's a great restaurant called Lift close by but we didn't go. Great reviews though and just behind the hotel facing the water. Denman is close by as well and we ate there as well as Robson. Overall the place was amazing. I'd definitely go back. I always enjoy Starwood properties. The only problem that I had was on Monday night, the eve of my birthday, a fire alarm started going off when we got home from dinner. This was about 11pm. The alarm was due to a flood. They couldn't shut off the alarm for over an hour. My boyfriend passed out but I couldn't. I even called down and asked what the problem was and told them it was my birthday. I was quite disappointed when I woke up and all we got was an apology letter. I was hoping at least for breakfast buffet or something! Anyways, overall it was a great stay and the fact that we only paid $60/night made it truly amazing. What a steal!!!

Reviews.Title: “Get the upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upgrade your room if you book through the internet - it's worth it. On vacation we'd booked the three nights that were available at the Wedgewood and wanted to extend our Vancouver stay for a fourth night. On the advice of another couple we met, they recommended booking the Westin thru Hotwire by choosing the 4-star hotel that shows up for $80. All things considered, the $80 was a fair value but we quickly spent an addl $30 to upgrade. Our $80 room was 40 feet from the convention center and it felt like we were in a fishbowl with our view being the center's meeting room windows. We wanted nothing more than a place to sleep, but it was the musty smell of the room that actually drove us out. The $110 room (Starwood Preferred) was still a relative bargain for the upgrade since it was fresher and had a nice view of the marina and Vancouver Island. At the same time, the bathroom was the tiniest useable space I've seen in a hotel. It was dimly lit, the door opened to the inside towards the counter (you always had to jockey out of the way and close the door to simply use the sink) and there was no hairdryer?!? Gotta remember you're there to save money, right? (just never perceived Westin that way before) Hey, it was relatively cheap and we only wanted to stay one night so we recommend it. The desk staff and bell staff were very understanding and helpful, but in no way could we have done it for an extended stay. Potentially a decent value depending what you need it for.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Beaverton
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. Just a stone throw away from Stanley Park. Has all the facilities you can imagine. A nice indoor pool, hot tub, sauna and steam room. A well equipped gym and a huge outdoor heated pool adds to the wow factor. The location provides endless awesome views. The marinas and the seaplanes give this hotel such an incredible buzz. Parking at the hotel is $18 for self park and $18.50 for valet parking. The garage is in another building but you can easily find on street parking for free. You just have to move your vehicle to another spot by 11am the next day if you arrive at night. The room is again standard Westin quality. A heavenly bed, heavenly robes and heavenly shower completes the package. This is going to be our hotel of choice the next time we visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire Deal at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, we enjoyed our stay at the Westin in Vancouver. But, I was a bit disappointed by the fact that we had made our arrangements through the travel bidding site Hotwire. A few people on this site recommended calling a week ahead of time and asking for a Tower Room. I called a week ahead, the young lady was very friendly and stated that she would "make a note in my booking." When I arrived, the check in clerk said I could get the tower room, but it would be $30 CDN more per night. What do you do at this point, say nah, I will just stick with my $100 USD broom closet room. No, you pay the $30 and smile. The room was fine, comfortable, with a view. But the extra charge in my opinion is a scam, and one that the Westin is happily perpetuating.

Reviews.Title: “On the water, peaceful, and convenient to food/shops”
Reviews.Author: seatraveler6
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay near the water, to see the harbor from my room, to be very comfortable, and to be close to restaurants. I originally wanted to stay at the Pan Pacific ,but changed my mind after reading about the construction going on near Canada Place. So I picked the Westin. It was a good choice. We got a Marina view room on the 7th floor (Starwood Preferred floor, I was told) in the Tower bldg. I booked using the Entertainment Card and got the deluxe room for approx. $265 CAD. It was quiet and comfortable. I really liked the heavenly bed and shower. We could open up the sliding doors and look out at the Marina and Stanley Park in the distance. I even made a seagull friend out on the balcony. My favorite restaurant was an easy 5 block walk from the hotel. This was Hon's Wun Tun House. Wonderful noodles, wun tun, bbq ribs, and other Cantonese food. Shops, drug store and great Natural Foods store also nearby. The Natural foods store has a wonderful bakery! It reminds me of Whole Foods. Vancouver was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: F1ona
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bayshore was an excellent hotel all round. We spent 3 days there in July. It is a great base while exploring downtown Vancouver. It is set on the waterfront, in a good area, within walking distance of Stanley Park and reasonable walking distance of Downtown attractions. The view from our window over the harbour looking across to North Vancouver was just great. The reception staff were very accommodating, we arrived in the morning and were fortunate to be allocated our room early, which made a great difference to us (and our 2 children) after an 8 hour flight. We thoroughly enjoyed the great Canadian breakfasts in the lovely dining room, the indoor pool, the outdoor pool and all the extra touches which make this a very special hotel. Can't wait to go back! After this hotel, no other hotel on our holiday compared, you get what you pay for and it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “The Best.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Fabulous setting. Excellent staff, with only occasional exceptions.

Reviews.Title: “very rude staff”
Reviews.Author: aaronr
Reviews.Content: I just returned home this morning and wanted to add my two cents about this property. For starters, this hotel has the rudest, least accomodating staff I have ever seen (and I travel extensively). The hotel was full when I checked in and I was not able to get into my room until 6:00pm local time. I had been traveling for over 10 hours and needed to clean up before a 6:30 meeting. I tried to get a temporary room to shower and change in, but they had nothing for me. I had to go to the public restroom at the hotel to clean up and put a suit on. Once I got my room it had a view of the roof construction (they started banging at about 7:45 A.M) My room was nothing special- My advice; try the pan pacific or fairmont down the street, they are the same price range and much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Westin Bayshore”
Reviews.Author: Jean-RWeymouth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 days prior to a Princess cruise in July. The location was wonderful, near Stanley Park and right on the water. We stayed in a balcony room with a city view. The only view we had was of workmen on a roof. This room should not be sold as a room with a view. The room was clean and the bed had a great Heavenly mattress. For the money I felt that the room was somewhat small in comparison to other Westin properties we have stayed at recently. We ate breakfast in the restaurant and it was very enjoyable. We went for a late dinner at the smaller on sight restaurant and were ignored by our waiter. Interesting because the place was almost empty. The concierge was wonderful. She arranged a number of tours for us and they were all wonderful. I have to agree with other reviewers that being away from the busy downtown area is nice. Would we stay here again? Yes, specifically for the location. We also ate at a wonderful restaurant next door....Cadeiro's. It was relaxed, reasonably priced with a nice menu.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RetroK
Reviews.Content: Booked it on Hotwire for CDN100/night for Memorial Day weekend. Got a room in the Towers wing. Highly recommend requesting a room in the Towers. Very clean hotel, nice room, king size bed, balcony overlooking the Marina and the hills. Decent bathroom, Starbucks coffee in room, the Heavenly Bed. Just a great experience. Nice breakfast buffet, though we just walked to the Bojangles Cafe about a block along the water. Parking was expensive, so we parked on the street at night. The street parking is actually closer than the hotel underground parking, and it is free till 9am. Great hotel location. Denman street is where all the nice restaurants are located, and Robson is for shopping. The only thing bad is there is no free Wi-Fi, even in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Most enjoyable Hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: gasman
Reviews.Content: This was the overall most enjoyable hotel I have ever stayed in, and I've stayed in probably 200 or so in every part of the world, some of which were quite literally fit for roylaty. Rooms bright & airy, value for money excellent, location superb, amenities superb. I particularly liked the ability to specify when you wanted your room serviced each day. I would have absolutely no hesitation in staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Raath_ki_Rani
Reviews.Content: Oh that bed, that bed!!! It was a little slice of heaven! ;) The service was great. We started off in a small room that smelled of smoke actually, but called down to the front desk and got moved for $30 more to a room that was enormous with a balcony and gorgeous view of the marina. Spacious room, lusciously decadent beds, nice bathroom, lovely service, good location (close to Robson and Denman with lots of good shopping and great sushi). All in all, a pretty wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: SummerA
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights while working in Vancouver and I did not want to leave. I had a corner room in the Tower. It seems like a bit of a walk to get to the Tower from the lobby but the view was worth it. Gorgeous view of the mountains and the marina. The sea planes land in the harbor near by which is a very neat thing to watch in the mornings. The room was a nice size and the beds were great. Bathrobes were provided which is always a nice touch. Spent a lot of time in the Lobby Bar / Restaurant and the service there was always very good and the staff were very friendly. I also found the front desk, concierge, and valet staff to be very friendly and helpful. They went above and beyond on a couple of occassions. The only thing that keeps me from rating this hotel as Excellent is the difficulties that I had with the hotel provided wireless internet access. I was unable to use their wireless-equipment to access the internet from my room. Their tech support tried to get it to work, couldn't, said they would come back the next day, but never returned. So, I was stuck going down to the lobby to check my company email. I was too lazy to pursue this with the management so I don't know what they would have done to resolve it. But, all in all, a lovely hotel and I would definitely stay again and recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Overated Hotel, Not a Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Due to the great reviews, I decided to stay at this hotel. Exceptional location on the water but too far away from the rest of downtown Vancouver. Very poor service at reception and restaurants. Bedrooms were old and tired. Bathroom was appalling and in need of renovation. Not sure why this property is called a resort? No spa, no tennis courts, organized activities or outdoor recreation. They have a marina and are next door to Stanley Park but that's about it. Very dissapointing considering the price. Will not return to this hotel or reccommend to anyone.
